review: Sorry I have to do this, Red Robin. I've been a pretty consistent fan of this restaurant for the last three years for its cheap prices and friendly staff. The food has always been okay; no complaints there. Not too long ago, the staff was very attentive and bottomless fries still existed! Now, good luck tracking down your server for napkins or a refill on those "bottomless" fries and root beer floats you paid for.  I appreciate the efforts our server made today to at least acknowledge our presence after 10 minutes of being seated, but the fact that it took him 20 minutes since we were seated to actually put in our order shows how understaffed this restaurant is. Our server was running around to so many other tables I couldn't even keep track. I don't blame him, but I do hope that this restaurant gets him some more help and other employees on the floor. Additional stars given for Daphne, Tiffany and Steven. I've never seen such enthusiastic workers and despite the wait time that comes frequently when dining here, I've always enjoyed their service and appreciate their hard work. Hope to see some improvements and some new staff members to help out!

I've been to a few Red Robin locations in the past. I'm going to have to say this again: "Red Robbiiiiinnnn....yuuuuum." S/O and I were looking for something to eat before we head into REI. Came around 2:30 and the place wasn't packed. We had to wait about 10 min to get seated. We waited another 10 minutes for someone to take our order.  Our waitress was really nice though, so that's a plus. S/O ordered the Burnin' Love Burger with onion rings. He finished his meal quick so it's safe to say that he likes it. I ordered the chicken burger with garlic fries. I liked the garlic fries more than my burger, so that says something. Each table has it's own mini tablet where you are able to order games and pay for your meal with a card. It's easy peasy to use if you will. Otherwise, bring enough cash + tip so you can walk out quick. Not a big fan of Red Robin but it sure fills you up quick.

Solid 2.5 stars - went here for ma's b-day because she loves the bottomless fries, though overall nothing really stood out too much. At over $11 for a burger, even though they are 1/2 pound burgers, I expected a bit more. We got the chips and guac appetizer, which didn't really feature that many chips or that much salsa/guac, and it took a while to get more fries and pay, despite the digital menu device blinking. Overall, I feel like Red Robin has potential, but there would need to be an improvement in quantity of food and service that would make me more inclined to visit more often.

I don't even know how this place remains opens. The staff seemed more concerned with socializing with the cooks than serving the customers. We were seated at 835pm. Had to click ask for server on their touch screen at 845. At 850 she came and said sorry. Ordered and since we were starving, we asked if we could have our fries first. It's 905 and we still have not had any food delivered to our table especially the fries that we asked for first. When our food was finally brought to us, we were given no utensils, no napkins, no ketchup. Our waitress stated she would bring it right to us and we watched her go take another order to the bar, check on two other tables before she brought us anything.  There were only four other tables in the restaurant at the time we were there. Onto the food. Our fries were cold and the burgers were soggy from too much sauce. It wasn't the burgers I was used to eating at Red Robin years ago. I've never been so disappointed in a burger ever. This was worst than a Carl's Jr. burger.  Sure enough she never checked back in on us. We paid on the little kiosk they have at the table which takes away the whole food "service" aspect of working in a restaurant. I guess the up side of being able to pay at the table is we didn't have to flag down the waitress who didn't do anything other than bring our food to us. She did not deserve a tip and Red Robin did not deserve us as patrons. One star is more than what this place deserves. Last but not least, I checked my email receipt and was charged 1.99 for entertainment center which we did no use for any sort of entertainment other than paying. This place is a scam.

This place can be a hit or miss, and Saturday's dinner was definitely a MISS. We got there around 4:45, so I wasn't expecting service to be slow. Took about 10 minutes for our server to greet us after being sat. I ordered a simple chicken, lettuces wrap sandwich. Delicious. No problems there. But hubby's food on the other hand, unacceptable. He ordered a bacon cheeseburger from the gourmet section, and that's where things went very wrong. His patty was BURNt!! Wtf. Shame on you cooks for having the balls to serve it. Then they had the brilliant idea to have the burned part of the patty turned over because you know, we wouldn't be able to taste the burnt-ness that way.  We let our server know right away (which took another 3 minutes or so because I flagged her down), and she swapped it out for us.  Will we be back? Probably. Only because we live close by.

We were seated right away. The server was very friendly and extremely attentive. His name was Elliot. My friend enjoys coming to this particular Red Robin because it was the place of her first date  with her boyfriend. She recommended the pretzel bites because of the beer cheese it comes with. She was right, it was delicious! We ordered the bbq chicken wrap to share and they were accommodating because one of us wanted chicken and one of us didn't. We added avocado and this also was delicious! I did notice other tables were having difficulty with their orders being brought out. One table offered to pay $5 for their drink and wanted to cancel their order because of the long wait. Either my friend and I were not aware of the long wait or our server was just on top it! I had a pleasant experience and will probably come back.
Under staffed. I was told our server "John" would be with us shortly, our server was some chick. Not John. Weird. Silverware had a booger lookin thing on it. Bleh

Burgers are usually pretty good. The rest of it, not impressed. Arrived around 11:15 to an empty restaurant and a 15 minute wait. Not a good start. Was starving, so ordered quickly, and added a salad so we could have something to munch on while we waited. That was a waste, as it showed up with the rest of our meal. Couldn't get our waiter's attention to save my life. Good luck getting bottomless fries. Asked for medium well burger, it was raw.  I understand s*#! happens, but this has been the experience I've had for at least the past few visits and I'm over it. Didn't bother mentioning anything to the manager because I did during my last visit and he was defensive, rude and dismissive. There are way too many restaurants around here to bother with this one, spend your money elsewhere.

Phenomenal service from our waitress Tiffany, if she hasn't been given a raise yet, she definitely deserves it. Came with two of my friends around 7:30-8:00, hoping for a good bite. We ordered two appetizers being the onion rings and the chips and dip. Both came out fairly quick and was super satisfying. About my meal, I had the french onion soup as well as the Garden Burger (got the veggie patty but you can opt out for the vegan boca). Can't say I remember the prices of my meal but it was phenomenal. The French onion was super creamy with the amounts of melted cheese that was on top and the veggie burger tasted healthier than I expected. Woo-hoo! I also ended up signing up for the Red Robin's rewards system which seemed to have great perks as you build up your criteria. Plus a free burger on your birthday month! Overall, super satisfied with the restaurant's hospitality, the steamin' food and the open environment to just enjoy a meal with friends. Second time at this location and both 5/5 stars, great job guys!

This is a busy location, but we were seated fairly promptly and received excellent service. Although it was a little noisy, the food was excellent. I ordered a Blue Ribbon Burger which was prepared exactly to my specifications. My three companions and I shared a guacamole, salsa and chips appetizer and the waiter brought us additional tortilla chips quite promptly. My companions seemed quite pleased with their meals (Salmon Caesar Wrap, Whiskey BBQ Burger and Mac-n-Cheese + a cup of Red's fabulous French Onion Soup). I was pleased and surprised with the efficiency of the kitchen and the quality of the service we received which enabled us to get to the theater at West Valley College before curtain time! Bravo!
This has good TVs at the bat. Bottomless fries are a bargain. Kids love the red balloons. Parking is pretty painless. The waiting area is a mess and small....wish bigger....especially on game days.

Went for lunch today and it wasn't busy at first. Our server was attentive (sorry I didn't even catch her name). My simple sandwich that I asked for plain and dry had mayonnaise on part of the bun. Sigh. Also, unlimited fries?? Not that I needed them but was never asked if we wanted to more. Will still go back but get the feeling that the attention to detail is slipping...

Came here for lunch today. The service was stellar. Our waiter, I forgot his name, was very attentive and patient with us and always asked if we needed anything. My review is missing a star because the food quality has went down over the years. That and it was a little dirty inside. But other than that the food was still delicious and service was excellent. I would only return if I am in the area.

For a self professed gourmet burger joint with unlimited fries, this visit failed on both counts.  The first two angus burgers ordered medium rare arrived well done with a very small number of cold fries on the side.  While we waited for a redo on the burgers another order of fries arrived cold and dry again.  Second burgers were better but closer to medium and edges were crispy singed.  The final fries attempt came very hot but the potato centers were not meaty and flaky but weirdly creamy.   Dessert guys?  No thanks!

Last two times about 8/17 and 9/17 ish- the service and food was much improved.  I let the manager know we were happy personally.  Will be back - kids love this place so keep the parents happy because we pay the bill.

To be honest it seems like this place is in need of more staff.  Because it was nearly impossible to get a refill on drinks. They provide you with these tablets for request Service and paying ect. But when you ask for service all it does is flash... like if they can't see me waving my damn hands how will they see the little red light. Other than the disappointing service the food was ok.  They got my order wrong,  also the fries where a bit cold. Not to happy with this location

I ate the Red Robin classic hamburger and my friends ordered onion rings stack appetizer. I'm allergic to the onion rings bread crumb exterior or the oil they used! Unfortunately, I didn't notice until I left the place and went to another place. This shows that their oil used is not good for us because I am sensitive to the oil restaurants use in their food. I am definitely able to eat onion rings at different restaurants. The waiter thought my friend, her brother, and I were trying to save $ and gave us the onion rings for free. Great service and we tipped him 20-25%. Great waiter. Sadly, I won't return for another while.  ---------------------------------------- First time here! The red robin classic hamburger was great! The bottomless fries were worth it, hot and steaming! I'd come back here again and recommend this place to others. I'm thankful my friends introduced me to red robin's!

I'm giving this a 1 star review because I can't give it a no star review. The food was good as always, but the service was dreadful l. We had been sitting for 40 minutes and our waitress hadn't even introduced herself. They said they were busy but there was only 2 other full tables in our section. This is pretty much the worst service I've had. Waiters were on their phones, walking slowly and joking around with their employees. We were about two minutes away from walking out when we finally received our food. I like this restaurant, please get better employees though. I'm a big tipper normally but no part of this service warrants a tip.

Haven't been to a Red Robins in a long time and for no particular reason! So I came here with my wife after shopping at Westgate and burgers sounded like a good idea! So we get there and I ordered The A-1 burger, pink and with an extra patty!  It's must of been an off day from when the other reviews went because my burger was close to perfect.It was juicy, full of flavor, had that char flavor note, and was extremely filling...of course the bottomless fries helped but I only had one serving as the burger was more than enough!  A solid 4 stars as a 4.5 may have been given had my burger been more on the pink side and less on the well side although the cook managed to serve up a juicy burger. Like I said, we must have hit the burger lottery because our burgers were spot on and the service from our server was second to none! And just an FYI my review comes of a comparison to the many burger spots I've been to. Being a former Marine I've had many a burger from different parts of the U.S. ----Almost forgot, you have to try the pretzel bits with the beer-cheese! The pretzels are light and fluffy not dense like you think a pretzel would be and the cheese sauce is nice as you can taste the hint of cervesa!! I WILL BE BACK!!!
Hair in food, thanks Red Robin.  Not a very good Birthday dinner for my son. Not What you would expect from a $14.00 burger.

Red Robin isn't my go-to place to eat, but the boo and I decided to dine in last week. We were greeted and seated promptly. I usually experience long wait times here, so we already decided if there was a wait, then we would leave. We ordered the blue cheese burger with fries and the veggie burger with garlic fries. Both were good and reasonably priced, but nothing amazing. The garlic fries didn't come out until my bf was pretty much done with his burger, but they ended up giving us 2 baskets. Our server was attentive and apologized for the wait time on the fries. I do think their $6.99 burger with fries is a good deal. Just A-ok for me.

My fiancé and I went in for lunch the other day within fifteen minutes of them opening. We both ordered pretty basic stuff. She got a tavern burger with cheddar cheese. I got a blue ribbon burger on a regular bun and an ice tea.  The server says no problem it will be out shortly. No mind you I used to work for these guys in Alaska and when my uncle owned it it was a really great place and we were busy from open to close. This location maybe had 20 people in for lunch at best with in the first half hour. From the time we ordered to the time we were served, it took at least twenty minutes to see our server who told me the ice tea machine was having issues, it would be a few more minutes to get some tea. When she brought it to me it was like dirty water and had little to no tea flavor. But said it would get me started. I was not impressed.  Then our burgers came, the fries were ice cold and the burgers were like warm. Furthermore if you go into a place and they ask you for temp on a burger (some pink or no pink as the ask) than if you ask for some pink you should get what you order especially when the place is not busy. But instead my burger was cooked all the way through. A server there that we know got us one of the managers. They said they could remake. But we figured it took 30 minutes to get in the first place we were not going to wait another 30 minutes. Let alone pay for food we didn't order.  I mean how hard is it when you first open to not have the right food and drink ready and waiting. Is it a lack of training, lack of standards or a pure lack of leadership. That's why you have regs and checklists. If someone is running late it can mess up the whole team. Maybe schedule your crew fifteen minutes earlier to make sure things are done right. The manager gave us coupons for two apps, is that really a good standard. Besides taking care of our food for that day, he should have taken the time to get our names and take down our concern.  He invited us back but didn't give us his card. A little unpersonal if you ask me. Not a good lasting impression. 11/28/17 Went back today to give them a second chance. Huge mistake! I am not certain where the lack of training is coming from or even the pride of ownership of ones duties. But even after telling the server exactly how we wanted our meals, there was some type of breakdown either from the Manager who was in the kitchen actually cooking our burgers or the server who put in the ticket. They were not very busy so there should not have been any mistakes. My fiancé ordered a tavern burger with cheddar cheese and no sauce. Yet the burger came to us with American cheese and sauce all over the bottom bun. Her second burger can back with the bun soaked in grease, one patty that was charded to hell and back and a top bun that was all ripped up. Obviously they pitched the bottom bun and patty and did them over, scrapped the cheese off the top patty and just recheesed it. Then tried to heat the bun up on the flat top. What a fucking joke!! Plus the fries they sent out weren't even hot, and looked like ones left over from an earlier batch that had been sitting a while.  I got the Royal Red burger. The nice picture shows it with a sunny side up nice looking egg. What I got was a broken yolk chard flat egg with burn bottom and edges. Plus if a server asks you if you want some pink to the patty, you would expect some pink. Not the hockey puck that I got. I sent it back and still got a well done patty but the egg was sunny side up with a burnt bottom and edges. Which is a true indicator the cook did the egg in a hurry over high heat. I did not have the time or fortitude to wait a third time and told the server to just remove it. And I got my meal with a side salad instead of fries, but could only eat part of it because the lettuce was rusted and the green leaf was wilted. Two things you never want to see I. Your salad greens.  We got up from our table and asked to see the manager. We waited up front far too long and walked out. "Larry" the manager said he made our food but he was confused. Not what I would want to hear from a person who is supposed to be in charge. Told us to come back sometime for a burger on him. But not sure that's a risk I want to take again.

A wise man once said, "Are you ready to order, sir?" to which I replied, "Only if you're on the menu."   That wise man was our server for the night, David.  Thanks to David, I enjoyed both a five star dinner and an enchanting evening. (The only reason I didn't give a full five stars is because the fries weren't the only thing bottomless)
My first time at Red Robin! Burgers were yummy and bottomless  fries are not bad at all! Had a Cobb salad that was quite good as well. Service was really good!

location: Central San Jose, San Jose, CA
review: We went on a Wednesday and it was crazy busy. That meant trying to get the attention of our waiter was rather difficult. But he was very nice to help us split our check 6 ways and give individual change.  I had the banzai burger and wow it was banzai. The bun was nice and thick and toasted well. The patty was juicy and well done. The pineapple wasn't I believe grilled, but it was warm and its flavor melded with the burger perfectly. I had heard the fries were super good, but I was a little let down by how dry it was--granted I didn't have ketchup.  All in all, I would come here again, but maybe not on such a busy night.

This place is alright. We went at lunch time and it was quiet and we were seated at a nice booth. The server was pretty good. Our menus were sticky (that drives me nuts). My Southwest Sombrero salad was just okay - it had at least three large pieces of lettuce core in it, and I didn't realize until after we left that the fried jalapeño coins were missing. We had fried zucchini and fried mushrooms (so I really didn't need the fried jalapeños), which were really good. My friend had the Cobb Salad and she said it was okay. Nothing blows me away about this place. But it's in a good location with a ton of parking.

We went at 11:20 on a Saturday to beat the rush. Very disappointed in the service. The person who seated us took her sweet time (and it was not busy) and our server acted like he was being bothered. He was even sarcastic when I asked him a question about the menu. Food - good - not great. I can't imagine what it would be like in here when busy.

We were going to Smash burger for lunch a week ago Sunday, at last minute hubby saw the sign of Red Robin and changed his mind. He was so sorry that he did. The place was  2/3 full and we were seated promptly, our waiter was courteous, so far so good. We ordered a gourmet burger for him and a grilled chicken sandwich for me.  Then we waited easily 30 minutes to get the chicken sandwich first, then the burger came with a small fry, the beef patty was completely over done even though he asked for medium. The chicken sandwich was decent but the broccoli didn't show up until we were almost done. We were never offered refill for the sides. Our waiter agreed that the burger was way overcooked definitely not 'medium' as ordered; his response was that we mention it in the survey when paying our bill using the machine on the table. The bill for two sandwiches with just ice water before tip was almost $30... totally not worth it.

Ring ring ring. Tv tv tv. Buzz buzz. Table is ready. Loud loud loud. Action action action. Look over there. Now over here. Something to drink?  Bang bang crash. Can I take your order?  Boxing on that screen over there. Informercial on this tv. Kids playing games on $1.99 screen at the table. Too loud to talk. So much going on.  I always like my burger at this and other Red Robins, but it is never a calm or relaxing experience. Lots going on.

I have been to this establishment a handful of times and have not had a problem. Today, I had the misfortune of meeting their bartender, Eric.I waved him down and he made clear eye contact with me. I was sitting less than 5 feet away from him. There is no doubt in that he saw me.  The second time I approached him, I greeted him politely (even asked him how his day was going) to try to reset the situation... and he still acted as though I horribly offended him. He was short with his reply and refused to stop to even take my order. Red Robin, I would highly recommend training your front of house staff on proper etiquette with customers.  I did not stay. I will not be coming back, nor will I recommend coming here.

It's a busy Monday at work, didn't have much time for a lunch so I ordered online. Went to pick up my food and everything was fine. Until I noticed my order is incorrect, called them right away and was told I would need to speak to a manager. No problem, spoke to Samantha and man does she have great customer service. This woman really knows how to take care of her customers. Thank you for helping me with my order situation! You deserve to get recognized for your work ethic! Hey Red Robin you have a great employee and she deserves a raise for it!!!

Red Robbin is Red Robbin.  Hamburgers and fries.  Some drinks.  And TVs. Went here for lunch before watching a movie near by. Wife got their gluten free bun burger.  I had some.  The bun was horrible.  This location really needs to find a different supplier for the GF buns.  If you have a gluten intolerance, just get the hamburger without bun.  Plus you save a couple of bucks. BBQ hamburger was good.  Never got a second of fries.  Can't understand why.  Server said the order had to be put in?!?  This is a place that is know for having unlimited fries.  So why does server need to put "in" the order?? The fry guy should be cooking fries non-stop during lunch time.  This I know, because my family had a hamburger restaurant at one time.

When you were a kid (assuming you aren't any longer), did you ever have such a dreadful experience at a restaurant that you promised yourself you wouldn't eat there again? To me, that experience was at Red Robin Gourmet Burgers. When I was in middle school (or was it high school??), I had eaten at the Red Robin near my house for the very first time; I really didn't like their burgers one bit and decided I would never visit a Red Robin ever again. The only positive thing out of that experience was that they had decent fries.  Fast forward about 10 years and I've kept up my promise to avoid Red Robin. But that all changed when I decided to give it another try since my girlfriend got a free deal through their birthday rewards (basically if it's your birthday month, you can get any free burger from "gourmet burger" section). We ended up going to the one in San Jose. The Red Robin Gourmet Burgers that we went to was on El Paseo de Saratoga within the Westgate shopping plaza. Since it's a huge mall, there should always be plenty of parking. Getting here is also very easy because the plaza is nearby major streets (like San Tomas Expressway and Saratoga). I recommend coming slightly before you get hungry because wait times can be long. Even though it was a Monday night around 630pm, we had to wait approximately 15 minutes before getting in. And it would also take us around 20 minutes to actually get our food.  If you have never been to Red Robin Gourmet Burgers before, this restaurant is another one of those big burger chains that you see on T.V. and everywhere you go. As the name suggests, this restaurant specializes in fat, juicy burgers with a variety of different ingredients. Their burgers are split between the classic gourmet burgers (like the guac bacon and the original), and their finest burgers (fancier burgers with ingredients like arugula). In terms of pricing, Red Robin is a bit more expensive than most burger chains for what you get (more on that later), but one reason why people keep coming is because of their unlimited steak fries (they come with each meal and you can substitute for other type of fries for more $$). I ended up getting the Burnin' Love and my girlfriend got the Guacamole Bacon. -Burnin' Love (6/10). First off, I give props to Red Robin for actually putting some spice in this burger. Usually, most restaurants are flaky with their "spicy" burgers, but this one packed some heat. I love the idea of frying the jalapenos and placing one right on top of the burger. However, the burger falls really short: The patty was super small and not that juicy. It looked and tasted more like a charbroiled diner style burger (something you see at In n Out), which was disappointing as it should have been bigger. Plus, they don't have a medium rare option! And furthermore, the lettuce was very, very meh. They used sliced lettuce which probably came from a giant pack. Why not use a large slice of iceberg lettuce? I mean you clearly have some if it's on your wedgie burger picture? But all in all, this wasn't a "bad" burger per say. I feel like it didn't meet my low expectations.  -Guac Bacon (7/10). Though the Guac Bacon burger has the same shortcomings as the above, at least they had a very large helping of guac to make up for the meh patty. I love the bacon in there, even though it wasn't crispy. All in all, I probably would've gotten this one instead. Or maybe the swiss mushroom..  -Steak Fries (9/10). To be honest, I'd probably come to Red Robin just for their steak fries. They are HUGE, super crispy, and warm. I recommend getting a refill/second batch because those are much hotter and crispier. That's because when you get your burger, the fries have been sitting since it takes longer to make a burger than fries. Thus, get the second batch!! All in all, I have to rate the food quality at Red Robin 3 stars at best. It was probably just as I'd remembered it as a kid. HOWEVER, the biggest redeeming factor of this place was the hella good service. First off, the waitress/waiter who were both serving us were super kind; they kept asking if everything was okay. They also processed our checks very fast. And second, the boss was SO HELPFUL for getting my phone out of the little crevice in the bench where I dropped it in. I was a bit distressed since I always do this to myself, but he was very kid to me. He jokingly asked for a $100 tip, and if I had that money, maybe I would. So for that, I end up giving Red Robin a "nice-su, you can take your parents here and they'll be happy." TBH my parents would probably be okay with this since they love good service. But if you want the creme de la creme of burgers, this Red Robin (or any for that matter) is not for you. Eat well and prosper,

Came here after my best friend's wedding! I had a bad experience at a different Red Robin location but since the bride and groom wanted Red Robin, I decided to give it another shot. BAD IDEA!! Apps never came out, asked if we could swap some side for fries was told there was an additional charge (no problem) but when the food came, NO FRIES! I sure got charged for them though. The kids plates (which did have fries) were COLD!! I mean COLD COLD!! really?? My burger was dry and overcooked. I had to go and find the waiter to get refills & ask to not be charged for the appetizers since we never received them!! I would have spoken to the manager about these issues but as I stated I was the driver and had the bride and groom with me who had to go get ready for their reception!! NEVER AGAIN RED ROBIN!! $100+ for bad service and worse food!!

It's sad that I have to write a negative review I really wanted to try this place but it was just beyond unreasonable. It's Friday night and not busy at all. I'm here with my family and the two hosts at the front tell us that we can be seated but it will be an hours for us to get any food because their kitchen is behind. I've never encountered this before I would understand if it was busy but the place wasn't. I suggest that they have better cooks or flow of this restaurant never coming here again and I've never even tried it.

I was craving Red Robin so I made the trek out to West San Jose on my day off. The experience was terrible and I won't be going back anytime soon. What used to be a consistent, reliable chain restaurant is now just a mess. First, I was seated at a table with a menu that was missing pages and it was the pages with all of the hamburgers on it. The place was busy and our waitress was slammed, even at 1:45pm on a Tuesday afternoon. When our food finally arrived, it was terrible. The fries were cold and limp. I got the Southern Charm burger that was barely warm and had no flavor. I couldn't taste the bbq sauce or onions on it. There was no ketchup on the table and the waitress didn't come around for another 7 minutes to get more ketchup, take an order for more fries and refill our beverages. It took another 10 minutes for our fries to arrive despite the waitress claiming that all of the "fryers have been fired." The interior was not very clean and seemed very worn. It was super noisy even though the restaurant was half empty. Thank goodness our server was a rockstar and hustled. She was the only part of this situation that worked. Everything else was awful. I definitely won't be coming back to this location anytime soon.

Last night we received the worst service/meal ever. I have been to this location a few times in the last year and it keeps going further downhill but I thought one more shot. Well that's it.  - Food took over an hour to come out - once we received food, French fries instead of broccoli was on everyone's plate.  - when broccoli came out it was smaller serving than when you get a refill.  - at that point I asked to speak to manager & she came over. I wasn't looking for a free meal when I came in but I just couldn't take it anymore. After she comped our meal she asked if she could get us anything else. Asked for more broccoli.  - When broccoli arrived I proceeded to eat it & there was a staple in the broccoli.  I don't know ‍ where it came from or how it got there, luckily it didn't cut my gums or anything. I called the manager over again and I told her. I'm just glad the little boy with us didn't eat that piece of broccoli.  Never again. Don't go here - if you do, you've been warned.

Worst place ... been here a few times but everytime they sucessfully mess up the order . Am a vegetarian and so is my family . Today was the last straw .. we ordered 3 vegetarian burgers (means vege pattie nd no meat ) aparently this restaurant doesnt knw wat tat means . They gave my son a beef patty .. nd i got mine with bacon strips !!  Seriously ??? BACON ??? I gave up .. 2 out of jus 3 ????  Either they have very very bad sevice or they jus dont care ! I dont knw ... but will never set foot in this restaurant ever !!!

I'm sitting here waiting for my burger (it's been about half an hour and I'm hungry) but as I've been here many times before I feel like I can write an honest, although hunger-motivated review.  Started dinner off today by missing our name being called, apparently they "yelled it three times" but somehow my late-twenties ears missed these clear and well-enunciated calls. The part that got to me wasn't that they didn't make an effort to find us but that there was absolutely no apology- or anything remotely resembling an apology in response. Once we were re-added to the list, we were brought in fairly quickly. We immediately met our server, Ryan, who has so far been SUPER nice, getting us multiple drink refills and checking in on us frequently. The food here is mediocre, complex flavors and seasoning being replaced by cheese and bacon. The cocktails and alcohol-containing milkshakes contain very little alcohol and a lot of sugar.  So why, you ask, would I choose to come here rather than any of the gourmet burger options offered in the Bay Area? I have a very good reason: the steak fries and freckled lemonade. For someone who mocks the addition of sugar in all of our food, I cannot stop myself from ordering a freckled lemonade. Sometimes (today) they add less sugar and it is slightly sour and delicious. Other times it is diabetes in a cup, but every single time it is exactly what I want. They make it with vodka too but I haven't tried it; why mess with perfection?  Now the steak fries: I'm pretty sure they contain recreational drugs as a seasoning (can I say crack on yelp?) Every few months I CRAVE these amazing bits of salty goodness smothered in ranch dressing (I clearly have a very refined palate) and these fries are the actual reason I will ALWAYS come back to Red Robin.  So if you're looking for a gourmet burger, go somewhere else. But if you're looking for a mediocre meal with the best fries and freckled lemonade ever, come stand in line for a half hour, wait for your food for another 45 minutes, and enjoy!

Ok but why are Red Robin burgers sooooo.. squishy? Other than that, I enjoy this place. I compare it to Johnny Rockets, Peggy Sue's, etc. An American themed restaurant w/ classics such as burgers, grilled cheese, etc. The unlimited fries really get me because fries are my favorite food. Sometimes on my lunch break I just order fries, 2.16$ I would come back for Ryan & Cassie in a heartbeat. They're amazing employees, working quickly and diligently.

This place seems to always be understaffed.  My dad and I waited 15 minutes to be seated because they didn't want to seat anyone at the tables, seemed like they only wanted to use the booths that cover around the restaurant but there are only like 15-20 booths.  Our server couldn't hear my order so I basically had to yell my order at her which was a little odd.  We ordered the O-ring shorty which is the shorter version of their onion ring tower.  It was literally $5 for 5 small onion rings, what. a. ripoff.  Definitely not ordering that again.  The burgers were just average as usual.  I am definitely reconsidering visiting them again considering the prices and the service were not really up to par.

Popped in with the kids for burgers and Mac n cheese. Our server, Ryan, was on it and our food was delicious and came out quickly. No complaints. We left feeling like we got more than we paid for after all the free drink and kids meal re-fills!

We have been here a few times and usually there is something off! I am always excited about the consistency in the food and drink (although a little pricey for what you get).  The waiters and waitresses are noticeably interested in getting you in and out and the whole business is about that and not aiming for you to be pleased with your experience.  We also just went and were seated underneath an A/C unit. I went to go get reseated and the hostess said there is nothing she can do because there were no tables open. This was not true at all as there were 20 open tables at least! Instead of saying, let me see about that and I am sorry, she was curt and not helpful. When we left, the hostesses who were not busy at all, did not say thanks for coming. Isn't that their job?  I would pick another restaurant to go to in the area. Try veggie grill!

so I was eating there yesterday after watching a movie so I stopped by. it was not a good day. So I had soup and side salad. the salad was great oh yeah I was in the dark because there was no lamp. I witness other people who were sit in the dark. when they told the hostess they was to  it was an issue. The ice cream that I had was a melted version and the soup was so so. wow .

So the good....If you want to indulge in some bad food...The bottomless fries are great. It is also a good place for kids as the kids menu is pretty good. The service is slow....More fries please!! The burgers are average, certainly not gourmet.  However, this is a chain so temper experience rations.  Better than regular fast food, but nothing to knock your socks off.

The bar at Red Robins is not a recommended area if you're looking for good service... Host informed us if we didn't want to wait, there were seats at the bar. However, it took SO long to get our order in, to receive our food, and our waiter never came back to refill our waters. But he was nice and came by once to ask if everything was okay so stars for him. But the food was less than decent. My friend got the boneless wings with buzz sauce and I gotta say, they were the smallest pieces of boneless chicken I have ever seen. A couple piece of popcorn chicken constitutes as boneless chicken now huh? My tower of onion rings was fine; it was as good as I remembered it. My other friend ordered the chicken on ciabatta bread. Too much bread compared to chicken. Drinks were pretty good though. All three drinks were nice: TNT, Orange Blitz, and Merry Moscato. Not too strong though, which is how I prefer my drinks, but maybe not to others. Paid via their new electronic machine on the table so it was quite efficient. I've had good experiences here before. I'm sure I'll have it again next time when I'm not sitting at the bar.

I have come to this Red Robin since it opened.  When it opened, the burgers were fresh, hot and juicy.  Service was great, the servers got the order right and had no problem bringing you fries while you waited for your food and chilled with family. For the last 3-4 years the burgers have been cold or over done and it's taken AT LEAST 40 mins to get a burger out of the kitchen. When I ask where our meal is, after 30 mins usually, these are the frequent excuses: 1) sorry, the kitchen is really busy. 2) the fries are still cooking 3) we are really short on fries and you can only have one basket. 4) oh sorry there are empty tables but the wait is 20 mins because we are short servers.  8-10 other people waiting too. 5) oh sorry its taking so long for your server to come over for the first time, we have a few called in sick. 6) many, many issues that are simple with orders being correct...changing to a ciabbata bun, getting regular bun.  extra onions requested, no onions on burger.  No relish/spread requested, it has it on there!  Plain bacon cheese burger ordered, no bacon on burger!   7) sorry we are training a new cook.  The experienced one quit yesterday!  Seriously no one else knows how to cook a silly burger and fries??!! Whoever manages this place really is gonna lose their shirt soon when Steak and Shake opens, already smash burger is open and there are 3 other burger places taking share away from the Red Bird. I like Red Robin.  I really do.  But its time for the eagle to come in and clean house, hire the right management, to train the right staff.  Being under employed when people are looking for work is no excuse.  Get a bigger fryer and anticipate the fry volume better.  Fries sell drinks!  I cant enjoy fries without a drink and you charge $3.25 for a coke.   Figure it out!   Cook fresh burgers and dont let them sit under the warmers!   Its all basic stuff and if it isnt fixed soon, this bird will be extinct!   PS, never, ever, get rid of the baseball american flags!

Disappointed... service was really bad... usually, I love this place but the waiter really dictates the flow of the services... not sure if it could have been a better service if our waiter remembered the sauce for our fries, was more friendly and provided us with our drinks, quicker. On top of that there were no forks or spoons at all... he did not give us any additional fries without asking...

SCOTT is the BEST! Who would think you could get big juicy awesome restaurant quality burgers for LESS than Carl's or Wendy's or Jack? I cant believe their prices are so cheap for high quality burgers and perfect classic french fries!  Their 'To Go" service is great! Have you ever placed an order on the phone or online and you worry about forgetting something? Scott is so thorough and helpful. This was our first time back at Red Robin after many years. He took our phone order, made AWESOME recommendations. I even ended up going online to sign up and get a free burger on my birthday, The burgers were some of the best we have had anywhere!. I am really impressed and we plan to make them part of our dinner rotation that includes Giorgio's and Panda Express.  Red Robin is great food at great prices. I cant imagine ever buying another fast food burger again if there is a Red Robin near by.

Mediocer at best.  Appitizer and drinks served before utensils or napkins.  French onion soup was excellent but much too small a portion for the price.  Gourmet  hambergers were nothing to write home about, particularly for the price.  Overall disappointing

It's been years since I've been to a "Red Robin". I didn't have a lot of time. I sat in the bar for faster service. Once seated, I waited and needed to ask when someone would be taking my order. I asked a bus person and he went to ask. A huge "wow" as only a few minutes after the request, the hostess came by an apologized as the waitress/ waiter for my section had just gone home. A server promptly comes to take my order. She was friendly and appeared very knowledgeable. I did share I was in a hurry now. Four came very quickly as did the check . That is good customer service And the veggie burger with a side of onion rings tasted very good. Also, the restaurant was clean which is always appreciated.

I would say I am a regular customer of the bar area. Eric and Giovanna are awesome and they are the best at the bar!  Sometimes the kitchen takes a long time to get our food out but the vibes are good and we appreciate the great service from Eric and Giovanna and we come back for that.

I've given this chain many chances for reasonable service and food. (Multiple locations among many cities.) Today was another consistent disappointment. I will never return to this franchise again.  There were two people in my party around 1pm and both our burgers were stone cold. It took 40 minutes to get cold burgers and hot fries. The person bringing out the two burgers was adamant that it was to go to an adjacent six-top. Two burgers for six people? How does that work out? My friend was so hungry she just dealt with it, I asked for another to be cooked. It arrived in a reasonable amount of time. It was okay. I certainly don't believe the patties were never frozen as the menu claims. There was no discount and a rough apology. Christina, our server, never asked if my fellow diner was satisfied with her food.   Good luck in your business.
Server was rushing me asked for no lettuce  or tomato  had it on the burger asked for ranch never got it she was  mire helpful to a large group disappointed with the service

We always come back to this place cause the food never disappoints. The service is kinda a hit or miss, but tonight was definitely one of the best experiences yet. Regardless of the service, my family still considers this place to have some of the best burgers around. Our server Jessie, catered to all of our orders and was on top of everything.  Thank you Jessie, for an awesome experience, and good food too!

We went last week, waited 10 minutes​ to get seated (not bad) and about another 10 for a waiter to bring drinks.  10 later a waiter came to take our order and said the kitchen was slow today.  35 minutes later, no food.  We had to leave by 3:00 PM and it was 10 minutes to 3.  Asked if our order was coming in the next 5 minutes.  Waiter came back from the kitchen and said, "No way.  Probably 15." We offered to square up for our two teas and he apologized and told us to get up and walk out...so we did. This location is plauged with a slow kitchen but this was the worst I have seen it.  They really need to hire some staff. Went to John's Xlent Food in Willow Glen and enjoyed a nice Lamb Burger.
The worst service I have experienced. These guys are aversely understaffed. It takes 40 mins for them to get your order.  I have no idea why? The rivermark rr is so much better.

I had made it a habit to get to Red Robin every other month or so because of the nice quality of burgers and this was my local spot.  Unfortunately there were some changes that occurred which dampened the mood on visiting the restaurant. #1 - the Service took a nose dive with wait time after ordering probably doubling from what it had been in the earlier years of the establishment. #2 - the bottomless features changed a bit.  Whatever you ordered came in smaller amounts (wise for the restaurant) so that the time you had to wait (see #1) ultimately meant rarely taking advantage of any bottomless feature #3 - the menu moved away from staples of former years We had some nice visits over the years but they are done as I'd much prefer to visit an establishment like Islands or Five Guys today.  Service is key... too bad they can't deliver on that very well.

Came here with a couple friends to celebrate a late birthday.  Our waiter was nice and the food was fine. The reason for the low rating is that my friend had kindly asked our waiter for a small birthday special since we were celebrating.  After paying the bill on the tablet, the waiter didn't show around to thank us for dining and completely forgot about the birthday special. This sounds pretty bratty, but when you come in to a place to celebrate with friends, you expect the service to follow through.  She could have asked me for an I.D or anything to prove my birthday was a while ago. Pretty upsetting that the service at the end of the meal didn't follow through. Our waiter didn't seem like she appreciate our business.

So we arrived and were told 30 minutes. After we were waiting more people who arrived after us were being sat first. I let it go once, but it happened 3 times. I walked up to the host station and asked why people who arrived after us were being seated, the host said " we sit bigger groups first" The server was good, he was slammed because they were short handed...

Great lunch today.  Daffne our server was really attentive, sweet and professional. It was so refreshing.  Plenty of places to eat these days, but when you have an excellent server, it makes all the difference.  Thank you!

I have usually had great service at Red Robin so I placed a to-go order online for two adult meals and two kids meals, no special requests. After driving around the parking lot for 20 minutes to find parking due to the lack of convenient to-designated parking spots, I arrived 10 minutes later than my confirmation stated the food would be ready. I walked to the to-go lit sign by the bar and was ignored by three servers. Finally, a server asked if I was picking up a to-go order and pointed me back to the hostess. I waited in line again only to be told my order would be another 5-10 minutes. I finally got my order 15 minutes later than I expected and not a single apology. Terrible service.

I usually don't give 1 star reviews, because I think it is really hard to be that bad, but my visit to Red Robin left me feeling very unhappy. First of all, it is clear that the restaurant is pretty understaffed. There was a decently long wait to be seated, despite available booths, and the process of ordering/getting our food/getting refills took a while too. This is not a deal breaker, and i am okay with waiting. The big problem occurred with the food itself. I ordered the Chicken Bruschetta. It looked perfectly fine when it arrived. If it wasn't for the fact that I was sharing with my sister and had to cut it in half, I would not have noticed the fact that the chicken was HALF RAW. This was no little bit of pinkness, it looked as if they completely failed to cook half the chicken. I just don't know how they could have made such a huge mistake.  After discovering this, because service was so slow, it took a while to wave down our server to get this issue fixed. Our waitress was so apologetic--I don't blame her--but honestly I feel like they should have offered to waive our check for this kind of mistake. Instead, they said they would bring me out a new one--they did, but they brought fries instead of onion rings (which I had ordered). I would've let this pass since I felt bad the waitress was so busy, but honestly they were still making me pay the extra so I was going to get my moneys worth. Furthermore, we asked if it was possible to change the channel on the TV. Not a big deal if they wouldn't do it, but the problem was that they said they would and they never did. Not very happy about that either. In the end, the food was decent, and our waitress did try to make things up for us by being more attentive after the incident. However, I personally believe that there shouldn't have been this problem in the first place. Imagine if I hadn't shared with my sister, I would've just eaten the chicken raw...

Drinks - 0/5 - The Pina colada i had was absolute garbage, i can safely say it was one of the worst I've ever had in my life.  Food- 3/5 - I ordered the Southern Charm Burger and the bacon was burnt, still giving it a 3/5 because the onion rings were really good and we really liked the dips they had. And for my friend they brought the wrong order over so we sent it back and it took them over half an hour to get us the correct food. So, Service gets a 2/5 Would not come back here.

Got the California Chicken burger ($11) with Garlic Herb Fries ($0.99) with Campfire sauce and it was so good, I bit myself twice. Well to be fair, I was pretty hungry too. But it was really good! The chicken stood out to me a lot and the upgraded fries was definitely worth. The fries itself is good too! Even better, you get unlimited refills. Though I don't think you'll really need more than one or two refills because the meal was really filling. The refill took a while to get here but the fries came out hot and crispy. Also tried the House Salad ($4) and Bowl of Clam Chowder ($5). They were both alright.
Came here to eat before watching a movie , long story short , waited almost a hour and our food never came , never coming back

Terrible service Seriously I should not be waiting 15 minutes after they sent me down to order my food plus then we almost an half hour to get my food And never come back for refills on drinks!! The worst red Robin there is the manager don't give a shit about anything that's probably why the employees are slacking off! I will never go to this location again!! They make it worse I have my nephew with me!!
It's a Red Robin, people, it's not Morton's.  It's a clean, air conditioned place to get a drink before going to the AMC Saratoga theater across the parking lot.

Let's see..... broken soda machine, 15 empty tables (had time to count while waiting) but still 15 minutes to sit down,  greeter staff seemed annoyed that we interrupted their gossip session and texting to put our name down, only Spanish kids menus available, table top game machine broken, incredible disappearing waitress.  None of it horrible alone, but everything together made for a frustrating visit.  At least the food was good.

Red Robin is usually a pretty solid go-to place for medium speed burgers and grub.  Today was a 3-star type of experience however. Bummer.  We ordered the "Chili Chili Con Queso" and  the dip came out in a little bowl and was about a 1/4 inch deep. Hilarious. We spent the next five minutes laughing and deciding who would get to eat the next 4 bites. There was so little dip that we were looking for the hidden camera. Funny. Not $7 funny, but funny.  On to my (usually) favorite part of eating at Red Robbin's - the French fries! Today they were stale for lack of a better word. We tried a fresh basket and they were also stale.  Oh well. The burger was as expected but the fries were super sad.

This post is entirely for Christina! So a little context to this  I ordered take out for my coworkers & I. Waited 20 mins to pick up my food went on my 30 and given its in the same plaza I work in, it was a 2 minute drive. I've order pickup before so I know to go directly to the bar and wait. 10 minutes go by neither bartendars acknowledge me then so on 15 by this time I am irritated I've wasted half my break staring at my order sitting on the counterwith no help. My total was $31 and I had $32 cash to hand to her directly and leave. She had looked at me 3 times prior with no smile infact a dirty look like a snob. I then go to the hostess (who was lovely btw) and asked if I could give her cash so I can leave quickly she apologizes says she cant then tells Christina I've been waiting I asked Christina, "Its 31, right?" and in return I get attitude saying she doesnt recall and would have to check all while walking off! Checking my price right??? At this point I am completely over it and leave since at this point I wasted 20 minutes! My coworkers went to get the food and said she had a nasty attitude as well. Asking them "what are you here for", like excuse you? Christina! You should learn to crack a smile instead of being a miserable girl like you display yourself to be! But don't worry boo I'll be seeing you plenty of times just prepare for the attitude you'll be getting out of me xoxo oh and btw burger was trash

This is my childhood RR spot. And I recently came back as a 20-something and I STILL LOVE IT. Memories and standards achieved! I'm the type of foodie who stays away from big chains, but RR will be that one exception. I'm all about supporting independent small businesses, but how do you say no to $2 endless fries?! YES, our wonderful server (I loved her tattoos! And she reminded us of Ruby Rose) was very chill and sweet...and told us that we could totally enjoy our beers, the Super Bowl, and a low low price of 2 dollahs for bottomless fries! Let's be honest. Those steak fries are the reason why we all go to Red Robin. Sure the burgers are yummy (the royal robin with the egg is my fave), but it's that special seasoning on the fries that get my blood pumping to eat here. I love this RR because it's HUGE. There's always enough room if your kid is hosting a huge birthday party, or even if you're just here on a casual date for two! It's my go-to, and now I know that this will be my place for big sporting events. The Super Bowl diners were SCARCE here, and there were so many seats available!! WE LOVED IT. Our service was prompt and relaxed...love that especially when I'm doing my thing and catching up with my friends!

Came out to dinner, wait time was pretty short. The kitchen must be understaffed because the food wait times are progressively getting worse. Before we even ordered, we were told it would be 45 minutes for food, no real surprise honestly. I put up with it for the burgers, but there are better burgers out there.

Went to this this location for the first time in a year or so, sat down quickly waited for the waitress to show for about 10 minutes with a bad attitude I ordered a non alcoholic mixed lemonade drink my wife ordered a ice tea she received her ice tea in about 10 minutes I asked the waitress about the lemonade she said they were restocking the bar ? I said they should have restocked last night or at least this morning before opening, waited another 10 to order our food and then waited another 40 before before asking the manager where our food was he went to the cook line and just stood there for another 10 minutes we finally got up I went to him and said we are out he said sorry that was it and this was approximately 11:15 in the morning just after opening

Came here cuz it's close to my house and because my kids like it here but the wait is terrible. The wait to be seated wasn't bad but once we ordered our food it took almost an hour for them to bring it out not only that but for some weird reason they set the temperature to below freezing it literally feels like I'm in Alaska I was wearing a sweater and was still extremely cold, as I sat here for more than an hour waiting for a cheeseburger I looked around and noticed several people at the other tables also very cold. It's bad enough I have to wait this long for food but what made it worse was having to sit here freezing my butt off too

Although our server was good the food had left me wondering why would I come back to spend $40 for 2 adults and a child. We got a salad arhat had brown pieces of lettuce and at best maybe a half chicken breast. I had a wedge chicken sandwich where I got charged extra for asking to put on a condiment! And $$4.50 for a flavored lemonade that looked like Minute Maid pink lemonade and tasted like it too. The only reason this got 2 stars was our server was nice and accommodating and endless fries.  Did I forget to mention the kids grilled cheese came with one end piece of the loaf on it? Who does that? If I am paying top dollar for the meal I expect the best part of the bread!  Not a place I will come to again. Definitely has gone down a lot since it has changed their set up. Boo red robin my kid loves this place but not taking him here anymore.
Excellent service food was fantastic Francisco our server was amazing very helpful polite and fast definitely a great midweek choice for dinner

Horrible experience. The hostess was terrible. She initially said it would be a 15 minute wait even though there were at least 10 open tables visible from the waiting area. We ended up waiting over 30 minutes. The dining area was ridiculously cold and none of our parties food was even warm. For a place that serves bottomless French fries how are they not at least warm? This is suppose to be their thing. I used to like this place. I will never come here again. Red Robin .... Dummmmm!

Worst service I have had at a restaurant, ever. It took 30min for me to get the beer I order, and hour for the food to come and our waitress "ghosted" us after checking on our food at the 45min mark. The cherry on top is that I got food poisoning that night from the food. Not only will/would I never go back I can't wait for them to go out of business based off last nights performance.

Came her for lunch on Presidents day to eat with my wife and in-laws.  They were in a burger mood.  There was a 45 minute wait at The Counter at Santana Row so we came here as a plan B.  No wait!  Very cool I ordered the Bruschetta chicken burger to try something different and really enjoyed it.  My wife ordered the Chicken Caesar  salad and was happy with her selection.

Wow. Don't know where to start. We found a small piece of metal in our fries to start. The server wasn't apologetic and offered nothing as compensation. We didn't ask for any either.  The fries themselves were cold and stale.  The burger was also slightly cold and tasted unusually bland for a Red Robin burger. The fries were also soggy and undercooked. Then, two employees were on the patio. They stared me down the whole time. I asked what the problem is, and they laughed. The woman said something to the man and he laughed and said "I know right!?".  I went and told the manager what happened, and he didn't even know about the metal in our food. This is a serious health and safety issue. What if my son ate it?! Who else got metal in their food and didn't notice?  Definitely never coming back, even if they offer a gift card.

While plenty of tables were open and empty, the employee directed us to the noisy and crowded bar area saying that only the bar has tables for two guests.  We accepted but at the end regret our business here.   The TVs at the bar were on and people were already watching a game.  Pretty noisy for such a small area.  Ordered two burgers and took 30 minutes for them to prepare and bring our burgers.  Ate them anyways because we were so hungry. Unlike the food that took forever to come, our bill was ready to pay at our table from the moment we ordered! Our burgers were $12, and $14 each, with 10 fat sticks of french fries (I'm serious, I counted, there were only 10 sticks of fries), and a tiny portion of coleslaw which had more mayo in it than the cabbage! For such a tasteless, fat, and unhealthy meal, and a lousy service we paid $40 something.   Will not come back.  Sorry, but I'm happier going to The Habit burger, for their tasty burgers, friendly and fast service, and affordable prices. Seriously $40 for two burgers and beer?? What do you really think?  Why a burger would be $14?? What is so special about it?

Honestly, never a fan. Been twice,this location only. Friend treating, 3rd time's the charm?? Noon, Saturday. Not too busy (yet!). Had a great little server (mention only in case others by name), Steven. All the order was correct, including no salt fries. He asked also about the burger, I had not considered! Shows he's on his toes...so to speak. Food hot. Ice cream cake very good also. Steven had a wonderful personality!! He really made a great experience, along with pretty good eats. Now, I'll be back. Thanks Steven! (Btw, packed when we left at 1pm)

Love their Strawberry Lemonade here and how it is unlimited! The strawberries are delicious and so addicting to pick out. Another reason why we come here is for their onion ring tower. Red Robins seriously has THE BEST onion rings anywhere! Hands down they are delicious. Huge onions, crispy and perfectly fried in batter, and most importantly, it tastes so fresh! Only $5 for the small tower or $9 for the large. It's so worth it.  All the burgers that we've tried here have been pretty good. The cod fish burger and whiskey river burger are among my favorites. The burgers are huge and they come with bottomless fries. I'm not a huge fan of their thick cut fries so I normally replace it with a salad.  Most of their appetizers are pretty cheap, they have ones ranging from $3 up to $9.. not bad at all! The service has been consistently great. You can order off the little electronic tablets on your table too and even pay for your meal on there which is super convenient if you're in a rush or forgot an order. I think these tablets are pretty new we I've only seen them the last time I visited Red Robins. Definitely feel way overstuffed when I come here so it's always a good thing to share!

Do not eat the cheese curds. I ordered the gravy cheese curds fries dealio... never again.  The service was meh....  Eastridge and Rivermark Plaza have better food and service... don't waste your time here.

We Asian-Americans are known for being opportunistic.  I'm one of those people who gets as many free or discounted birthday meals as possible- and I only use one birthday, unlike my ex!  Red Robin has two locations near me in Sunnyvale: the Rivermark area in extreme northeast Santa Clara, or the Saratoga area next to the AMC 14. The only other location is in Eastridge mall San Jose..  Neither of these two locations is really close -about 8 miles each way.  And just try going from my house in south central Sunnyvale to either location during rush hour -it may take you half an hour or longer. There are no Red Robins west of Saratoga for 26 miles -in San Mateo! Now that I'm newly retired, I can take advantage of off times to get my free meals.   I was down in Campbell , and made plans to hit Red Robin in Saratoga, with my newly printed out free birthday meal. You can't just get a birthday meal, but have to join the Red Robin e-mail club, and bring along your 16 digit membership number.  Talk about red tape, the 16 digit number is longer than my 9 digit social security number, and 10 digits would cover every man, woman and child on earth.  They purposely make it long so that if you screw up any one of the 16 digits, you miss out on the free birthday burger.   We get there at 435pm on a Monday, park the Prius, and saunter in, me in my shorts, and my   thin, smoky white, cross strap Birki sandals contrasting against my tennis tanned legs.  And I was overdressed, judging from the clothes or lack of clothes the other guests were wearing. We are served promptly, seated at a cozy table for 2 next to the kitchen, with a view of bumper to bumper traffic on Hamilton Ave(?)  through the windows.  Good ambiance, very clean premises, with waiters all over the place, and teenagers out of school for the summer seemingly in every booth.       Have not been to a Red Robins in years, and it takes us 10 minutes to decide what to order.  All burgers come with unlimited fries.  However I'm not a fan of Red Robin's fries, as they are too chunky and lack the taste of the thin fries.   So the wife and I order our burgers with unlimited salads, at the same price. It takes 20 minutes for our orders to be prepared and served, and this is at 445pm.  Come here an hour later and you may as well use smoke signals to call in your meal!  They don't serve the salads with lettuce, cucumbers, and bits of tomatoes, until the  burgers are ready, and then serve it in a small bowl.  If you want those unlimited salads or fries, you are going to have eat it in small chunks, with long wait times between servings. The wife gets the $10 California chicken burger, complete with lettuce, tomato  and guacamole.  I get the $10 Banzai beef burger, with pineapple, lettuce, tomato.   The burger must be 6" tall.  Nobody can eat that directly with their mouth.  OK, maybe my ex-wife could fit it into her big mouth, as she put her foot in her mouth way too many times. Messy to eat.  We would look like toddlers with food all over our faces!  Now you know why they provide a knife and fork! I love pineapple with my burgers, but this is seemingly the only place I can get them to put pineapple on my burger, except in Hawaii, where they put pineapple at Island burger in Wailea for $11, and the burger there is half the size with no fries .     So I'm in hamburger heaven here, savoring my Banzai Burger piece by piece, going through two salads.   We leave at 525pm, 50 minutes after entering, with the wallet $15 lighter, thanks to a free birthday burger.   A toddler starts screaming in the background.  Good timing, our leaving!

My cousin graduated college so we decided to grab dinner at Red Robin. Got seated pretty quickly. We had a party of 6. We had a male waiter (won't say his name) and his service started off great. We started with a round of waters and a tower of onion rings. He came back to take our order then the onion rings came... About 15-20 mins pass and still no food. He comes back to fill my aunt's cup with hot water, and says food is coming out. Okay cool... An additional 20 minutes pass, still no food. No communication from the server. If he at least told us that there was a mistake or he forgot to put in our order, we would've been more understanding. We're all frustrated and hangry at this point. Finally another server comes and drops off our food. For some of us, our burgers were cold... 5-10 mins pass, our original server comes to fill our waters and we order more fries. Fries came out fast, thank goodness. But 45 minutes for our burgers to come out?! That's ridiculous...

The majestic North American Red Robin bird smart,intelligent are things one might say when describing this bird... Well not here at this establishment here are the rejects that shouldn't never left the nest! they need some Mexicans back there too speed up the food times! No stars thank you.

It's always a hit or miss at this location. Most of the time I get really good service and the food is super good. For my drink I always get the freckled lemonade and for the food I'll switch around all the time and try different things on the menu. But the onion ring tower is a must every time! Good for groups - I would come here with coworkers and the waiters were always great with getting orders correct and separating the checks.  The reason I'm giving it a three is because one time I went in and it was fairly busy but not to the point where it was chaotic. My friend and I ordered and our waiter was very rude and didn't get any orders right. He spilled my friend's drink all over the table and didn't even offer her a new one or clean up the spill. He also gave us the wrong order and when we told him that he got very defensive, rolled his eyes and left. I spoke to a manager who was able to get us the correct orders and took out the charges for the previous orders.

I really don't like Red Robin, and today's trip reminded me of that.  After waiting 20 minutes for a table, we were seated.  And then we waited.  And waited.  And waited for anyone to stop by to take our order.  Or even alone ask us what we wanted to drink.    When we finally got our orders in, they cooked my wife's hamburger wrong, and missed one of my items entirely.   The music was too loud for me, as well.      I won't be coming back.

Ehh. Definitely not one of the Red Robins I would recommend.  Our waiter was pretty nice, was helpful when he was actually around and kept the fries coming since it took literally 35 mins to get our food! The host seem kinda lost but was also nice. The beer-rita was NOT yummy at all. I drank it cause I didn't want to waste the money, but definitely not getting it again! Food was yummy but my sweet potato fries looked so unappetizing! -__- Anyway, bathroom was a mess, and Yeah. Don't think I'll be coming to this location anytime soon.

Hour wait for the food. Guacamole burger tasted like a Big Mac. Orange Cream Soda was watered down af. Our waiter was really nice and ver apologetic. None of this was his fault. But yeah, never coming back here again.

Whoa, it's been 4 years since my last update? Okay, since that visit oh so long ago, I figured out Red Robin was doing a major overhaul on all of its locations. They've even upgraded their burger varieties. I used to always get the shroom burger, but lately I've been getting the Prime Chophouse burger which comes with horseradish sautéed mushrooms, steak sauce, fried onion strings, provolone, and it's served on an onion roll. Red Robin still serves bottomless fries, which is a definite selling point. Protip-ask for a basket of fries while the rest of your food is cooking. Might as well start out with some parmesan-garlic fries as an appetizer, right?

Bottomless fries. First thing I think about when coming to Red Robin. Unfortunately, it's not the burgers :( I love coming here just to scarf on those little fingers of crispy carbs. This particular location is right across from Westgate Mall and was busy, but not packed when I arrived with my daughter for a late lunch on a Saturday afternoon. We walk in and see the hostess moving at a snail's pace to get menus and escort a couple to their table. She looked at me and my first thought was, "Wow, is she in SLOW-MO?." Literally. She didn't greet us, didn't smile, or even say she'd be with us in a moment, she just blankly looked at us with an open mouth then very slowly turned away and started leisurely walking away. Even the couple following her to their table looked at each other befuddled at her sloth-like pace. Fortunately, at that moment another gentleman (likely a server) saw me with my jaw on the floor and said, "Oh sorry, let me help you get seated, table for 2?" So glad someone else came to seat us, or else we could have possibly been waiting quite some time for the hostess to slowly come back. We sat down and ordered our food. Food took a bit longer than expected to arrive.  Overall, it was the experience I expected. Good fries, OK burger, and service that you neither give kudos to nor complain about. Just a regular old American Diner experience.

This place is so mediocre. We came for dinner on a Thursday night and waited for 45 minutes for dinner. It wasn't even busy! The burgers were really average too. They were room temperature and soggy which told me they'd been sitting out for a while and the chef had really piled on the mayo on my burger which made the bun even soggier. The fries were cold too. Overall it was just not a great experience and you can definitely get better burgers faster elsewhere.

The food was great, I recommend the burger with Mac n cheese inside of it and the banana chocolate "moo moo nana" shake. I would give this place five stars if they hadn't taken so long to give us our order, and if the waitress hadn't made me and my boyfriend share one glass of water the entire time.

Stopped in here to kill some time and have an Ale while waiting for my movie to start at the AMC Theatre across the parking lot. I was looking over the beer menu - looking for a good IPA. The best they had listed was the Sam Adams Rebel IPA - but I was looking for something more local and more "craft." I asked Crystal - my server, if there were any other offerings not listed. She replied they had Lagunitas IPA. While not local, it is California-based, and a very good IPA to boot. So I sucked down one of those before heading to my movie. The IPA was served in a very large glass - I suspect it was a 20 oz. glass. The place was packed when I arrived. I was lucky to find a spot in the bar area to sit. Very loud!

The coleslaw was a huge disappointment...tasteless. The chicken teriyaki barely had any teriyaki sauce as well. The iceberg lettuce in it was also very unappealing. The fries were not offered in generous portions, nor was the tasteless coleslaw.

~9:00 PM: Hubby and I arrived here a little past 9:00 PM and there were probably about 7 tables in the restaurant. No one in the front to seat so we waited...and waited.  9:03 PM: I had that awkward moment where you try to make eye contact with any of the workers but they don't want to help you so they pretend they're washing the tables. -____-''  9:07 PM: Finally, someone comes to seat us 9:12 PM: Waiting for our server to come and take our order. Once we finally came by, we ordered everything. Two burgers and sweet potato fries + a light lemonade. 9:13 - 9:45PM: WAITING....for all items except out drinks 9:45 PM: Burger comes out lukewarm...but steak fries come out piping hot.  I asked what type of dipping sauce they had. The waiter said "we have a lot." He brought out two salad dressings and two other sauces. I asked for the Chipotle sauce but it would cost 75 cents. That's more expensive than McDonald's!! All times are estimates... except the time the food came out is accurate as I was starving. I was constantly checking the time as I could not believe how long it was taking for the food to come out. Overall, the lack of service and the cold food has solidified the fact that I will not be returning. I wanted to give it another shot only because the place is a 2 minute drive from my house. I left feeling so disappointed and had wished that I had gone to Umami burger where the burgers are half the size, but 100% more satisfying.
Ryan was wonderful.  The bonsai wings were delicious! The ghost pepper fries were also really great.  love dining  here & the service my last visit was great.

Please clean your disgusting menus. The last three times I went there the menus had a layer of filth. I think to myself the first time maybe I just came in after a rush. The second time it happens ok maybe I'm just unlucky. The third time in a row I just know this place doesn't clean their menus. It's gross because everyone in that place handles the menus and then they give them to us. So  all I am saying clean your menu!! Makes me wonder what else you aren't cleaning?

My family and I went here last Saturday, it was not busy at this time. When they took us to a table we waited, then waited, then waited some more. After 25 minutes at our table, no waiter came up asking us for water or any other drinks. So we got and walk to the door to leave, the manager was there and said to "have a nice night"  Why would u care, we sat our table for 25 minutes and no waiter came to take our orders. The manger said " it happens, see ya." Poor service, would never give them money again. The one in santa clara is soo much better

Haven't been to Red Robin in a long time and the restaurant hasn't gotten any better. I had the black and blue burger with a lettuce wrap, we shared a half stack of onion rings, and I had garlic fries. Our food took forever to arrive, all at once. It took a while longer for our utensils. The onion rings where the best part of dinner. The meat in my burger was cooked to cardboard consistency, there was only a hint of blue cheese and mushrooms. I couldn't finish it, it was that bad. The fries were very greasy and not very garlicky. The worst was my wife's Caesar salad. When it arrived we all looked at the waiter and said we asked for a Caesar. This was a plate of shredded iceberg with diced tomatoes on top and a sprinkle of cheese. Not sure where they got the recipe but they need to rethink it.

Cluster. Don't come here. Go to Main Street Burger or Happy Dog in Los Gatos or Big Basin Burger Bar in Saratoga instead of this place. Arrived at Red Robin for pre graduation ceremony. Waited 30 minutes to get seated. Sat in booth for 20minutes without any waiter even looking at us. No one gave us water. Used the "Call Server" on Kiosk TWO TIMES so we could order burgers. No one came. Our party was Completely IGNORED.  We walked out. They didn't notice!! Never coming back to this ridiculous place again.

Worst service ever. Pagie was the manger on the floor at the time 3/24. We are regular customers, usually once a week. My wife had a freckled lemonade amd she had half of her drink left. We asked for a togo cup and the refused that they couldnt bring us one because its bottomless dine in. So basically i couldnt bring home for what i paid for. I recommend going to eastrisge better customer service and management 5stars for that store
