I know that Red Robin is a chain, so didn't expect anything super special when we ate here.  Our power was out and we needed to eat dinner with the kids, and Red Robin was close and open.  The food was less than okay, having almost no flavor and definitely not tasting very fresh at all.  I had the turkey club sandwich, which on the menu looked great, but in actuality was not.  My kids barely ate their chicken tenders, and they are not picky when it comes to those things.  I didn't expect anything life-changing, but also at least expected something decent.  Unfortunately it wasn't.
Fried pickles were burnt, service was extremely slow while there were plenty of empty tables, and fries were soggy. Not coming back to this location.

I've been to this location several times and the inital service has always been prompt and the servers are friendly, however, food delivery has been getting progressively worse with each visit.   The time from ordering to actually receiving our food this last time was approximately 40 minutes.  I'd understand this wait time for something like a juicy lucy burger, but these are standard patties cooked to order and assembled for variety from "stock" ingredients.   Of course, at least with the "old" Red Robin, I could snack on fries while I waited.  However, their recent corporate overhaul has resulted in transforming a generous fry policy to downright stingy.  I no longer get a basket of fries and it instead comes out with the burger.  When the burger does finally arrive, it comes with a fry order that's probably the equivalent of a child's fry order from McDonald's.   At the end of the day, it's a good burger, but I've decided that "gourmet" isn't worth an additional 45-60 minutes sitting there nursing my drink.

Second time I have been here and it's very disappointing. Half hour wait for a burger and they won't give you your fries ahead of time. I guess I'll just starve. But if I pay they can get me an appetizer in five minutes.

The food is always fairly great and I love this location. The only trouble I have is the gross restroom which appears to be clean but has a RANK ODOR like the plumbing has exploded right under the floor/tiles. There is no attempt to hide it either and I have experienced during my last several visits. Why won't the management do something? I've mentioned it before.... I love this place but I guess I'll just drive farther away to another location.

Staff was apathetic and rude. Half the restaurant was empty and there were nearly 30 people waiting to be seated with nobody actually being seated. Guests were leaving after 10 minutes of looking at all those empty tables they could be sitting at. No thanks.

My mom and I tried to go to the movies at the nearby AMC but had the time wrong so we decided to have lunch here instead.  Our waiter was very attentive and kept checking on us until we were ready to order. I went with the basic burger with no cheese or bun and I added avocado on it.  My mom had the Whiskey River BBQ burger.  It was supposed to have crispy onion straws on it but it seemed more like sautéed onions.  I had the sweet potato fries and mom had regular fries.  Both were delicious.  The sweet potato fries had good flavor.  Crispy on the outside, soft inside.  Regular fries were the same way. Definitely a great place for a burger and fries.  They have lots of options and flavors.  They have a very exciting liquor menu too if you are into that.

I had stopped going to Red Robin for quite some time because of the horrible service. A friend had just gotten back from out of town and we went for dinner, still horrible Service, Plus after an hour and a half our food arrived, COLD! Plus the bathroom was disgusting. I am not going back, ever.

I can honestly say this is the worst service my family and I ever received. The kitchen is not busy and we have been watching all of the servers receive massages from a creepy server that wears glasses and just standing around while there is food in the window. I used to work at Red Robin myself for years and the service we have been getting is intolerable. We asked our server multiple times for things we needed and never received  it until we were almost done eating. First, our order was wrong and mistakes happen but when I ask for something that was missing in my burger it shouldn't take 20 minutes to get onion slices. Also, we asked for a refill of fries and I had to ask twice and they were not even the garlic fries we ordered. This is such a disgrace for what Red Robin is suppose to represent. As I am eating I don't want to see a creepy two eyed weirdo massage multiple girls on the line. Seriously so gross. If people have cold food it's because servers are too busy not doing their job. This is the worst Red Robin ever. If I could leave no stars I would do so. It's not just our tables order that was wrong but the tAble next to ours was incorrect and they look irritated. I would like to add if there is food in the window you need to run it out!!!! Management you need to crack down and make sure people are doing their jobs correctly unless you are getting a massage from the creepy server on which that can be sexual harassment. Jessica and staff step up your game. Next time please provide more than 4 napkins for the whole table for the whole night. Wtf is that. Happy dining at this horrible location. #sadbird

Worst service experience! Had a bad experience before at this location but that was for a big group, but this time it was just 4 of us. I had to literally get up three times to go and call for someone to serve our table. The waitress was rude and least interested in looking after refills or clearing items. I think this was the last time we go here! The Red Robin's in Santa Clara is better.

This is probably the worst place to eat in the area.The burgers are good enough but it really lacks in customer service. So as you come in they always are going to tell you the wait is over 15 minutes even if there are 10 empty tables in plain view.Then you proceed to sit in the waiting area and you feel like your in that in the scene from Beetlejuice when they are sitting in the afterlife lounge and all those weird people are around them(which isn't Red Robin's fault of having that clientele it's just the area). Your then seated and ignored for another 15 minutes as the crew walks by you multiple times looking but not making eye contact as if amongst themselves they are deciding who is going to get stuck with you.Its like when your in school and your picking teams for a sport and it's down to you and the other kid who is not really good and they just settle for you.If your privileged enough to be served high five yourself!!! I ordered a drink an chips and they proceeded to bring me my drink promptly and a fancy bowl sculpture with about 5 chips on it.I then played trivia on the little tablet thing and like always looked around the restaurant to see if I could recognize who I was destroying in movie trivia.My burger arrived and it was good but kinda tiny(oh well it was good so I can't complain). Then I asked for a refill of my bottomless fries after I devoured my plate of 7 fries and they proceeded to bring me out another plate of 4 fries in another fancy sculpture bowl.Nice try Red Robin!!!distracting me with a fancy bowl.Why do they advertise bottomless fries and then they hoard their fries like a leprechaun and his pot of gold? Its too bad because when you cut through everything the food is good it's just a restaurant with quality food but a lack of customer service

The food quality has taken a downhill slide.  I used to like their food, but haven't been there for a year.  Went last week and was so disappointed.  The only thing that was good was the fries and the beer.  Ordered a cup of chicken tortilla soup (served in a saucer! smallest serving ever!), pretzel bites (cold cheese and bites tasted like they were microwaved), chips and salsa (the salsa was so watery!) and an original burger (the burger was so overcooked!) with fries.  We were starving and just looking to get into air-conditioning that we thought we had a sure bet  eating at Red Robin.  It was busy and took a while to get a table and then to receive our drinks after ordering.  But the waitstaff looked very overworked and I didn't want to complain about the food.  I didn't think that almost every dish I ordered was going to be terrible.  It's a bummer.  The place was busy and when we left there was a long wait so I'm sure there won't be any difference with my review, but thought I should let others know.

So Red Robin is not by any means a 'new' dining experience for me, and probably most of us out there, as it is not a new restaurant. What is new to me is the overall decline of customer service that has been sadly occurring in many like places (Buffalo Wild Wings, Mimis, Chilis, etc). My review is not about the food, because the food here is greasy good - so good in fact that after three consecutive bad trips I still have voted to go back for the promise of endless seasoned steak fries.  But lets talk about that for a minute - lets talk about the 'bottomless fries' premise. Now I don't know about you but when I hear the catch phrase 'bottomless fries' I am pretty excited and really do think I am about to do some real potato damage. The best part of that aside from the taste, is the fact that it is going to not only be an endorsed process but one that is facilitated with speed and ease for my consumption pleasure. But bottomless fry seekers beware....such is not the case. Red Robin has actually found the ingenious formula of attracting customers with the sly fry claim while gently folding in some basic satiating know-how. What ever you had in mind about bottomless fries let me tell you what actually happens. Your burger will arrive to the table with your first side of fries that is usually served in a little tea cup size metal 'holder' meant to jazz up the presentation and keep the fry portion to a minimum. Keep in mind these are steak fries so they take up some room. All said and done, you get a burger with roughly the amount of fries it takes to fill up a toddler. Then your server walks away leaving you fry-less by burger bite 4 and you are in your mind thinking "Its ok that she hasn't came back yet and Im almost done eating - they are bottomless". Minutes will start to overlap and you are now fully done with your burger and your drink is gone (long gone if you have a man that drinks like mine does) in desperate need of a refill. Finally just before you contemplate asking another waitress if you can get help your server will return and you will ask for more fries. Five minutes later they will return with a wire basket containing 10 fries all laid out flat on the serving basket to give the appearance of being full. Now if something is such a big selling point for you, like oh I dont know.....fries, then wouldn't you have a whole lot of fry action going on in the kitchen? My point is that even with the initial disappearance of your server once you do ask for the fries shouldn't they be there in way less than 5 min? Enter the trickery of the fry catch. By intentionally making you wait for the fries by spacing out the arrival of the fries one of two things is going to happen. One, your stomach will cue the brain that the parties over and you are full or two you are just going to get tired of waiting for fries in increments of 10. And just like that they have served you one or two servings of fries, making good on that bottomless promise.  But that was a rant and not even what this review is about - ok so basically here it is quickly. The service is just plain bad. Your server really does disappear on you and often your needs are just not met. On Saturday we went in early at about 5pm and were seated within about 5 min. We then sat at our table for about 17 min watching employees walk around, make small talk by the drink machine and seat other guests who had their beverages on the table within minutes. My husband wanted to go but I wanted to see who was actually supposed to be our server. Low and behold it was someone that walked by us countless times. Now I understand  being busy, so much so that the simple "I'll be right with you" would have shut  me up but over 10 min? I mean come on. So our server finally approaches and I just asked if I could talk to the manager. I know - I have become that person lol.....anyways she walks away, goes up to the manager and I see her laughing a little with him cause you know, that's always cool to do, and then he comes to the table. I told him what happened and that we were just going to leave but that he should be aware of what is happening on his watch - not that he seemed to care much. He then tells me to wait a minute because he wanted to give me a coupon for 'next time'. He then comes back with two 'Free $3 or $5 appetizer coupons' which was nice of him but basically means I can get fried jalapeno coins or the chips & salsa, and if you have ever had those here can probably agree should be free as it is so.....yeah. It was just a bummer all around having to get my newborn (not the easiest task) and go to a different place.  Case in point: If you want a burger really bad that is not from a drive through, have extra time, no kids, like being ignored and don't really like fries this place will work for you.

location: South San Jose, San Jose, CA
review: This place always seems understaffed. Giovanna is great in the bar, there's also a male bartender that does great but don't remember his name. Still works as a great spot before catching a movie at AMC.

We met yet again with my son, his wife and my 95 yr old grandma. Great that the manager made it very comfortable seating for my grandma after a long wait on a Saturday night. Amanda was an outstanding waitress and really out did herself with it being so busy. Thank you and tell John Costello your  regional manager that I said that you guys out did ourselves tonight.   Kimberly Newman
Best burgers, great fish and chips..good pricing. I'm a fan of the cheeseburger and fried mushroom with lots of ranch

Having had to work late this was one of the few places still open for dinner at 10.30pm. Even then we were waiting for a while. Crazy for fri night. Nig pig bacon burger with garlic herb fries and a mini onion ring stack to start. My burger was over unfortunately though my friends was correct. The highlight was our server was awesome. She kept our drinks filled and checked on us regularly. I guess being crowded and late didnt help but a place that supports a capacity of 260 should be able to handle the high flow. 3.5 stars

Good food. But not worth $1800 a burger. I asked for a table and was seated at a tiny cramped booth in the back. Moved myself to a table. Manager had someone carve a scratch in my car door down to the metal.

I took my 2 sons here for lunch today.  We were seated by a very nice hostess.  20 minutes later, not one server came to our table.  Server on one side of us made eye contact with me, but still did not come over.  The other server on the other side of us, also did not check on us.  We have been to this restaurant many times and this was the first time I was thoroughly unpleased.  It wasn't even a busy day.  Normally parking isn't that easy for me because I have a big SUV, but this time, there were many stalls to choose from.  Other times, we normally have to wait about 10 minutes before sitting, this time, we were seated immediately.  I could not take it anymore.  I gathered our menus and told my sons that if the waiter next to me does not give us some sort of recognition, we are out of here.  He ignored us once again.  I took the menus to the hostess and told her that we were not being waited on, so we are leaving.  We then went to BJ's for lunch today and had excellent service and food.
Fast service. Large bar area so you don't have to wait for a table if there's a long wait  Friendly waiters.  Rebel IPA and other seasonal Sam Adams on draft.
Love the place but the waitress Michelle has the worst customer service ever an very poor manners!

An hour wait for cold food. ("The kitchen is backed up" - then why is the food cold?! And how is the kitchen backed up EVERY time we've been there. Normally they just pull the "aw, the kitchen is backed up, sorry we couldn't get your free fry refill out before you got fed up and left" crap.)

The food is great and the menu is creative..  The bottomless fries will definitely fill you up..  Just sucks the holiday rush is blowing up the wait time for food..  This time we snuck into the bar so we sat quickly but the food did take sometime..
David the server gave us the BEST SERVICE out of over 30+ times eating here. His manager Samantha came by and she was very nice and professional too. THANKS DAVID!!
Worst company ever to work for they never let you off on time and they have the worst food ever do not come hear BEWARE I would never recommend this place do not come hear
Julie with the cool hair brought us fries as soon as we sat down. Awesome. She even offered us sauce. Double awesome.

This review is for a visit my wife and I made To Red Robin at El Paseo de Saratoga just after Christmas ... around December 27th.  I call it a visit because after waiting about an hour for what we were told would be a 20 minute wait for a table we left. We checked in with the hostess. The place was crowded but we were told it would be only a twenty minute wait for a table.  After waiting forty minutes we checked back in with the Hostess and she apologized and let us know we were 2nd or third on the waiting list.  We waited over 20 minutes more and still were not seated so we left. I wrote to Red Robin to let them know about our experience but never heard back.  They have lost a customer for life.

I went here last Friday night for dinner and had a absolutely horrific experience. First of all the hostess told me that it was a 15 minute wait for a part of two. 40 minutes later my sister and I were finally seated.  Then it once we ordered, it was another hour wait for our burgers. When I finally received my guacamole burger I was devastated when there was the tiniest smear of guacamole on my burger. I couldn't even taste the guacamole or even see it on my burger. Consequently my burger had no flavor.  When I asked for a refill in my bottomless fries it took another half hour to refill them. What is the point of saying bottomless fries if they are going to take forever. I was still waiting for my fries when everyone had finished their food. Finally my fries came and they were okay.  Before I even left the restaurant I had to run to the bathroom. I had gotten good poisoning! I don't have other digestive issues so I know that it was because of the food I had just eaten.  Finally after two hours of mostly waiting and paying to be being poisoned I will not be back to Red Robin ever again. I can cook better burgers at home in a half hour for half the price that won't make me sick. This place was a waste of my time and my money, and made me very sick.

Have not been to Red Robin in quite a while. Seated quickly and noticed that, in addition to condiments and menu at a small two top, there is some sort of tablet computer taking up room better reserved for other things. The waiter took our order, 2 burgers and 2 waters, and disappeared...for good. Another server dropped off the food.. The food quality would have rated 4 stars. The burgers were hot and so were the fries. A burger and fries used to come in a basket but now the fry serving is about half the size of the original and contained in a ring. Those quickly disappeared. Bottomless fries? Never offered nor were our waters refilled. The next interaction was still another waiter clearing our plates. May give them another chance later.

Came here Friday night with my teenage son and 2 yo granddaughter per the request of my son for bottomless fries. There was a 20 minute wait which was to be  expected. I asked the hostess for a high chair which seemed to confuse the hostess but she brought one anyway. We got drinks right away and ordered our food. I ordered the baby a kids meatball meal with broccoli as her side. Our food came and they decided to put fries on her plate as well. I was trying to get something healthy in her instead of fries. Oh well, once she saw those there was no interest in her other food. Everything else is what you expect from this chain.

Can never go wrong with Red Robin and their burgers. Not only do they come with endless steak fries but their own seasoning is amazing!  The big cantina tavern burger and the guacamole bacon burger were both incredibly satisfying and delicious!  My friend brought two hungry teenagers who can eat bucket loads of fries so the first thing you might want to consider doing is to asking for the fries refill PRONTO when ordering the meal, this way you would not have to wait for more fries to come as they can take some time.

This is the worst Red Robin location. The first time I came the service was horrible and the food was soggy/cold. I thought I would give it a second chance coming in today, but nothing changed. Very disappointing compared to the Rivermark location. NEVER coming back to this location.

Dang! I haven't been to Red Robin in years and ran across this one while out shopping. I had the grilled cheese with turkey and avocado and it was amazing! Service was fantastic - everyone was super friendly and my waitress was the best. Luckily this place isn't too close to me or I would be here way too often!

Pros first: The food was great. I had a cheeseburger and my dad had a hickory burger. I got the onion rings with uncharge instead of bottomless fries, because the onion rings are stupendous. My 3 year old enjoyed picking her entree, side, and beverage from the extensive kids menu, and I enjoyed that this menu was available for $5 and under.  Cons: My dad ordered a side caesar and he got a regular side salad. The silverware was dirty. We had to ask for silverware and napkins. We had to ask for drink refills. It took 20 minutes to place our drink orders, another 15 to place our meal orders, and yet another 10 for my daughter's milk to come out. That's 45 minutes from arrival, 25 minutes from order, for a 3 year old's milk to arrive. Not exactly stellar.

The El Paseo Red Robin is my favorite location with its great service. Plus, who doesn't love the endless fries? I was surprised to find this location very busy on a Saturday night at 5.  It was filled with families with small children; I guess a 5 PM dinner time for families with toddlers is the equivalent to a 7 PM dinner for adults.  We had to wait for 20 minutes but it was nice that they texted us when the table was ready. When we were seated, we were greeted by a nice waitress who served us our waters quickly.  We took a while to decide what we wanted but she was very patient and checked up on us without being pushy.   I ordered the Whiskey River BBQ burger and it was pretty good considering I am not a Red Robin fan.  The burger was nicely cooked and the toppings were not overwhelming.  I would expect a BBQ burger to be dripping with barbecue sauce but it was not overwhelming.  The crispy onion straws on the burger were a nice touch and every other bite I would crunch on a piece of bacon.  The bun however, was not toasted to my liking (or at all really) as well as everyone else's buns.  I guess they don't toast their buns or they were really busy that day... My big problem with Red Robin is their "endless" fries are usually not endless and floppy.  Our waitress asked if we wanted more fries but I was satisfied with the fries I had.  The manager also came by and asked if we were satisfied with our meals, which we appreciated.  The steak fries were also very crispy!  Not one was soggy, which made me very happy.  The fries were tasty AND they were actually endless. Overall, I was pleased by my dining experience.  The service was great and the food was good.  I still prefer the Island chain to RR, but I am starting to reconsider after that Whiskey burger!

Josh our server was attentive and courteous. We came for our daughters 11 birthday and he made our experience a good one. My husband and I came on another occasion and I ended up giving this place a really bad yelp review. Josh gets 5 stars, only down fall is the 45 minute average wait.

I was first introduced to the Red Robin chain when I was in college.  For a student on a budget, it really checked all the boxes: - free refills on fries - free refills on drinks - reward program (buy 9 entrees, get 1 free) ... Okay, maybe there weren't very many boxes back when my metabolism was faster and my wallet was lighter. More than a decade later, it's still a decent sit-down spot for a diet-busting burger meal.  (I don't dare look at the nutrition facts here.)  The decor got updated a few years ago, and the new chairs are an improvement. The burgers are pretty good: cooked to order, juicy, and piled high.  The Whiskey River BBQ burger is one of our favorites, featuring fried onion strings and barbecue sauce.  The guacamole bacon burger is a self-explanatory classic.  These come with bottomless steak fries (try RR's salty spice mix on them) and run about $10 each. Red Robin now also features a "Tavern Double" line of small double cheeseburgers (about $8 each) and a higher-end line of signature burgers on ciabatta buns (about $14 each).  These likewise let you refill fries ad infinitum. The "freckled" strawberry lemonade is a popular choice that's been around for years.  The newer "poppin' purple" prickly pear lemonade is even sweeter.  These come with free refills, so it's no big surprise that they check in around $4.50 each.  (It would be nice if the beverage menu listed the prices though.) The guest service experience can vary pretty wildly.  On our latest visit, our server Katelynne did an outstanding job and made sure we had everything we needed.  Prompt drink refills, piping-hot fry refills, the works.  She even checked whether we could combine the "Tavern Double Tuesday" special with a free birthday burger offer.  Really impressive service, considering she was flying around to cover many tables. On the flip side of things, in that same visit we saw vacated tables neglected for a long time before being bussed.  It honestly seems like the busboys here don't try very hard.  You'd think RR doesn't employ any busboys, but once in a great while they'll come by and bus a table... Food:  4 stars Value:  3 stars, depends a bit on how many fry refills you down Service:  3.5 stars, can be hit-or-miss (5 stars for Katelynne) Overall:  3.5 stars
Service a bit slow but waiter(s) attempted to be quick as possible.  Just tried the robin Royal. It's fricken yum!!!

Avoid like the plague. Got seated by an apathetic hostess who tossed down menus on our table and left. 15 min later, when no one showed up at our table, which by the way was grimy, we flagged a waitress, who turned out to be the manager, and asked if we could order. 10 minutes after that we left because no one ever showed up. The 'manager' had said to us - let me grab someone for you. Why? Don't you have someone to wait at my section? I'm giving this place 1 star because there is no way to rate them in the negative.

Red Robin burgers are satisfying when I'm craving a burger that's not from fast food joints.  However, my experience at this Red Robin was awful. I came here pretty late at night with my boyfriend (9:30PM), so there was no wait and not many people inside. We were seated, and our waiter brought out the menus for us. We were ready to order but our order wasn't taken for at least 10 minutes. We had to call another waiter over to take our order because we had no idea where our initial waiter was.  When my burger came out, I saw that it did not come with many of the ingredients that were listed on the menu. I thought they had given me the wrong item, so I called our waiter over and asked him if it was the right burger. He told me it was, but I knew it was missing some avocados among other things like jalapenos. He brought over a menu and realized that my burger was indeed missing some essential ingredients from it. A few minutes later, he brought back a plate with a few avocado slices and some jalapeno pieces on it.  What a disappointing experience! Not the best service from this place. Only redeeming thing is their bottomless fries/sides.

I hadn't been to this Red Robin a while and felt like having something extra fatty this night. As we pulled up we noticed that their sign out front was different and looked nothing like the old one. We didn't think too much of it and just went in. To our surprise they had remodeled the whole restaurant. The waitress said they were trying to get away from the Chuck E Cheese feel. The Food: The food is always great but this time it seemed extra tasty and not as greasy. I don't think they changed the menu items but it tasted a bit better than before. I ordered the Bacon Cheeseburger which I always order when I go here. I did notice that the bacon seemed to be of better quality than before. Not only that but I received three strips of bacon vs. the two that they normally give out. I got my burger on a wheat bun with American cheese. They waitress did ask how I wanted my burger cooked, some pink or cooked all the way through. I like it juicy so I went with some pink and I'm not sure if they gave you this option before. The hot date got a Chicken Caesar wrap which she said it also tasted good.  The Staff: The staff was nice as always. I did notice that they stopped wearing jeans like before. It's a little dressy and it looks nice, so long as they feel comfortable in their attire. The waitress came around a few times to make sure everything is ok. The only thing that sucks was that we did not get offered drinks or a refill on fries before the check was brought out. It's not like I was hungry after the meal, but it would have been nice if we were offered.  The Restaurant: As I said above, they remodeled the whole place. The layout was similar as before. The bar on the same side and the restrooms are located in the same spot too. They changed up the booths and made everything nicer. They moved the TV's around and added new pictures and frames. They even had framed pictures on the ceiling (dangerous, would not want to sit there) which looked cool! When you put your name on the wait list they take it down on a note pad and they actually text you when your table is ready. This is cool because you can go and wait in your car if the waiting area is too full. Am I going back?!? I will be coming back, especially now that they fancied up the restaurant without charging the customer more for their meals.

Eating at cabins are not so bad! Ted Robbin always delivered good delicious tasty burgers!! I usually get the banzai burger ! But I changed it up tonight to the peppercorn burger which is very tasty!! In the plus side they offer bottomless fries! We also got the regular bacon cheeseburger that never disappoints!! Gotta love red robin! Plus there's plenty of parking outside, it gets a little too crowded on the weekend but if you have wait it's worth it! Their 22 ounce draft beers are priced just right and the atmosphere to eat here is very family friendly and fun! The servers are super nice and tentative!!
Ali was awesome. From start to finish he was ON point. Drinks and food were perfect! I can't wait to come back!!!

Our server was amazing. However, the food was less then satisfying. We asked to add jalapeños on one burger and avocado on another. I uploaded pictures of what was received. The onions were old, the bacon was... yea. The atmosphere was great and the service was great but the food was horrible. The last three visits, in three different counties, has been gross. It's safe to say, Red Robin is no longer a food option. (Gave it two stars because of the service).

My first time at any Red Robin and oh boy will I never be back. The chef and waitstaff repeatedly told me the Boca Burger was gluten free, but it definitely is not and I had to show them my google results to convince them. Trying to get them to make anything vegetarian and gluten free was like pulling teeth. I asked repeatedly for the fancy grilled cheese they make on a gf bun. Finally they said ok, but they brought out a dry bun with two pieces of American cheese that they had microwaved.  What kind of meal is that?   The kid's grilled cheese, that's what. And not even with the side of fries it's supposed to come with... I sent it back and eventually they at least put a couple kinds of cheese on the dry bun... The only good thing I have to say is that we didn't pay for the meal.  So there's that.

Red Robin is a pretty decent restaurant. Positives - I really like their arctic cod fish burger. The fish is crispy and has just the right amount of tartar sauce. - The fries are delicious! I love the Red Robin seasoning that you can put on top! Negatives - Long wait- At times I had to wait near 30 minutes for a table.  It gets very busy on Friday and Saturday nights. -Inconsistent service- One time, I had to wait 30 minutes for a new batch of fries. It shouldn't of taken that long to get a fries refill. At times it also took long to get the drinks (water, soda, etc).  Overall, Red Robin has decent food but lacks great service. The wait times are also very long!

As a returning customer at Red Robin, I absolutely loved my order for both its exceedingly good quality and portion size. I ordered the Bleu Burger to go, which featured a delicious medium cooked patty with deep fried onions, tomato, lettuce, and cheese sandwiched between two onion-flavored buns. The quality of the meat patty was absolutely superb - juicy, flavorful, and melt-in-your-mouth fantastic and definitely so much better than I anticipated from a burger chain. I would definitely recommend this burger for first-timers! The price of the burgers here are a little bit on the higher end ($8 and up), but it's definitely worth every buck when you taste how good they are. Also, your burger comes with a side of fries of your choice, ranging from steakcut fries to sweet potato fries to garlic fries. I'm always a fan of sweet potato fries, and they are definitely delicious here as well. Love Red Robin and cannot wait till my next visit! P.S. You can sign up for their Red Robin Royalty program online - on your birthday, you get a free burger w/ a side of fries for free! :)

I used to love this place. I'm not sure if other locations have gone downhill like this one, but I won't waste my time going back to this one. The last three times I've eaten here, my burger and the fries has been brought to me cold to luke warm. Three different visits spread out over about two years and three cold meals. It was obvious that the burgers were made and left on the counter for a long while before being brought to the table. They offered to remake them for me and once I accepted, but it too came out cold. There's no reason that a burger at a place like this shouldn't be brought to the table still steaming hot. And my last visit a week ago actually included at least one raw potato in the fries. Remaking my burger ensures that I'm not eating with my family or friends and that they're waiting for me, so I usually decline and at least they have been nice enough to take the burger off my order. But it isn't good, so I don't eat it and still need lunch. In all honesty, McDonald's is better.

The food is continually good each time i come here.  But, the service SUCKS ASS from the hostesses up front to the waiters everytime i come. You would think i would have learned my lesson. Maybe this Yelp revoew will help me remember. Note to Red Robin: GET SOME CLUEFUL MANAGEMENT AT THIS JOINT ALREADY!

The service was off the hook and the food was good our server was very attentive. And pretty :) the dishwashers were cool aswell they didnt let our dishes pile up and the place looked clean and organized

We came here for my dad's birthday. Our server was really nice, the one star is for him. Minus four for how it took nearly 1.5 hours to be served our food. As my dad put it "I ordered food this birthday, but was served food on my next birthday."

Well last night was the worst , we went for a birthday dinner for a friend . Just 3 of us . It took 1 and a  half hours to get our food . We watched food sit to go out in the kitchen for 40 minutes . We asked the manager what was up with the food sitting and he said "OH that is cold sandwiches " I am thinking then why is it sitting there - go serve it !!! It was just so long for a few burgers . They filled us with soda the whole time we waited and then we were full and could not eat all our food . We watched all the black shirt workers standing in the pick up area waiting and waiting and the manager coming around telling each table that they were backed up and they have quit seating people until they get caught up . It was not packed . They really need to get their stuff together there . It is a descent place to eat but the service is bad .One of our onion rings was wierd , it was the whole top of the onion like a cap and filled with the breading and then fried so when is was broke open it just dumped the uncooked breading all over .  Our server was nice , nothing she could do I guess . Get some new managers with a clue and some management experience . Dont think I will be back there ! They did adjust our bill and took half off     just saying , it should have been free after waiting that long ....

It was not busy when we were there for lunch between Xmas and New Years. The hostess was attentive and seated us quickly. Otherwise, the service was slow it took quite a while for the food to come out.  When burgers and fries came out, nothing wasn't very warm.  The fries were barely warm and quite undercooked - pale without a crispy skin. Who cares about getting "bottomless" fries when they are soggy? The burgers were - odd. They tasted okay, but they completely fell apart as we ate them. The buns crumbled in our hands and the meat broke into chunks. ??? Although not busy, it was hard to hear across our small table as the place is really noisy. Since there were so few people in our section, I almost wondered if they played a recording to make it sound busier and livelier?

Walked up at 9:30pm, one party of three waiting for a table, and the irritable hostess, BEFORE we can even say a word, blurts out "30 Minutes" in a negative tone. It could not have been more than 5 minutes of waiting, based on one party ahead of us. We left. Right behind us was another elderly couple. As we walked to our car, we looked back, and that couple also was walking out the door. Note to manager of this facility: your hostess is driving away business. Don't worry about what you pay her hourly, cause you're losing way more in terms of business.

I don't really have high expectations for a chain restaurant, but if you're gonna choose to eat at Red Robin, this location is the one you wanna  avoid! First of all...parking here is HORRIBLE (thanks to the theatre) and wait times here are HORRIBLE (you can guess why...thanks to the theatre). The bar area here is super tiny, and the restaurant has a very odd, narrow lay out. The main dining room you get a view of the kitchen (which is SUPER loud btw). Putting all that aside, one thing Red Robin does is try to make dinner a good value. They have all sorts of cheap appetizers and most burgers are around $10 with bottomless fries. Quality isn't as good as before, but for the price you're paying, it's not a bad deal! I stick with the Royal Red Robin or Whiskey River BBQ burgers and they are usually done well! They have a bunch of dipping sauces which are good too.  Fair prices on drinks, but they aren't very generous on pours. Well drinks come in taller pint-style glasses, so you end up with a standard serving with 90% mixer. My vodka lemonade was so watered down, I complained to the manager who admitted that she has to order a double. She was nice enough to comp the drinks and give us a free speciality cocktail on the house, but I won't be drinking here anymore...unless it's a beer or something! Overall, it's too much of a hassle! Smashburger is at Westgate Mall, and if I'm hungry and craving a burger in the area, I'd probably go there. However, if you don't mind waiting, Red Robin isn't a bad option! 3.5 stars rounded down!

Came because i heard great things and i show up and tried to to get on list and they  told me that it was going to be an hour wait to get a table and 45 minutes after I get my table to get my food because the kitchen is not caught up and that they've been busy all day that is not acceptable. And I can clearly see 6 vacant tables. That's lazy, or bad management
Snarky hostess and understaffed restaurant not a good start to what should be a quick in and out before a movie at AMC.

I was not satisfied with my burger, shake, and service. My Oreo shake tasted like rubber and chocolate. My burger was burnt and my egg was barely cooked. I accidentally said the shakes weren't good and the waitress heard me. I felt poorly about what I said, but I was simply suggesting to my friends not to get a shake. My waitress looked at me in a way that made me feel uncomfortable. I came from a soccer game at Prospect High School and I was very famished. I hoped for a nice meal to satisfy my hunger but instead got a poorly cooked meal that I could have cooked better at my home. Thank you for your time If you want a good burger I suggest you go to Buffalo Wild Wings at the shopping complex right across the street.

I'm not going to cook dinner today! This nurse nerd proclamation resulted in mini me and the hubby deciding that it's burger time .... So Red Robin is their choice tonight. Well, I must admit that I wasn't really in the mood for burgers... but hey at least they serve alcohol! Yes, it has been one of THOSE days!! So, we are promptly seated and our server appears relatively quickly. Great! We have the spinach & artichoke dip to start. Can I say super yummy! It was perfectly bubbly and warm with just the right amount of greenery. The chips, on the other hand were quite greasy, so I stuck with the celery sticks (hmmm.. Who serves celery with spinach & artichoke dip anyway?). Well, I guess RR does?!? Oh yeah, I must not forget the hubby's potato chowder ( still searching for clams and flavor). Well, atleast it looked pretty! Next are the burgers which were all good. No complaints from mini me ( DGB burger) or the hubby (BBQ burger), I had the chicken breast burger - sans bun. Note: I didn't mention fries, because they were cold and old! Minus a star! ( who the heck wants cold fries? Hmmm...Old & Cold Bottomless =fewer repeat requests). Lastly... My drink. Ok so I love martinis and the holiday special was a Kettle One cranberry concoction! Score....or so I thought. Ummm... Where was my Kettle??? Not in my drink! Minus a star because weak drinks= pissed nurse nerd!  So, dinner was just ok. My buzz was nonexistent and it's still raining!

If I could give this one negative stars, I would. We came yesterday at 6:30-waited for 65 minutes with about 50 other would-be-patrons. In the end, after watching close to 100 guests leave without the hostess seating a single waiting family, we were told by the hostess her management wouldn't let her seat anyone, so we left. It was appalling. My husband told me he'd waited 60 min here last week with my daughter, only to be forgotten at the table for another 60. They were gone for almost 3 hours!!! They should be out of business by the end of the year with this kind of management.

My wife and I recently ate at this restaurant for dinner.  Our hamburgers were good, but not great. The service was even less impressive. It was obvious our server doesn't like her job. She seemed disinterested in waiting on us. Once she served us, she never came back to check on us. We were so unimpressed with our server, that we are not likely to go back again. Red Robin used to be our favorite place to go to for onion rings and delicious bottomless fries, but the bad service is enough to keep us away.

Just ok.  Got a free birthday burger - thank you!  But husband's meal was cold - the meal and fries.  They comped his meal. Our poor waiter had a HUGE service area and he tried his best, but it was slow service to our during the lunchtime rush. It will be a while before we visit again

Several times eating here & now we review. I had great times each and every time. It's busy but our servers always delivered. We met several friendly customers while we visited.  My chicken wrap was always on point, even down to the thick avocado slices. Boyfriend was always happy with his meals. We both LOVE the pick 2: mushrooms & cheese sticks. Yummmm... I would say my only complaint would be that the area closest to the kitchen needs a bit better ventilation. Smoke came our way each time. It was kinda distracting since I already have breathing issues that I'm on medication for. Something positive to leave with: Check out their HUGE Lego cheeseburger & fries display! It's very neat!

Food was ok . Amazing ? No . Fries were limp but when I ordered more (bottomless) I was given fresh crisp ones so I know they have the ability to make good fries . We were sat right in front of the station where they must  get the silverware etc. had to listen to employees talk amongst themselves which is fine but maybe shouldn't talk about smoking weed or make comments like " I'm getting lit right now " while sucking down a blue alcohol looking drink .  Also heard the "f word" several times . I'm not a prude I don't care but there should be some level of professionalism . Our server never asked if we wanted refills on our drinks .. actually the sweet lady busing tables did ask us and I think she probably does a lot of work the servers should be doing . If you don't mind the lack of attention in service the food is edible . Just disappointing that people seem to lack  personal drive and work ethic  these days .

We went to this place last night and we all developed stomach bug! We ate there around 7:30pm and when we arrived home around 9:45pm, our stomach started to feel very uncomfortable, we had diarrhea late in the evening and today. Till now when I am writing this post, I still have very upset intestine. And I think it entered my milk too cuz my 4 month old EBF baby also fuzzed and cried the whole evening last night and had mild diarrhea today. Poor baby.  Besides the food poisoning I am complaining, their service is bad too, they have a lot of empty tables, but they make us waited 30 mins to be seated, and they assigned us a table just right next to the restrooms. They didn't even consider that the table is poor to a family with a little baby. Food served very slowly. And our whole family got stomach bug after that.

I don't go to  chain restuarants very often, but we felt like a burger, and we enjoy the bottomless fries this place offers. We spilt one of the more expensive "featured burgers" with blue cheese and onions and mushrooms.  While it wasn't as blue-cheesy as advertised, it was a good, juicy burger and yelp I like those bottomless fries. On this last visit they were not as salty as usual, and quite enjoyable. Our waiter was great and attentive.

I see a lot of low star reviews were for bad service, but I didn't think it was that bad Delicious Burgers! Bottomless Fries!  One of, if not the best, gourmet burger places in the south bay. Location is convenient, seating is plentiful and spacious. There's outdoor seating for days you want to enjoy the cool crisp fresh air of the south bay. The service decent, though you may need to ask for refills every now and then. I got the guac burger, which was absolutely melt-in-your-mouth delicious. Their fries are also really crisp and fresh and I like how they come as wedges. I will definitely be coming back here again when I feel like getting a burger.

Can never go wrong with a trip to red robin.  We sat at the bar because the restaurant was pretty packed (dinner time on a Saturday) but were promptly attended to.  Ordered the cod burger and a cup of french onion soup.  The food came out super quick and was amazing as always.  The cod was battered and crispy with a tasty slaw and tarter sauce.  The onion soup had the perfect amount of broth/onion/bread/cheese ratio, but was a little over salted.  Great dinner regardless!

We used to like this location..Maybe they are way understaffed? The service is horrible...bottomless fries? Ha you're lucky if you get any ..The wait time for your food is so long you'd think you were at a gourmet place ..no refills on drinks blah blah ...really don't think it's the fault of the servers just believe they don't have enough...they really need to get it together

Should have listened to my son and went to the Counter. Just didn't want to wait in the cold at Santana Row during the holiday season. Has to be nightmare over there.  But check out the picture I uploaded. Found moldy tomatoes in our burger, got lucky with it falling out of my sons burger for us to see, pretty sure a bunch of people had black mold tomatoes tonight. Last time here. Place isn't that good to begin with, so no loss.

If you don't want to wait in line to go eat here then you better know what you want to order, give them a call to order for a pick up, kill time for about 30 minutes somewhere or at home, pick up your food, go home and enjoy your food. Parking does suck here because of the movie theater. Wait times vary since there were times when my party and I were seated in 10 minutes and there were times it was 45 minutes to 1 hour. Just be smart about your dining decisions when it comes to Friday-weekends. It's better to just call to order for pick up than waiting more than 45 minutes :) Their bar area is a bit too small but Brianna is such a champ when it comes to super busy times at this place because she doesn't like one of those irritated bartender/bar area server. Love their Whiskey River BBQ burgers and bottomless fries though! Oh, milkshake too!
This evening I ordered to go. A patty melt with fries, a cheeseburger with fries and a onion ring. Food was delicious! The only problem I have is paying $40.00 for 2 burgers!

1 rating because service was unlike anything I have ever experienced. Server came across as a smart ass and if you asked what was good or what you recommend(um because ITS HIS JOB!!) his reply was "I don't know" or "I can't really answer that" HUH?!?! When we ask you what beer you recommend you don't tell us "There are too many to list" Wait.....WHAT!?!? Food was great which warranted a 2 but it was prettttty shitty service.

We go to this location frequently but the service and "mood" of the people working here has gone downhill. We arrived tonight were not greeted but instead felt like we were inconveniencing the "hostess" (um isn't that her job to greet people when they walk in) instead we got an attitude and were asked how many and asked my name. My stepdad uses a walker as she could clearly see and when she asked us if we wanted s booth I asked for a table. Apparently that pissed her off as she rolled her eyes and put three tables together for us. I wish that was the end of the bad experience but it wasn't. We then waited about 15-20 minutes for our server to ask us for drink orders or just to come by and say that she would be right with us. Nope. I went to the bar and got our own drinks. She finally showed up and took the rest of the drink orders. She then took our food order. But didn't come by to see if we needed refills or anything.  Then we are done with our meal and had to wait forever for the check. I ask for the computer and she said that our table didn't have one. Ugh!  I gave up and we left. Horrible experience!  Next time we will drive a little farther and go to Applebee's. I don't like the food as well but at least we won't be treated rudely!!

I'm disappointed with this location.  Seeing my older review from 2014 on Yelp was actually helpful, a good reminder of that experience shows the place is hit or miss.  This place isn't always the best choice. Mediocre is the right label. My husband and I have gone to this location on numerous visits, but, the next time we want Red Robin, it will have to be the Rivermark location. The next time I'm near Westgate, I'll strongly consider other dining options. Our visit was tonight- Wednesday, Sept. 14th at 8:00.  We were seated in the coldest area of the restaurant- the central area near the window.  I asked if we could relocate- We normally sit near the bar, during afternoon hours.  When our waitperson (Jessica) asked what we wanted, my husband suggested that I needed a jacket. Jessica tells me the manager is busy in the kitchen, but will get to it when they get the chance.  It would have been nice if this mythical manager actually stopped by and acknowledged that there was a problem.  Our food came, and the fries were cold with my Arctic Cod burger.  My husband ordered fish and chips- the fish was soggy, and the four small pieces were buried in his cold fries.   Food would be classified as warm, but not hot.  Service was not stellar-it was okay, but, we only saw our server when she took our order and brought the food to the table.  We were near a semi-large group. It really wasn't that busy.  There were three people working at the maitre'd station, mostly having a conversation amongst themselves. It took awhile to get a refill on the drinks, and the replacement for the cold fries only came AFTER we finished our meals.  Same for drink refills. As far as observations on restaurant cleanliness, I noticed the tables outside that needed to be bussed when we came in, still needed attention as we were leaving.   As far as sitting at that cold table, I don't understand why we had to sit at that specific table other than the fact that table was in the zone for that waitperson. That situation could have been resolved in a personable fashion over the excuse of "We'll get to it when we can".   My guess is that the system cannot be adjusted.  My problem with this place is that I've had better experiences at this location.   Much better.  Enough that I normally ignore that the value of the food is overpriced for what is received.

Red robin is a new discovery in our house. Yes, I know - a little late to the party. They have great burgers here. The apps are also great. The fish and chips lack the oomph than other places. The breading doesn't stay on the fish which is very frustrating. The prices are very good also - let's be honest that is hard to find in this area. The reason this place does does not warrant five stars is the service. Last two times I went to Red Robin I saw my server twice. Once to take my orders and the next to pay. The food was delivered by an expediter not our server.  Whenever I go there I am convinced the reason they have bottomless fries is because there is no way possible for you to get more than one order. While we enjoy the food we only go to this red robin when we have lots of patience.  FYI, don't hit it up before the movie. You will most definitely be late to the show.

Just ordered our meal with my granddaughters let's see how it goes. I ordered a lettuce burger, first time trying it lets see how taste. So the verdict is Great lettuce burger . My granddaughter like her teriyaki burger so would definitely come back. The wait was about 20 minutes which as we all know is pretty good, the hostess did a great job moving the tables

The worst Red Robin I've ever been to.  Server had attitude every time we asked him for something.  He rarely checked up on us, the place was not even busy (about 1/3 full).  Requests to the kitchen took forever to come out.  He forgot part of a friend's order but still charged him for it.  Orders were never delivered by our main waiter.  Fries and drink refills were rarely tended to.  He insisted we use the tablet terminal to pay instead of handing us a traditional receipt.  There was grease on the bottom of my burger (and everyone in the party).  To top it all off, I got mild FOOD POISONING.  Disgusting environment, I would avoid this location if you can.

Came here after the 4th of July parade and thought what a better place to celebrate America's birthday than at a burger place?! Got some seats outside and environment was pretty good. The food was good, but the main thing that was annoying was the service. It's slow and our server forgot to come back with our fries. We even saw another table next to us leave because they waited so long to be help and no server came by...

***FOOD POISONING!!!!!!**** Wanted to like this place, but nope. Just no. We were sat in what presumably is the armpit of the restaurant, there was so much yelling. Not the type I had expected at this restaurant as it wasn't loud patrons, but hostesses and wait staff yelling at each other.  Our waiter had an ok attitude, but the attention span of a goldfish. Our appetizers were delivered and we proceeded to have to ask twice for plates, utensils and napkins. Ummm, really? Then we were dive bombed the entire stay by little gnats swarming around. We thought they were coming from the door being open, hind sight says we probably should have taken that as a sign and left. We couldn't find our waiter for a large portion of dinner. Then as if to add insult to injury, got to witness a FANTASTIC waitress one section over run literal circles around everyone. Seriously, she delivered food to her tables and hustled and helped deliver for others. But alas, we were the Oliver Twist of this story.  We aren't planning on ever returning anyways, then at 2 am this morning my nine year old wakes up with food poisoning. After reading through other yelp reviews, it's kinda common here. That's it for me. I'm reporting this restaurant to the department of public health. There's a reason people get sick at restaurants and I've seen enough horrifying episodes if kitchen nightmares to be properly horrified at this place.

I love this place... and everyone I know loves this place. The burgers are the best and I always get the Bleu Ribbon with a turkey patty.  This is my 1st pick for my Mothers Day meal and my kids are more than happy with this choice.

Absolutely yummy for my tummy tonight! We spent the day cleaning and by 5 when we got here had only had coffee and water, so needless to say we were hangry! We were sat promptly waiting the ten minutes they quoted us. Our waiter Elliot, a new fellow, was great and brought me salad right away once I let him know my condition was serious! Our burgers: mine the smoke and pepper was cooked just right and the hubby tried a new one - the uber burger which he was quite happy with! Fries, beverages, salad all Perfectly complimentary to the food. And Elliot. He made sure we were happy and we let him know we were thankful. See you next time YUMMMMMMM

Service not so great at bar.  Bar tender asks what you want looking over her shoulder with back to you so if you plan on altering how you get your food (no sauces ) good luck. Bottomless fries...  the ones i started out with were cold and end pieces , she never came back to check if everything is ok.  Yes, they are busy with door dash and making cocktails, but if they are not  going to provide service then they shouldn't serve food at the bar.  Burger was black and blue burger was good but didn't come out as I requested.

My daughter and I stopped in here for a quick "beverage" after getting our nails done.  It was a friday around 3pm so I figured it was a good place to "happy hour".  To my disapointment, the bartender politly said they no longer have a "happy hour".  Instead they have a handfull of items that are always lower priced.  That's no fun, I like Happy Hour! Oh well, we ordered a glass of $4.50 house red (Rex Groth) and a Screaming Zombi.  Wine was bleh but it's $4.50 so what can I expect but my daughter enjoyed her Screaming Zombi quite a bit.  Not too sweet, not to bitter and plenty of booze to make ya "feel" it.   The hubs and I have come here a few times for the food.  The burgers are good.  Nothing outstanding but good for a chain restuarant.  I tried their onion dip and didn't really care for that.  The chips were weird and the dip was way to sweet.  Oh well, gotta try it at least once right?  Service is consistantly good. Very friendly bartenders and the crew keeps the tables cleaned after folks leave.   Red Robin really caters to families and young adults.  My daughter came here with friends often when she was in High School.  It's not a place I would choose for dinner just because I've had my fill of chain burger joints but it's a nice stop in before or after catching a movie at AMC14.  They have a small outdoor patio that faces the parking lot when the weather isn't to bad.  This place does get busy on the weekends and evenings .  I've driven by plenty of times and the line was nuts.  So if you're planning to visit, I'd come early.

This place had the worst service I've had in a long time! The meal took 30 min to get to the table and when I got my meal they said my onion rings were coming up shortly so as everyone at my table were eating I sat waiting for my onion rings which showed up as we finished our meal! Also  I now know why they offer bottomless items it's because the staff never comes to service you so you can't order anymore! I don't know how this is acceptable by any standard but I will not be bringing my family or work meeting here. Go to Burger King you'll get better service!

We have had a few bad experiences at Red Robin (not this one) but decided to give it a try. Good was amazing. Server was fantastic! Rafael got sat with us (a 2 top) and got a party of 8 at the same time. As a server I know how that feels and how it can break you and your shift. He took it all in stride and made our meal enjoyable. He was friendly but not over the top.  We will definatly be coming back.

I had not been to a Red Robin in 20 years yet the service and food I had tonight was amazing!!!  The servers name was Jessica and I must say she was TOPS!!  She was so awesome we left her a 40% tip!!!  She absolutely deserved it!  Wow!  We will definitely go back!  Thank you Red Robin!  A+++++

Tl;dr: mediocre food and crummy service My husband and I went here for dinner on a Sunday night. It was not too crowded and we were seated right away. Unfortunately, we were seated next to the to-go pickup area, where a very loud young girl and her mother (who was uninterested in telling her to stop loudly kicking the bar) were waiting. That did not start things off well. I ordered clucks and shrimp and he got a bacon cheeseburger. His burger was underwhelming. My entrée was fine but the fries were cold and sad, do I wanted to get them replaced with fresh ones. This RR location is using ziosk table kiosks, which let you play games, order food and drinks, or call the server. I hit the button to call the server and a red light on top started blinking. And blinking. And blinking. Unfortunately it had no relation to anyone coming to check on us - in fact, several other servers walked by the blinking light and did not acknowledge it at all. We finally, after write a few minutes, saw our server, who brought me new fries. They were hot but also insanely greasy, which was kind of gross. We paid with the annoying little ziosk console and left. I don't think we'll be going back to this location.

This place got their four star rating not just because their burgers are good (their burgers are about a 3.5), but because they give you bottomless fries. Come on, you can't beat that. Their new tavern burger is great. It's a double patty but not twice as big. Each patty is smaller, but you get two of them. OK, you're now saying "what's the difference then?". The difference is that there's more edges to the burger to get the flavor of their grill. It really makes a huge difference. I highly recommend it. The downside of this place is that there's usually a wait, and their service is iffy. Sometimes it's decent, but most of the time it's not so great.
worst food i've had in awhile. Stay away. Jack in box would have been better.

I WILL NEVER VISIT THIS LOCATION EVER AGAIN!!! Came to this location awhile back with the boyfriend for date night. There was a 30 min wait so we decided to go to the bar section for a drink before dinner. Bartender was talkin to his coworker and didn't bother looking at us til couple mins later. Bartender didn't know how to make me an amaretto sour or Midori sour because it "wasn't in his drink book." I settled for a rum&coke while it took him a couple tries to remember what my bf ordered (corona beer). There was seating around the bar tables but we finally got seated 40 mins later.  By then I was starving so I told the bf to hurry up and order. The server took forever jus to get us water because he saw we already had drinks. I saw a TON of plates just sitting under the heat lamp with no servers in sight. The servers I did see just glanced and walked past the plates stacking up. I looked around at all the irritated customers, the table next to us even told us they've been waiting for an HOUR and still haven't gotten their food. When they finally got their food, they told me and my bf how cold and disgusting it was. After a talk wit the manager they sent their food back and eventually left without finishing their meal. I was soooo hungry, and the food took SOOOOO LONG I wasn't hungry anymore. You ever get that feeling?  Sadly, because the bf was so hungry he ate his burger. Even though I had been starving, the cold bread and lukewarm fries disappointed me. They even ran out of boxes...  I WILL NEVER COME BACK TO THIS LOCATION!

If you want to sit in the bar to catch the game, it's a great place to do so.  If you want great service, just deal with the bartender, everyone else is useless!  you'll be waiting 15-20 for your order.

Service was good. Our server saw that I was removing the tomatoes from my salad and gave me a second salad without tomatoes. The food was okay. However, I found a sticker in my side order of broccoli.

My co-worker today got me lunch from here today. Let's see how that went! First off, allow me to start off with how I always enjoy this place, no matter what the location. My co-worker got us some burgers and fries to go. She came back rather fast so I can say from that, that the service shouldn't have been an issue. As for the food, for take-out, it wasn't half bad! I didn't get as many fries as I would if I ate in. It was still fresh and tasty for take-out. Overall; Not too shabby for take-out, dinig in must be great

I wouldn't recommend coming to this restaurant unless you were absolutely starving and it's your only option. Service here is really slow and poor. If you come around 5:00pm they'll make you wait 25 minutes for a seat when all the window seats are clean and available, and they won't let you sit at them because they "don't have servers." 10 minutes later you'll see the next family sitting there with no excuses. If you ask for their bottomless fries, it will take them 15-20 minutes before you'll even get them, if they don't forget (which they often do). To top it all off, ordered a chili burger and they told me they ran out of chili.. 2 days ago. Don't even bother coming here unless you don't care about slow service and potential ingredients being unavailable. The burgers are mediocre and you can get a good burger anywhere else nowadays. Save your time and money please.

I've been to a few Red Robins in my day...but all the other locations were back in SoCal. Gotta admit, this spot never disappoints. We've only been here during the weekend a few times, and we never had to wait to be seated. There's plenty of seating here and the customer service is definitely a 4 out of 5. Food comes out in a timely manner. We only had to deal with waiting for our a food a bit longer than usual once, because our waitress seemed like she just started working there. Burgers: bomb dot com. Pasta: bomb dot com. Endless fries AND only a few dollars more for sweet potato fries: BOMB dot com. Only thing I miss is their salmon and chips, I used to order that ALL the time back in SoCal...but I guess they discontinued that item. The restrooms are actually pretty clean too, which is a plus for me!

The hamburger was excellent as usual. I would have rated a 4 or 5 but the staff has lowered the rating I give for the last few times I've been here. In the past, it was slow service and errors on our order. Tonight it was 2 REALLY LOUD employees in the bar area. They talked for a long time and it was louder than the music!! Tip, don't annoy your customers! It'll be a while before I come back and I'll miss the burgers... :^(

Red Robin YUM - Has always been a favorite of mine (since High School, actually). Love that they have bottomless french fries - the bottomless feature also applies to SWEET POTATO FRENCH FRIES. What! Who could say no to that?! It's a great place to grab a drink after work & catch up with an old friend. The service was ok - Could've been better, could've been worse. And the hamburgers are always juicy here! (Even if they no longer serve medium rare).

My husband and I finally got some time to go in a date night, we don't usually get to go out!!!  It sucked,  we ended up leaving.  We are really patient people, and we have been to this location a few times before, with no problems. We ordered our food and drinks at the same time-- I a diet coke and my husband an ice tea, drinks came back wrong, should have been an inclination of the future. We waited for our food for almost an hour, without the waiter coming to check on us or to tell us the food is still being cooked.  The waiter took a larger party's order, was very attentive to their party, even brought out their appetizers!  (This party was seated about a half hour after we ordered our food). My husband ordered his burger medium well done, so they did not have to wait for the burger to be fully cooked.  The one star is for the service, not the food.  We didn't get a chance to taste our food this time around.  The waiter could have come by to explain they are busy or food is almost ready, he didn't.  We left without him noticing, we did get a thank you on the way out by the hostess.   We ended up going to Carl's Jr.  The Carl's Jr. On Saratoga, where there is one lady taking the order, and making the food-- we got our order in 5 minutes, with a hello and a goodbye. AND a thank you.  IDK if I want to go back to this Red Robin location. Might just have to haul my cookies all the way over to the east side, next time I'm able to go on a date w my hubby.  So sad.

Half way decent restaurant. The three stars is mostly for their onion rings and malt milk shakes, everything else about Red Robin is "meh". The burger I ordered was lacking quite a bit in flavor, the cheese was hardly melted on top, and it was served lukewarm. The service is incredibly slow here. It was a bit crowded so I'll give them the benefit of the doubt, but it felt like we were waiting an eternity for our food to come.  Red Robin could use some work in my opinion, it's alright for what it is though.

Piss poor management of the restaurant. Drinks took forever to come out, basic request of sauces, forks, and napkins took forever to come out as well. My first experience here was phenomenal. Our server Ali was quick and prompt. He deserves a gold medal award. However, on our next dining session, it took a complete 180 degree turn. It was almost as if they were purposely trying to do bad, hoping they would get enough media attention from Gordon Ramsay to have a "Kitchen Nightmare" transformation. I was so irritated by the drink orders that I went to go take a look at the bar. The ONE bartender had about 20 slips/drink orders coming out of the machine!! What is going on with this place?? UNTIL THEN!! ^-^

I was a bit wary of this place because of the reviews about service, but this place is A-OK! I think we went there a bit earlier than dinner time, so our experience wasn't as bad. We ordered: Bottomless Milkshake ($4.49) --flavorless vanilla ice cream --We drank 3 of them and good thing they were bottomless because that's expensive! 3 A.1.® Peppercorn ($10.99) -Bacon, melted Pepper-Jack, A.1.® Peppercorn Spread, tomatoes and crispy onion straws on an onion bun, came with bottomeless fries -Burger was OK, A1 Peppercorn was blah.  -Steak Fries were nice hot and crispy  Overall: Tables should be wiped down, it was a bit sticky...Service was really good. She was really nice and attentive. Before we even spoke she asked if we needed more fries and a refill of our bottomless shake! She gave us 2 orders of fries and 2 root beer floats at once and we finished all of them! We left happy. Would come here again.

The first time we went we had Very bad service !! The manager of the day was awful he didn't apologize for the service . My husband's food was late. & one of the employees was arguing with the MOD !    The second time we went again our food was late but at least the manager of the day was much nicer & gave us a discount.  I love there onion rings that's why we go there , but after this second time no way !!

One of my favorite places for a delicious juicy burger! This is my favorite location. My usually is their Royal Red Robin burger which consists of bacon and a fried egg. I always ask for extra crispy bacon and this is the only location that really makes it extra crispy. The garlic fries are amazing especially if they are straight out of the fryer.  Don't forget to signup/register for a Red Robin card. Get a free free burger after purchasing 9. I think you also get a free appetizer on your first use (verify that this hasn't changed). You also get a free birthday burger in your birthday month. The kids menu has plenty of choices for a reasonable price. The balloon at the end of the meal is always a treat for my son.  It can get pretty crowded for lunch and dinner on weekends so plan accordingly or come early.

Consistently good food. Ton of choices for great burgers.  Red Robin looks and feels like a national chain restaurant, but actually delivers on the food it serves. As mentioned, the burgers are very good, cooked to preference.  The service is ok, at least at my nearest joint. We always eat in bar area where there is no wait.  My latest meal there was the Atlantic Cod Sandwich, which I've tried before and didn't really like it. This time, it was outstanding. Glad I gave a second shot.  Boring selection of beers on tap, and way to many host/hostesses at door. But good food.

If I could give this place a negative star rating, that's what they would get. Management has no control of anything.  They lag on everything from the moment you walk in till the moment you leave. About the only thing they do right is, oh wait, they don't do anything right.  AVOID THIS PLACE. POOR STAFF, POOR MANAGEMENT POOR EXCUSE FOR A BUSINESS.

First off, we got seated pretty fast. We sat near the bar. The waiter was ok. There were no utensil at our table. I ordered the cod fish and chips and my gf ordered A1 Peppercorn burger. When the orders arrived, the fries were cold. The cod fish and chip was cold and not only that, the second piece of fish I touch had a piece of hair. I lost my appetite when I saw that. THe burger was also cold. Not hot as I expected to be from a hot burger meal. The burger came with sweet potatoe fries and it was also warm/cold. This place totally sucks. The waiter did not offer to refill our water or "bottomless fries". After this experienced with this restaurant, I would never come here again. If you guys want a good meal that is hot and welcoming, I suggest you go to five guys, in n out or some other delicious place.

What a crappy place! Went with my daughter last Sunday to taste "some of the best tasting burgers", as I remember them back from about 10 years ago. Waitress brought the coffee, without the spoon or sugar.  15 minutes later brought the spoon - the coffee already got cold. Brought a new cup - tastes like CRAP! This is NOT a coffee, people! Ordered soup and a burger. Waited for 25 minutes...  She then brings the burger only. She "just forgot about the soup". After complaining, manager brought the soup and tells me "we will remove it off your bill". Burgers taste just ok. Nothing special. In'n'out have tastier burgers now. Tortilla soup - absolutely tasteless. Waste of money. Waste of time. Waitress brings the bill, the soup is still on the bill.  Decided to leave a feedback about the experience on Red Robin's "Guest Support" page ( ) - it's just blank!  I guess the management of this place doesn't care about their "Guests" altogether, regardless of the branch... Sad.
Love it here.  We go all the time!  I absolutely love the banzai and DGB burgers.  Oh and the purple pear lemonade is awesome.  Plus, it's a fun place.

Worst service experience we had in the US so far. We literally gave 0 tip. And normally we are easy on 20% tip for a nice service. The seating personal was absolutely overwhelmed. We waited more than 20 minutes - 10 of them in front of 5 empty tables. And we were only a party of two. Even after being seated nothing happened for a long time. No server passed by while 4 tables were waiting to order. When the server finally arrived we directly ordered drinks and entree. We left the appetizer out to not risk waiting a long time for our main course. While we were waiting for our order people even started seating themselves. Guess that tells a lot. Luckily, you can pay at the table here. So, after finishing our burgers we could leave quickly.

This is solely based on the customer service from the front!!!!!!! I am very aggravated and disappointed with the service my mother and I received when we first walked in to put our names down. My mother got a very rude response from EVAN in the front saying "Well this is America". Once I heard that, I was already taken by surprise by his sarcastic comment to my mother. I knew after that this might not go well. As I caught Evan glaring looks at my mother and I. Laughing and smirking to himself. As we got called up within 4 minutes of putting our names down. He asked my mother if we needed a kids menu while he looked at me straight in the eyes. He definitely tried to antagonize and provoke me. After that, I was beyond livid. Sadly he didn't have a name tag, but thankfully before I even followed I asked a manager his name. I am very upset and I definitely want something taken care of because of this. I will not be recommending this place because of his service. Everything starts with the people in the front, if you provide great customer service you'll be a lot more successful. I don't think you should ever have a toxic person at your place of business. As for our service, STEVEN NG was excellent!! If you do go, ask for him! He was well professional, great, very personable and friendly.

There seems to be a difference between restaurants up here and restaurants in San Diego. Service was slow, parts of the order were missing and the burger was just meh. Which is weird, considering I love Red Robin. The server was nice but there really shouldn't be a 10 min wait just to get started with water. The smoke and pepper burger was basically a regular looking burger with pepper sprinkled over bacon. Tasted alright. Nothing special. Still love the bottomless fries and freckled lemonade though.
