It's okay. It used to be better. It's your basic, loud, crowded, burgers and shakes joint.  I come back because I love their fries with campfire sauce for dipping.  I get my burger bunless with a lettuce wrap, because their buns aren't that good.  Shakes are decent. Mixed drinks are over priced and average. I enjoy the fish and chips,  but it's s little to large of a portion for my taste.  Basically,  I just come here for the fries. ;)

Took a while to place both orders.  We had 3 different waiters... the appetizer was wrong then replaced.  When I got the fried zuccini I wasn't happy with them.  I told the manager who wasn't friendly and didn't smile.  She asked to touch them to check them and took them off the bill.  Then I got my prime rib sandwhich and it was bland.  No one cleared our table or refilled our drinks.  Out of our 3 waiters there was only one that smiled. Yummy french fries though!!
Ryan was  our waiter.   He very good  with what he  does.  He makes you feel  welcome.   Over the food is  pretty good.   Thanks  Ryan!

Hospitable? I think NOT. Honoring offers made? No. Customer service? Poor to non-existent. Double check your take out orders!  We ordered burgers to go and found it was not what we ordered. We called and the Manager told us during our next visit they would pay for two burgers to make up for their mistake. When we decided to take them up on the offer, they refused to honor their offer. This isn't the first time they made mistakes. We don't usually say anything so the one time we did, this is the response we received? This is their idea of customer service? Don't offer if you aren't going to honor it. It's really too bad because we are frequent patrons. Not any more.

We love Red Robin.  We used to visit this location a lot when it first opened, and it was well worth the visit every time.  Banzai Burger.  Need I say more? But since the latest remodel, unless we just had a string of bad luck in our visits,  either the management has changed or something fundamental shifted but this is a place that needs serious help.  Service quality is seriously diminished.  Certainly there are some good people working there, but errors in orders and long waits for food shouldn't be the norm.  Food quality and presentation has also slipped.  It isn't the same experience at all. We keep telling ourselves we'll never go back, but tonight, after watching a movie at the AMC, we decided to give it another chance for dessert, and arrived to no hostess at the front station at all (waited for five minutes and even asked staff if anyone was available to no avail).  We had to leave knowing we would be stuck in there for a VERY long time.  The only folks waiting aside from us was a family who walked out with us complaining they had sat there for 30 minutes looking at a number of empty tables filled with uncleared dishes that were not being tended to. The place was a mess.    Red Robin is a repeatable concept.  It is a successful franchise. It has an established system that should be easy for any conscious manager to sustain.  I have no idea why this place has tanked, but it needs to wake up and get the fix it needs.  We'll come back when it decides to be a restaurant that cares about its customers again.

Don't know why we keep coming here.  Always have terrible luck with the service here.  Both dinner and lunch.  Service staff is friendly, but so slow.  If I'm paying $15, this is not what I'm expecting.  Slow to refill my water and super slow on refilling the bottomless fries.  Maybe it's a strategy to save costs, but a terrible customer experience.    Think I'm done with this place.  Would rather get a burger from Mooyah or the Habit.

We've been to this place many times.  There are a lot of great burgers on the menu and with bottomless fries, onion rings, soda and even root beer floats, you'd think they couldn't miss.  But Red Robin fails every time.  I like my burger medium, my kid wants hers well done, and my wife prefers medium-well and half the time we get them mostly rare or all well done. My kids burger often has has stuff on it she wanted excluded, our others sometimes are missing stuff... Service is good about half the time.  Forget about the bottomless stuff, about half the time, we do not get refills on our drinks or on the fries.  The last time we went, service was slow, but the burgers were great. The waiter checked on us once, we asked for some ranch dressing... But we never could get anybody to provide  refills on fries or drinks. We waved yelled ran after the guy and we never got the dressing... after two hours in the place we had to leave.  The waiter did get us fries and drinks as we were leaving...

I was here on two occasions in the last 3 weeks; once for dinner and once for lunch. I am not sure if they are understaffed but service was reallllyyy slow. We had to wait for a really long time for the food to get to the table; we had to wait for water for 10 mins too phew. The taste of the food was not that good either. We ordered garlic fries and they tasted just like regular fries; when we mentioned that to the server, she just smiled and said, 'oh yes that is right, the recipe for garlic fries has just changed'. So that means you pay for garlic fries and get regular fries??? I have had better experience at the Rivermark location. I am definitely going to that location from next time onwards.

OMG this place is amazing. My husband and I came here last night after watching a movie.  I was hoping for them to still be open after our movie had ended, and they were! We got out of our movie at 9:30 pm and I believe the restaraunt closed at 10 pm, but they were still willing to seat us even though they were only open for another half an hour. Our server was Lauren B. who was an absolute pleasure.  Most of the time when you go into a restaurant last minute, the servers tend to be grouchy and rude, but not Lauren. She gladly took our order with a smile, served us our plates in less than 10 minutes, had our orders perfect, and tended to all of our needs.   My husband and I ordered the Royal Red Robin, and it was absolutely amazing.  The burger came out perfect!  It's basically a cheeseburger with an over easy egg on top; however, we don't like our hands getting all messy, so we ordered ours over hard.  We ate those delicious burgers in a matter of minutes lol.  Our orders came with bottomless fries, but our burgers had us full enough. I am totally a burger kind of gal, and the burgers sold here are definitely some top rankers!! Upon finishing our meal, Lauren came back to ask us if we wanted some more fries or possibly a dessert.  She handed us our bill, and said no rush, just take your time, and let me know when you guys are ready to go.  We tried to skidaddle as soon as possible to clear way for their cleaning to commence, yet no one was in a hurry except for us. THIS LOCATION ROCKS: Great experience, Great Food, and EXCELLENT SERVICE!!

Very sad to write this review.... First, we waited in line just to be greeted.  Mind you, we came in at 7.  Totally normal dinner time imo.  I have family members with a very specific allergy.  We have to use the app, they say... if it WORKED!  We asked to use their ipads to order.  She said, "They're all the way in the back."  Well, go get one!  Fries came out cold, no one checked in with us.  My husband flagged down a manager for help.  The manager took the cold fries, and put in another order.  Then the waitress dropped them on the floor.  45 minutes pass..... still no burgers.  Then an hour, and, cold food.  Disappointing is an understatement.

Walked in around 9pm. Ordered food by 9:15pm. Didn't get food until 9:50pm. Waiter brought our meal in three separate parts. Order was wrong on both plates: my friend's beacon/lettuce wrap burger didn't have beacon, and my "flaming hot" burger wasn't even mildly spicy, not in the least. Other tables got their food before us, despite us ordering 10-15 minutes before them. We didn't ask for anything special, just regular burgers and fries with water. It was only my friend and I, TWO people.  Our waiter tried to make up excuses like "oh we start cleaning the kitchen around 9:30pm so the cooks were busy," "it takes a while to cook burgers," and other lame ways of avoiding the fact the service is just terrible. There were only about five other tables eating in the entire restaurant and just as many employees working as there were customers inside. What a joke. I spoke to the manger and he asked me how he could remedy the situation. Since I'm not looking for handouts, I simply requested they improve the service and he said they were working on it.  Don't bother eating here.

I went there with a friend last week. She found a hair on her salad and when she told the waitress she said the manager will take 3 dollars off the bill. Not the best customer service. Won't go to that place again

Its red robin, not a steak house people lol. Burger and fried were awesome.  Banzai burger is my fav. Go with the honey mustard to dip the fries (trust me on this).  Service was as expected, decent.  Grabbed food and hit the movie 100 yards away.
We sat outside because inside was packed and our service was slow and our food was cold. Bad experience.

Our timing was less than perfect as we arrived at the peak or end of lunch hour around 2pm and we were seated at 23 mins. Luckily our server daphne was warm, pleasant and knowledgeable. Besides having stellar customer service she was able to accommodate our table with 2 ziosks (the new tabletop technology that allows people to order, pay the check, summon a waiter, or best of all play games and watch movies) for a price 1.99 each our children were able to watch a movie while the other played a game. This is a cool service. The food was hot, delicious and served within reasonable time, the appetizers came out quick. The reason for three stars was the cleanliness of the facility. In the woman's bathroom there is a continuous drip under the sink that creates for slippery situations my 4 year old actually fell right by the caution sign. I hope they get that fixed ASAP. There were a handful or more of empty tables which needed to be serviced and remained that way the entire time we dined.  Overall it was a pleasant experience and this location remains among my top 2 red robins in the area.

location: North San Jose, San Jose, CA
review: I will not come back. This place has gone down the drain. We were greeted rudely and since the place is crowded we requested to sit outside. We were discouraged to do so since there's only one server and yadiya...so we opted to sit inside. Then the greeter took upon herself to put us on the list only after adding 2 others to be sitted. I know since I watched who got there first and who got called in. By the way this so called employee is walking around holding a Rubik's cube. Then the server is in a foul mood bringing us cold food. We may not have dressed up to eat in this place but we make our living honestly and I guess our money is not good enough.

My family and I have been coming here for 2 yrs and it's consistently been 3 star type of place for us. But today I wish I could put zero stars mainly for customer service.  I came in with my mom for lunch and were seated at the two seater booth all the way at the end of the restaurant by the kitchen. We were waiting for our food to come out and bam! My mom starts sliding down below the table because she was seated on a broken booth that was being balanced on a freakin' bucket! A bucket?! Seriously?! Now my mom is a petite woman at 5'1 and the booth just slid. Imagine if it were a couple of kids sitting at the booth? Good thing my mom was able to catch herself. When the manager came out my mom told her how dangerous it was to have a broken booth like that and she simply put the seat back saying she didn't know it was broken. Oh and no apology or concern for my mom's well being was given. Awesome customer service RR. Needless to say we walked out not wanting our food anymore. Hopefully ya'll get that booth fixed otherwise there might be an unwanted lawsuit on your hands in case some customer like a kid gets hurt.

The speed of service on Fri night is slower than molasses. We went here last night and these are 2hrs of our life we won't get back. Food is slow, and soggy and unappetizing. So first 45 min to sit, then 20 min for appetizers and 40+ min for burgers....which have obviously sat under the lamp because the bread is soaked and dripping and the fries are lukewarm and thrown on the plate as a last ditch effort. Unpalatable at best Overall, what a waste of Fri night! In and out would do a better job than this mess. P.S: we could see the servers hustling hard, not like they were sloppy. Makes it even more odd Verdict: never returning, not to this spot, and likely not to the chain
Food is always wonderful but service is slow & prices have jumped by $3-$5 per entray.

What amazing customer service! After an awkward encounter with another patron in the first come-first serve bar section over a table that we had sat at, we had left the restaurant feeling embarrassed and a bit outraged. We made it to the parking lot when I decided that I should call the manager. I explained what happened and she had already been informed. She asked that we come back in and she would seat us right away. I was hesitant, but she practically insisted and was very apologetic. She took care of us herself and made sure we had a 5-star dining experience! Then when we thought they were bringing us the bill, they let us know that everything was on them!  Red Robin is one of our favorite restaurants and we like to treat ourselves to their delicious banzai burgers every so often. This was the first time we had been to one since relocating from Florida to California just a couple months ago. We will definitely be back as Ramona and her staff were absolutely wonderful! Thank you SO much! You and your team turned what could have been a horrible dining experience into a 5-star review! Kudos to you!

Today there sucked!  Went in about 12:30 and they were obviously understaffed.  Told us 20 minute wait, my mom kids and I waited 30 minutes and checked in and they had crossed us off the list!!  Did not apologize, sat us down where we waited another 10 minutes for NO HELP and so we left without eating.They had empty tables and clearly not ebough wait staff of kitchen help I am assuming.  Good luck with that Mr. King, Manager.  I personally can't wait for the Habit to open!

I'm usually not the type to complain but today's visit was horrible. First off the food was cold. Second off they messed up my order and took forever to bring my fries and fix my salad. And it also took WAY too long for the check. Not coming back to this location.

I've been here a couple of times over the years usually to redeem my Birthday Burger with my family.  If there's anything that I enjoy is a free meal and Red Robin's Royalty Reward program always gives me something to look forward to on my birthday month. As for the food itself, this Red Robin, like other locations, has gotten a bit more modern in its decor.   My most recent experience here was my to-go order on the last day to redeem my birthday burger.  I was seated at the bar and I was amused to see how they arranged their hard liquor bottles on their shelves.  Some of their bottles were literally way out of reach for their bartenders...one of them even had to get a stool just to reach a bottle of Jameson!   Otherwise, a decently adequate Red Robin for your burgers and unlimited fries fix.

This place is great! I am pretty sure if you order anything from the menu you won't be disappointed. The customer service here is great and always come around to check on you, which is great. The place is rather large and can get pretty busy on busy days/nights. There is plenty of parking. This place can't get any better! Definitely check it out! Oh and the onion ring towers are YUMMY!

it seems like every red robin these days has terrible service. my friend and I were trying to catch a bite to eat before going to the movies, but between waiting to flag down our server and waiting for our food to come (which I thought was a long wait for a table of 2 without appetizers), I literally paid at the table and took a quarter of my burger to go, ghetto style in a napkin, as I walked across the parking lot to the theater.  it's too bad they can't seem to get it together because I love me a freckled lemonade and a shroom burger, but I always have to make sure I have a good 2 hrs to spare.

My friends and I used to come here a lot, but the last 3 times we have been here it's been absolutely terrible.  The wait for food is just ridiculous. 40+ minutes just to get a chicken sandwiches for 3/4 people?  None of the servers we had we attentive or offered anything while we waited. The drinks took forever to get, the refills took even longer.  Hint: when you want the server to bring something extra (like extra barbecue or campfire sauce) tell them BEFORE you get your food. We made the sad mistake of asking when we got our food initially and didn't get what we asked for until we were finished.  The last time we went, our server gave me the wrong food but I decided to eat it anyways because it took 45 minutes to get it and I was starving. The manager on duty took it off our bill, thankfully.  We had to talk to the manager twice and was offered a discount on our overall bill, but because we asked for separate checks, the discount was taken off. Our server (the last time we went) told us that our discount would be taken off if we got separate checks, but she could find the manager and have him apply the discount to each check and that it would just take a little longer. Since we were there for 2 hours anyway, what's another few minutes? She came back 10 minutes later with our bills.... And no discount.  Just absolutely the worst service I've ever had 3 times in a row at the same place, different servers. Train your servers to be more customer friendly, or hire a new staff.  It would be wise of this location to offer fries (more than one basket for 4 people) while waiting 45 minutes for their food. I'm sure my friends, as well as others, don't go to restaurants to loiter.

Gave it a second try after a horrible first experience and shame on us for doing so. Service is just about as bad as any Buffalo Wild Wings. On top of shitty service we received the wrong burger, no ketchup and fries that were still frozen! Such a disappointment. Won't come back to this location again.

Three visits over the last year, and all I can say is: Don't bother going out of your way for this one. If you do, don't come hungry, and expect to wait.  The decor is disjunct, the wait is interminable, the food is mediocre, and the bathrooms are smelly. If you sit in a booth by the far wall, there's even a draft coming through the bottom of the window frame.  Our wait time for a table was quoted at 20 minutes, but ended up being closer to 30. Their handy app showed our place on the list. Once seated, however, it was another waiting game. We ordered a mud pie and some drinks to pass the time before our burgers arrived. We waited 10 minutes for the pie/drinks, and then 30 minutes for our burgers. Good thing we weren't starving! Our server Jeff hustled like crazy to serve us, apologizing for the wait, and attentively checking in. His hustle was to no avail, though, as the kitchen seemed to be moving at glacial speed. We could see that the few orders that were partially made sat under heat lamps for several minutes, awaiting last parts/ingredients before runners/servers brought them out. All the employees looked frazzled and exhausted. What a mess.  There were empty two-top tables over by the bar that could have been filled. Large parties often take up many tables and sit for long periods of time. This creates a backup for smaller dining groups. These could have easily been arranged into those bar tables.  I always look forward to the bottomless fries. Today, though, they were soggy and mushy. I didn't even finish the ones on my plate. My tavern double burger came lopsided, with tomatoes arranged on one side of my burger. It was greasy and ooey with cheese, but only served to remind me that Five Guys would have been a similar, cheaper, and faster meal. Tremendously disappointing.

To begin, service was slow, and we could not reach our waiter most of the time. He would bounce around nearby tables, but would somehow manage to skip our table numerous times when we needed service. The restaurant was initially packed, but the service speed did not pick up after the crowds cleared out. We started with the giant onion ring tower as appetizer. It was delicious and crunchy (and the probably best part of the meal). I loved the dipping sauces, especially the BBQ one. For entrees, we ordered the Ensenada Chicken Platter and the Whiskey River BBQ Wrap. The chicken was rather dry and bland. It had the exquisite taste and texture of cardboard paper. The BBQ Wrap was about the same. It makes me wonder whether Red Robin microwaves their food like Applebee's. The Cookie Magic shake was noticeably better than McDonald's Oreo McFlurry. (Apples to apples right?) However, its signature monster size has gone on a diet and is much smaller than I remember it during college. Was quite disappointed when I finished it a third of the way into the meal. The clam chowder soup was quite good and about the same quality as the ones I get from Safeway. I recommend it. On the other hand, the French Onion soup (which is supposed to contain sweet caramelized onions) was the saltiest I've ever tasted. I imagine the chef accidentally dumped half a cup of salt into it. No one at our table wanted to finish it. Overall, the food and service were quite subpar. I think I'll stick with McDonald's, as their

What can I say? I come here if I'm in the mood for a burger, but I'm also in the mood to get restaurant-style service. Food here is decent. The burgers taste like burgers, and there's a pretty big variety. The fries here are bottomless, which means you never leave feeling hungry. Personally, I left feeling like I should go for a jog to alleviate some of the calories I just packed in. The wait can be surprisingly long. Sometimes they seem a little understaffed (as in you won't get seated even though there are 3-4 empty tables in the restaurant).

Enough time goes by and I always forget how terribly slow the service is here. Wait and wait and wait to get seated. Wait even longer to have anyone bring you a drink. And then wait some more before someone takes your order. Then settle in for a really long wait for your mediocre food. Is there an app that can detect your location and remind you to always avoid a nearby restaurant?

My family had gone to Red Robin on Thursday, January 22nd and Sunday, January 25th. The experience was almost like night and day.  Both times I had called ahead to put my name down because I had the Red Robin Royalty Card.  Let me start with Thursday, January 22. We got to the restaurant, checked in, and immediately got seated. We got a few bad stares because their were people waiting, it looked like I just walked in, and got seated right away. Service was great and quick. I ordered the Fish and Chips, and it was done well (crispy). Our waiter was very attentive, and making sure everything was fine.  We went again with my family and friends on Sunday, January 25th, and once again called ahead of time using my Red Robin Royalty Card. We waited a little bit, but we were seated pretty fast. Now service was way slower. It took like 15 minutes to get our drinks, and when we ordered our food it took almost an 1 hour to get. I ordered the Fish and Cod, and it was "soggy". I didn't want to send it back because I didn't know how long it was going to take, since we already waited an hour to eat. My mom ordered the same thing, and her's was just as soggy as mine. They messed up on my friend's order, and had to send it back. I know it wasn't just our table because the table next to us sent their food back several times due to mistakes. My dad ordered beer also, it took ordering it 3 times to finally get it, and drink refills also took a long time also. I've been to this Red Robin several times, and never see service this bad. I'm still a fan, but not sure what happened the night of Sunday, January 25th.

WTF They could have just served us melted crisco with a spoon! We wanted patty melts...good idea we hoped. The marbeled rye was over toasted, the meat was wafer thin, the cheese was minimal, oh and the onion...one 1/2 side only. And here is the truth...they cooked the whole thing in smothering grease. YUK, I'm telling you it was awful! We ordered onion rings, an indulgence, and they too were loaded with grease, gleaming, dripping, awful. Think very carefully about selecting this place, it is an adventure in awful.
Can't go wrong with a burger from red robins, always delicious!!!! We usually end up choosing this place over a bunch of other burger restaurants

Bottomless steak fries!  So good with the campfire sauce!!  The free refills on the freckled lemonade is also a plus since a lot of places only give refills on sodas and water.  I'm not much of a burger fan, but Red Robin has so many more options than burgers that anyone can find something they will enjoy. The workers are all very friendly and will gladly take your plate back if something is wrong or you mis-ordered your meal.   Margaritas have a good taste, but they aren't blended very well.  Too many ice chunks on more than one occasion.   This is a great place for lunch with friends, family dinners, or even dinner dates before a movie that's just across the parking lot.

Great spot to have dinner before the movies ! Red Robin is my spot faSHO! My favorite RR, in particular though, is this location. The service is fast(er) and the food is always on point. Shoutout to the waitress who gave us free milkshakes, very nice of you! I also love how it's located in a shopping area with the AMC right across.... only bad thing is that I always get a food coma while watching a movie afterwards but i'll take it!  tip: get the freckled lemonade!!!!

God help me, I really do like a Red Robin burger every now and then... So good!  Endless steak fries? Yes, please!  Free refills on root beer? Heck yeah. Did you know that this particular Red Robin carries craft beer as well? Probably not the best idea to suck down a pint at lunch BUT it would be a great after work treat. Or if you've had enough of your family, drink a few ;)

I usually like Red Robin. My One Star is for the server that didnt give a *uck about her service. Oh and for the Egg that took 20 min to make. Her name is Katelynne He... I get it, everyone has bad days, but to not take care of a customers because they screwed up on your order, doesn't help anyone. First it takes over 30 minutes to get my beer and 2 milk shakes. Then another 30 minutes to receive our burgers, to only find out that my order (Royal Red Robin) was screwed up. Egg Over hard was requested and I received Sunnyside up. Fine, no problem, its a mistake, I sucked it up and waited 20 minutes to have an egg cooked. 20 MINUTES TO HAVE ONE EGG COOKED OVER HARD!!! Wtf!! All of this while Katelynne is next door chopping away while I flagged her down to check on my burger. She clearly knew my order was screwed up because she only came by to ask where my burger was previously. But with no sense of urgency taking care of the situation, she said she was tired from being up at 6am. Ok, I guess it's ok to not do your job because you're tired.  When the burger came out, I dig in to my burger to only find out that the *ucken 20 min egg that was being cooked, cooked for literally 20 min on the grill. Bit into the burger and what do I bite into? This Caramelized, plastic texture that was from the egg. Ok, at this point, not cool. I waited over an hour just to get this burger that was not up to standard. Not only that, but I tell Katelynne, our server..... Her response, "ok".. and walked away.  I work in the food industry and I know what standards are and what they are all about. Her standard is no where near Red Robin's standard. She should've taken care of the situation right then and there, but had us wait another 15 minutes to flag down someone else to get the manager over. And of course, she took care of the problem.  Morale of the story is, don't ruin someone else's day because your day was long. This was taken place on 10/01/15 @830pm on table 13

Sat waiting for our food for about 40 mins.  I think they had to go out and slaughter the cow. What was frustrating was while our waiter was nice - he didn't say anything until we pressed him.  Then he shared the kitchen was behind.  Offered fries if our food didn't come soon. He came back and said our ticket was next.  Waited 5 more minutes.  What he SHOULD have done was just given us our stupid fries while we waited.  My daughter had the burger with the free refill fries - it would've been SO EASY to just give us the fries while we waited. But NO.. cheap and stupid. NEVER go there if you are hungry.  burgers are good but so are the burgers at the Counter!  Or Habit, or 5 Guys or Smash Burger, or... get the drift? There's SO MANY other places that are just as good and not as slow. The manager came out to placate the table next to us - NOTHING for us - not even comping a drink or ANYTHING! Am NOT going back to Red Robin again.  Customer service doesn't seem to matter to them.  And as I said - there are MANY other good places to go.  Such a shame but given they've been in business for a long time - you'd think they'd get this figured out!

My wife and I spent two hours at RR at Paseo de Saratoga yesterday evening, It was not a good experience for is, the wait staff, or other guests. All the guests waited forever to get anything. Mostly what we got were apologies and very weak smiles. I never got the food I ordered, and my wife's was cold and inedible. We left hungry.  Sorry, Red Robin. Next time we want an upscale burger, we'll give Smashburger a try.

I pass by Red Robin quite often and I finally decided to go and check it out tonight. When there is a wait, they have a system that sends you a text when your table is ready and also allows you to see how many people are in front of you all from your own smartphone. The system was very helpful and interesting and made my experience start out on a positive note. On to the food! We ordered a bowl of clam chowder, fish and chips, and a bacon burger. The food was very good, but did take a little too long to come out.  Clam chowder 4/5: came out quickly, was almost lukewarm, but tasted very good and had a lot of clams  Fish and Chips 4/5: took a little too long to come out, but was very moist and seasoned nicely Bacon burger 5/5: again took a little too long to come out, but was a very tasty and moist burger (definitely worth the wait), came with decent fries Overall, my first time at Red Robin was better than average. We only had to wait 2-3 minutes until we were seated and our friendly waitress came and checked on us quite often. From the other reviews I read, it is true that many tables are left uncleaned for quite some time and is one of the reasons that there are long lines outside, so come earlier to prevent the wait! I would definitely come back for another one of those amazing bacon burgers!

Came here on 7/11/2016. Sat in the Bar very busy only one server for the bar and patio. Server was great other wise this restaurant is the dirtiest Red Robin I have ever been to. Condiments are greasy, dirty with food all over them. Fries always take forever to get to your table, food was not HOT! Fries also tasted like cleaner or something just gross. This Red Robin has been the worst for years. Had to drive 10 miles to get a GREAT meal at the Rivermark Red Robin. Sad that I have to drive 10 miles when I could walk to a Red Robin that is close to me. To bad I would not send my worst enemy to the El Paseo Red Robin.

location: West San Jose, San Jose, CA
review: I love coming to this place!  Great service! Fair prices! Great food! Family friendly!  Ask for Annette's section, by far the best waitress in the world! Every visit we ask for her,  she's awesome!  And there's a bar! With TV's
My food was good.  They service was slow. I asked for a side of ranch it and my serve was not seen again. Nor was a refill on my drink.

Red robins, yummmmmmmmmm  Right ?! So we came here around dinner time, we have about 7 people. We see some openings but the hostess told us to wait, she wasn't specific or welcoming, she makes me uncomfortable honestly, so we just waited, about 10 mins we got seated, I ordered milkshake, bacon burger, it was good. Wasn't great, it's nothing special here except eat all the fries you can haha. Food took a while, our waiter is friendly and polite . Recently we went it was renovated, looks nice inside, won't be back for awhile. Parking is kinda hard it's in the same lot as amc 14

Red Robin.... yummmmmm! bottomless steak fries, freckled lemonade, and burgers! what isn't there to like?!?! I do like how they have gluten free buns available so I can actually enjoy a burger vs. only have the patty and lettuce at most burger joints.  Make the most out of it and sign up for the rewards program ;) They also use NoshList which adds you to a waitlist so you can see the time you've waited to be seated and you will get a text when your table is ready.  I wish all places had this available!

Was contacted by management and received a gift card to return and try again.  Glad to say service was excellent and their management professionalism to follow up on my earlier review was much appreciated.  Glad to be a customer again.....

Notice to all: Anyone who frequents the Saratoga Avenue Red Robin you'll want to BE ABSOLUTELY SURE you inspect your food before you put it in your mouth.  In a recent trip to Red Robin a Red Robin employee took a bite out of my hamburger before serving it up to me. On December 30th at 7 p.m. I visited Red Robin with family and I ordered a Bonsai Burger.  When it arrived, I called the waiter over to ask whether my burger is supposed to be a turkey burger, since I didn't have a menu in front of me and I thought I had ordered a beef burger.  He told me "Absolutely not, I'll send it back."  What he then came back with was a burger whose meat was so burned it was actually nothing but a charcoal disk.  Again I showed it to the waiter and his face looked shocked and he said "Oh that is really burned."  At the moment that he returned with a third burger I asked for a to-go box since everyone at my table had finished eating. At home, opening the to-go box I couldn't help but want to inspect the burger and this photo is what I found. Shocking!! I complained to the Red Robin management [transmitting the photo in separate calls and in-person conversations with this location's Red Robin Kitchen Mgr. Octavio Casas and Red Robin District Mgr. Chris Negley] and while Red Robin registered my complaint, my impression is (and I have been given no information to believe otherwise) that Red Robin is not taking this incident as a serious matter. Both Chris Negley and Octavio Casas told me that this location's General Mgr John King would call me to discuss and to this date I've never been given a call by Mr. King. Not at all sure that the Red Robin employee who took a bite out of my burger before serving it up to me is still employed there!! Translate the one star as a negative 5-star rating.

Horrible service! Not a place I would spend a dollar at. All the servers seem so annoyed while helping you. The wait time is always long and you're never guaranteed an actual wait time. Every time I have come to this location my food seems to get worse and worse. The food always comes out cold and never taste right.

We arrived about 530 on Wednesday during the summer, and waited 25 minutes for a table. We should've known there was a problem when reception areas (both inside and outside) were filled with people waiting, while two-thirds of the tables were open. The host was telling people that not enough servers were scheduled. Many customers walked in and left before putting their name on the waitlist. We were seated, and waited a very long time for our order to be taken, and another 25 minutes for water, and then 10 more minutes for drinks to arrive. The food took much longer. We thought seriously about leaving. The schedule was poorly managed on the day we were there. This restaurant is located in a shopping center with AMC movie theater. Not a recommended choice if you are working with a timeline, or eating with anyone unwilling to wait a long time.

I had never been to Red Robin and was excited to see what the commercials were about. It was NOT good. I asked the server what she suggests since it was our first time. Per her suggestions of a tavern burger, which would have two kid size burgers and a size, I chose the Pig n' out burger. My mother went with the Patty melt with Thousand Island dressing on a bun. 28 minutes later our food was served in the tiniest portions. Mine was one burger, NOT two, with "mixed fruit" of mandarin slice, (ya know the one in the can), squishy strawberries and about 1/4 of a cup worth. My burger was definitely kid size at $8.49 price. For 50 cents more I could have gotten a normal size one.... My mothers was a joke. Her buns, crumpled in her hands and fell apart since it was so old and stale. I asked if there was even thousand island on it. After dissecting her food we found a thimble full. She received a handful of fries and thankfully the waitress saw our disgust and brought another handful. If we weren't going to see a movie we would have returned the food. I wrote on the receipt, this was our first time and we will never be back. With so many competing Burger Joints my suggestion is to NOT waste your money here. Bill came to $34 plus some change. Not worth it at all. My biggest regret is not taking a picture to show everyone the joke food.

Food is ok for what it is.   However, service always seems spotty to us.   We went once last month (Nov 2015) and the host at the front was odd/rude.   He seemed to have a private joke going with himself and was sarcastic to customers.   Kristina was our server and didn't crack a smile until it was time for us to tally a tip.    She was efficient, though. We just visited again yesterday (Dec 22, 2015) at 2:30 p.m. and we thought it wouldn't be too hard to get a table after the lunch rush.   That was a mistake.  There was a long wait for a table yet the restaurant appeared to be about 1/3 empty.  There were more than enough tables available to seat all who were waiting.  I am guessing there wasn't enough wait staff to work the tables.   It was frustrating nonetheless.   The good thing is the hostess was very nice as was our waitress.   Service was really slow at our table but we chalked it up to maybe a wait staff shortage.    It took us 2 hours to have lunch.   Not sure if we'll return.   Definitely won't if we are in any sort of time constraint.

Right out the gate, server didn't get to us for almost 20 minutes for drink order. Fairly unprofessional when finally showing up. Food was kind of overpriced for what it was. Had to repeatedly ask for basics, i.e. Napkins, utensils. Pretty much not worth it.

Not the kind of place I generally go to, but went along with choice by larger group.  Gourmet hamburgers for all...server didn't have a clue as who got what burger when delivered and accompaniments screwed up In a couple of cases...condiments only provided on request.  As burgers go, okay, but nothing exceptional.  Meets expectations for a sit down burger joint.  Maybe I should skip eating with the group?

Awesome place for artery-clogging, obesity-inducing food!  I usually get the guacamole bacon burger and towering onion rings to share (both of which are mouthwaterning-ly AMAZING). This time I had the Avo-cobb-o salad with focaccia bread and balsamic dressing and bleu cheese on the side. The salad was delicious that I didn't really need to add any dressing at all. The grilled chicken was nice and tender too. The focaccia bread was just pita bread with some "focaccia" flavoring though.    Great and attentive customer service is consistent no matter which location I go to. What I love about Red Robin is that portions are huuuuge for the price! I always have enough for lunch/dinner the next day- maybe it's also because I stuff myself with the bottomless steak fries hehehe

I feel like lately I've been on a Red Robin roll.  For like years I hadn't been to one.  Within the past month, I've gone to 2 different RR's.  Say whhhat?  That's what happens when you are a girl just hanging out with another girl, you want some endless fries. My coworker and I, went on our 'girl's night out,' dinner and a movie.  As we waited for our movie at the AMC Saratoga, we walked over to RR to grab a bite.  I ordered a super light meal: side of mac n' cheese, broccoli and a happy hour strawberry Margarita.  Overall, I was pleased with my meal.  Bonus I got to eat the fries off my friend's dinner.  The mac n' cheese I'd have to say was really good.  They give you good size portions for the sides.  Plus they are cheap.   Tips: Order the campfire sauce to dip your fries into.  There is a free sauce listing inside your menu on the lower left corner.  Do it!

Walked in, was directed to a table, waited 5 min for a waiter who never came. Looked around for an available waiter to flag down, but eventually excused myself. Menu looked great, too bad i was too hungry to wait much longer.

In the midst of one of the worst dining experiences ever. Seated over 30 minutes ago, took 20 minutes and requests of 2 separate staff to get a high chair (which we finally just went and found on our own). Drink orders placed along with app order about 15 minutes ago. One app showed up, no drinks. No silverware. Server nowhere to be found.  Still no drinks. Still haven't been able to place an order for dinner. No manager anywhere to be found. This is ridiculous. Never again will this place get my business. Horrible, horrible, horrible!  Maybe they will go out of business soon and we can get a neighborhood restaurant that is worth our money.

i know red robin isn't the fanciest place in town, but man i love their burgers! this location is the one i visit most often, maybe a few times per year.  their service is the only thing that knocks them down a star (almost 2 stars). it can be pretty bad.  the girls at the front aren't always very welcoming.  but last time i was in, we were seated and just left there for a pretty long time before someone finally came over.  she wrote nothing down.  it would have been fine if she actually had the capacity to remember it all... but she didn't.  so some things didn't get ordered, other things were ordered wrong. food:  burgers. yum.  they cook them perfectly, and it's just the right size.  i go for the basic gourmet cheeseburger.  nothing really gourmet about it, and i'm ok with that.   mayo, pickles, tomato, cheese of choice, and my fav... shredded lettuce.  i think that's what gets me.  i'm not a fan of leaf lettuce on my burger.   oh, and onion rings... delicious.  the bbq dipping sauce is tasty. it's a family place, so you have to expect lots of kids.  but really, it's not obnoxious or anything.  good place for a laid back night.

I used to love this place, what the effff! Came here with my girlfriends before a movie. We gave ourselves an hour and a half, thinking it would be enough time. I should have known it was not going to be a good experience as soon as I talked to the hostess. She just looked down and with a very passive aggressive demeanor told us the wait time. We took open bar seating since we just planned on getting a drink and some fries. Our waitress comes over with water for two of us, and says she'll be back with one more for our other diner.  So 15 minutes later there's no sign of her and we don't have a lot of time.  We spot a guy in a blue dress shirt by the bar, and naturally assume he's the manager. We wave him over and tell him our orders haven't been taken yet. He just shrugs us off and says our waitress would be right with us. Great,  thanks. She finally shows up and takes our orders.  We get our appetizers a short while later but no drinks. We finish our food and still no drinks. We look over at the bar tender who looks genuinely bewildered. She's pouring beers for people at the bar and standing around with a confused look on her face. We flag down our waitress and ask about the drinks.  She goes to the bar and asks the woman behind the counter then walks away.  They finally come. Mines got a tiny piece of ice floating in it, with a big clump of salt stuck to the side of the glass.  We have to leave and didn't have any confidence in the manager to correct the situation anyway so we just get our check and leave. By the way, all the condiments, salt,  etc at our table and surrounding tables are all empty. Awful experience.

We've been here about a dozen times over the years. The service is always horrible. The servers are kind, but everything takes so long. Dinner at Red Robin should not take 2 1/2 hours.  We only go there because my kid loves mac and cheese and enjoys getting his free refills because the bowl is so small. We learned last night that they no longer do that.  Last night was our final visit because I found a fish bone or piece of nylon in my chicken sandwich. I told our server and the kitchen manager came out. She said they would make me another sandwich right away. I got it 20 minutes later and it was burnt.  Not going back.

This place is HORRIBLE!! Me and my family have been comming to this location for years and the service used to be amazing! We loved it but then a couple months ago management changed. Ever since, every single time we come here, we have had a horrible experience! When we get here it takes about 20 min to get our drinks, another 30 to get our food. Once we get the food the FRIES ARE ALWAYS COLD!! Never have we gotten fresh hot food here. AND they always screw up the order and give us something wrong. We always end up speaking to the manager which kindly takes off items from our bill sometimes. Honestly we love the food here so we keep comming back but yall NEED to do something about the service because it has gone downhill so fast.
Red robin went out of their way to find out why I was unhappy, so I think that is worth a lot, changing to 3 stars.

Horrendous experience after waiting for 50 Min with kids. The order was delivered wrong ...manager was obnoxious...we were never welcome. This is is my mast experience with Red Robin. The last time another floor manager asked me to give them another chance. So we showed up to be disappointed again. This will be my last time at Red Robin because it is it worth any of the effort that hoes into it for a customer. This is not the experience I expect to have in a place like this with the kids hence I will not go again ...ever.

The last time we came here I was disappointed greatly, wrote a giant complaint review and eventually erased it and went on with my life because I didn't want to deal with it. A few months later we come again and it's the typical stuff, rude uninterested, quoting people 30-45 minute wait for what was really about 15 min and half the back tables were empty. We sit and order our daughters food first so it comes out first then our drinks and later on our food. The food comes out not too long after and after a bit later of sitting my daughters macaroni and cheese comes out, apparently it takes longer to cook a tiny cup of Kraft macaroni than it does to make three hamburgers. Speaking of food, I thought my "pig out" burger was pretty gross, the meat like warm and soggy, cheap sliced government looking cheese, soggy bland bacon, the whole thing was mushy, bland and just disappointing, we used to live across from another red robin and their burgers were always hot, juicy yet crisp enough to have some bite to it, they were definitely two hand premium burgers, this was like a crappy old Burger King burger, I would almost prefer a good Big Mac or whopper over this, so I didn't finish it, the fries were a mix of decent fresh crunchy fries and old cold soggy fries,my daughters Mac and cheese was watery and bland (definitely in a whole class or two under elephant bar's) I never got a single refill of my drink, neither did any of my group, we did get a single refill of fries, but he offered to put them in right after we just got served and they didn't come out until we were receiving dessert. one of my biggest complaints from last time was the fact that they put those dumb terminals on each table trying to sucker people out of money for free cell phone games, it makes the waiters lazy and never come around, even to collect your money, it's like "you done? Well pay yourself". I don't even want to waste more time writing this, done with this place for the second time.

Favorite place to go for burgers! Endless baskets of fries and burgers that are fresh off the grill,  Mmm Mmm Mmm! The customer service is very good here and my order is usually always out in a decent time.  Only thing I give a THUMBS DOWN on is that I have to pay extra for my Thai Chilli sauce now!! Not happy about this at all.

I have been here many times ,I like their food. I was by the neighborhood yesterday I tried to called in the order to go but the phone number was busy  so I walked to order togo " I was there for 10 minutes and no one even acknowledge me " bad customer service I left without ordering!!!

We love coming to this location but my veggie burger yesterday was horrible. I'm not sure why but it felt soggy like the bread had been exposed to moisture. The Boca patty also seemed under cooked.  What's up with the new menu?  It just confuses people.

The food was okay. When we got here, we noticed a wait. We asked to sit in the bar area because generally service is usually the same as the service you get when sitting in the regular area. We came in around 7:15. It took about 20 minutes for our table to be cleared from the previous people and another 10 minutes to even get our order taken. We asked for fries to go with our drinks which we never received. Subpar service. I wish I would have read the Yelp reviews prior to coming here. Very disappointing.

I'll start by saying, I wanted to treat my little brothers out to eat. I was going to smash burger but I wanted it to be a little more special than just a regular fast food store. We didnt wait for long until we were finally seated. I felt really good having my 2 little brothers with me in the same table. I was asking them how their school was and such. Food was good, my server was very nice too. When we were done eating our meal, I have paid using their tablet and left some tip, walked out then came right back in because I have forgotten my phone. I came back, the reception didnt have my phone so she had to look for my server. When my server came he handed me my phone and underneath it was the tip I had given him, he says "Heres your money, I dont need it" turned his head around mugging me. Now what seems to be the problem is that, am i being judged as a person by how much i tip'd? Am I a bad person for not being able to galantly tip like the rich folks do? I mean my sallary is not that great also, Im barely able to get by with what Im getting. I took my brothers to eat despite having a budget, i havent even paid for some of my bills yet, and yet I was made to feel sad just for not tipping him the amount his expecting. I dont think im a cheap person, sometimes when i see homeless people i give them money, or when there is boy scouts/girl scouts I buy their goodies, and sometimes when I can, i treat my family out for dinner. What am i getting at here is that I did not appreciate what my server did, I do hope he's not doing that to any other customers, Im not the type to say fire the guy since we all are in need of a job, but what he did was wrong, and hurtful. Im a nurse and customer service is a must in my profession, receiving gifts, tips or any such is not acceptable. As a nurse we get cursed at, yelled at, and sue'd, or even get our license revoke in worst case scenario, but we still smile because at the end of the day at least were making every person we care for cared for.  I will not be coming back to any other Red Robins Restaurant after this experience. It wasnt a very pleasant experience. Edit: Food was great, my brothers had a fun time. They thanked me for the treat right when I dropped them home. That is very fulfilling to me, as long as my brothers had a good dinner, it is all I could ask. As for me, the server left a bad taste in my mouth. Sorry, but Im not sorry, if any one were to be put in my spot they would feel the same.

We were seated outdoors since there was a crazy wait for seating inside.  We ordered the Red Robin burger with egg and bottomless fries.  The service was a bit spotty since it was really crazy but it won't deter me from going back to try other items on the menu.

"Doggie entitlement mentality" runs rampant around here.  We realize that.  California realizes it too, so this summer the governor signed a law that allows pet owners to bring their pets along to a restaurant as long as they remain on the patio.  It is still illegal to bring any animal inside a restaurant, unless it is a service animal. So imagine our surprise and dismay when we went to this Red Robin location a couple of nights ago and were seated in the dining room, only to discover that a woman at the table next to us had her smallish (Pomeranian?) dog under the table.  She had even put two little dishes (one filled with dog food and one with water) on the floor under the table, so this little prince (or princess?) could have its meal, too, though this did not stop the little creature from continually begging for scraps (which were occasionally given...yuck), nor from stepping in its water dish a few times as it wandered around beneath the table.  This was clearly a pampered family pet, not any kind of service animal.  WHAT was it doing in a restaurant? I should mention that the outside temperature that evening was very mild.  It would have been entirely comfortable for this lady and her doggie to sit on the patio and LEGALLY enjoy their meal.  It would even have been perfectly fine for her to leave her precious pet in the car for an hour or so...it was NOT hot and would not have posed any danger to the animal. Allowing people to bring their pets into a restaurant is just irresponsible and cowardly behavior by the restaurant's team and management.  I realize that people in this area can get pretty worked up if they are told that their precious pets cannot go everywhere and do everything that humans do...but that's just tough.  Managers can and should stand up to them and uphold the law for the benefit, health, and enjoyment of the other restaurant guests!  If a guest really believes that their dog should be treated like family, then they should either eat on the patio where their pets are legally allowed, or stay home and eat at the family (and dog) table! A disappointing and gross experience.  We expected better from Red Robin.
Good food, but service has gone downhill. My family were first seated without menus, then it took at least 15 minutes for someone to take our drink orders and bring menus.

Went on a Saturday at lunch time. Pretty busy so wait is 12-15 minutes to get your food. Onion ring shorty was 4-5 stars. $6.99 double burger special is a great deal. Ordered no salt fries and they came out perfect. A good change from in and out. I wanted the burger medium rare but they only cook one way so med well to well done. We'll be back.

After the hike at Big Basin, we came to eat lunch here.  Probably not the best place to eat, but heck.....I wouldn't have eaten here if it wasn't for the hike! :) For a table of 8, we had to wait 15 minutes even though it was 2:30, but once we were seated, the server was quick and attentive.  We asked for fries before our food came out since we were starving.  I had my favorite: the California Chicken Sandwich with no mayo on a Whole Grain Bun.  Normally, I would eat half and I'm full, but this time, I ate the whole damn thing and I didn't feel guilty at all!  The sandwich was tasty and the fries were addicting.  Doesn't help that they're bottomless either!

Even though it's the week before Christmas, and everywhere is busy, this Red Robin let us down. Prior visits have been satisfactory. The longish wait for a booth was expected, and about a dozen people were in the lobby. We waited perhaps twenty minutes. Not too bad. The booth was in the bar area. The wait person, Juan, was not friendly or engaged. Our drink order took a long time (perhaps another ten minutes), he said the bar was backed up; but we watched the bar tender casually washing and wiping glassware, yet still promptly serving customers on the bar stools. One drink came first, then Juan took our food order. Right out of the menu book, nothing complex. After a reminder, the second drink arrived.  Then we didn't see Juan near our booth for sometime, perhaps another twenty minutes. We flagged down a staff member and out came Juan with our cold burgers and cold fries. I told Juan we'd not eat those, he shrugged and vanished. We asked the person at the hostess station for the manager (we were very tempted to just cut and run). Well, Juan got to him first! "I sincerely apologize" over and over. Then a new one "Why didn't you tell me sooner?" Really dude? This is your restaurant. If you don't know when your customers are being ignored, or your food is cooling off at the serving line, or your servers are "phoning it in" you might consider another career! We didn't go there to manipulate "free dessert" - another lame offer made to bring us back. A juicy burger, an a little holiday people watching, was why we came in. Bad service and bad attitude is why we won't come back! Visit here at your own risk.

Do not eat here.... Came in today and literally watched our food in the window for 20 minutes watched the manager walk passed it and run other people's food...super bad service will not come back which sucks because I really like red robin.

Looks like extremely long wait times, and bad service is a common theme at this particular Red Robin. 'Kristen K' was "supposedly"(this word was NOT chosen loosely) our server. Aside from irrefutably not wanting to be anywhere near this establishment, it simply should not take 40 minutes to whip up a side salad(yes a side salad). With there being multiple locations within a 15 mile radius, we will definitely not be back.

Wow, this place has gone downhill real fast since they changed things up and changed management. I've been going here since they first opened but after my service here tonight, it's my last. It's really irritating how they tried to remodel it by looking so upscale, especially with how they plate food. I ordered a BBQ chicken burger and my parents got two different salads. I bit into my chicken burger and it was COLD and RAW. My parents salads had burnt chicken and old lettuce. After that, we just decided to give everything back. I have never had any problems until everything changed and I wish the old staff was still there. Good luck if you go. I suggest cutting your burger in half before eating it.

Food here is alright. It's not good, not bad. My go-to is the Whiskey River BBQ Chicken Sandwich. So much flavor and so messy, but so good. Best thing about Red Robin is their bottomless steak fries and their bottomless strawberry lemonades :) Make sure you tell your server exactly what you want all when s/he is at your table or else you may never have a chance to flag them down. This place gets pretty hectic on weekends and it's very frustrating when you want more water, extra condiments, refill or the bill.

Waited 40 minutes for a table. When we were seated the place was less than half full. Servers just standing around. The bottomless fries were under cooked and to try and get more of them was next to impossible. The server was nice enough, just super slow. Our burgers were cold when we got them and the buns were mushy. Will never be back here again, too bad.

3.5 stars for food, 4 stars for service & hospitality. Burgers here are definitely gourmet- flavorful, filling portions and a great variety to choose from. I tried their "sauteed shroom" burger with a vegan patty. Mushrooms on my burger tasted delicious and patty was juicy too. Bun was fresh. Substituted steak fries for sweet potato fries- which were BOMB! We also tried their shakes- banana  and cookie dough- both were delicious. Onions rings are average. I like that Red Robin has tons of choice in their menu. Even if you are not a burger person- you will find something for your tastebuds (sandwiches, wraps, appetizers, shakes, desserts). Also, they have the ability to customize their menu- you can substitute a salad or coleslaw or sweet potato fries for their regular fries (all burgers are served with bottomless fries). If you are a vegetarian you can turn any burger into veggie burger by just substituting it with a vegan patty. They also offer a variety of buns to choose from.  Then why am I holding back one star? I wish my food came out a little more hot than it did (at best my burger was luke warm, with cheese slice just softened but not melted enough; onion rings were also at room temperature). Service here was excellent. Kaylee was our server. She has a good sense of humor and is very attentive. She got our order right and refills were served promptly. She checked on us regularly to ensure a great dinning experience. I would certainly recommend this place especially if you have a large group since seating here is plenty (indoors and outdoors) and wait time is generally limited. Decor is typical of an upscale burger joint and atmosphere is lively. Prices are at par with other gourmet burger joints. All in all, a good dining experience!

The service was great. The ambiance is pretty chill. MY food was great. There's just one thing. The person I was with found a hair in his burger. When we brought it to our waiters attention, he apologized sincerely and brought it back to the kitchen. Soon after, the manager came to our table to apologize... something I did realize was that the hair we found was very similar to the manager's, that was pretty disturbing.  In the end the second burger came out great and he finished it without another problem. But something I wasn't satisfied with is that they charged us for the hair burger and the second burger. We ended up paying for both but I'm really upset at how we have to pay for someone else's mistake and a burger with the managers hair in it.  Definitely picking a different chain red robins next time. Last time I was here there was a whole party of adults with their children and they let them run around popping balloons & scaring the other diners. Management did nothing to stop the disturbance and a hostess kept supplying the balloons.
It took a very long time just to get our drinks. The wait for our food was beyond ridiculous. Food was mediocre. Do NOT get the French onion soup. The cheese is like plastic.

The food here is fantastic! Bottomless steak fries with burgers too! My favorite place to eat in Saratoga. It has excellent service too! Ask for Billy as your waiter, he is hands down the fastest:best waiter I've ever had (counting other restaurants too) refills usually arrive before I've finished my drink, and asks if more fries are required often when I'm around 3 left or so.
Plain awful. Avoid at all cost. Expensive, low-quality burgers. Slow service coupled with long wait times. There's absolutely nothing good about this place.
Great place for a vegetarian like myself to get a veggie burger. Friendly staff and fast service!

Guilty pleasure here- I love their guacamole bacon burgers. I am not a fan of chain restaurants, but I am a fan of Red Robin. I have been countless times and to several differnt locations and they never disappoint. I always get the same thing - that guac burger. I have seen people eat salads here and they look good, but come on, they make gourmet burgers. Time to cheat on the diet.  This location is as good as any. Good service, friendly staff, clean, and usually quick.

We had a surprisingly good lunch with the kids a couple of Saturdays ago.  Despite the place being packed, we were seated within 10 minutes and our food came promptly.  I ordered my burger medium, and it arrived medium--not well done like most places.  We ordered one refill of fries, which was plenty.  Our server Jimmy was hopping like mad, but still attentive and friendly.  Generally this is not my kind of restaurant, but choices are limited when there are kids involved, and Red Robin exceeded expectations on this visit.  We'll be back.

I've come here time and time again but have to admit there have been less than stellar lunches and dinners here.  Today I came here for dinner with my Mom. We waited ten minutes and we're seated at a small booth. Our waitress, Sara, came by shortly to take our order. She was warm, friendly and efficient. I ordered a drink from the bar, the bar was out of Disaronno. Bummer, I get a soda. Two out of our three appetizers get to the table. Sara apologizes, admits that she forgot to put the order in for the third, and races back to the kitchen. When our burgers came, they were all wrong. We didn't want pickle relish and avocado added. We sent them back. Sara came back afterwards with our corrected burgers and third appetizer. While eating my Mom discovered she had no avocado.  We give up on trying anymore. The manager comes by, in addition to Sara, to apologize for getting so many things wrong with our order. When we got the blithely compared our burgers and my drink. Overall, we've definitely had better there. Hopefully management works out the kinks in the kitchen so food is made how the customer wants and brought in a timely manner. Sara was a great waitress. Most of the problems we had weren't because of her.

Our first time at Red Robin "Gormet" Burgers was lackluster, to say the least. For some reason we decided to come back for a second time and, quite honestly, it was worse than the first time but our our return visit the service also lacked. The only good thing about this place was the amazing desert - I think they call it "Mud Pie".  I might go back just for that if I wanted to eat myself sick again on a HUGE slice of chocolate, Oreo, caramel awesomeness.  But, sadly, I most likely will not because the rest of everything else there kinda sucked.

I have been here many times over the past 2 years, and my favorite server is always Crystal (Cristal? Krystal? I can't remember how she spelled it). She always greets my family and I with a smile and is always attentive.She doesn't hover over your table, but is always near by watching to see if you need anything. Doesn't hurt that she is so nice. Last time i was there she was bartending now, so we sat at the bar. Same as always, great service and great food. The food is always good there, even when i try something new. She always give great recommendations and we always have a great time.  Always loved the drinks from the bar here, and the burgers are second to none here. Cooks always do an excellent job each and every time! We have had the other servers there, who are very nice as well, just something about Crystal that makes our experience a memorable one each time! Keep up the great work!

I will star this review by saying that I am a grown up and I went here with 5 friends (all also grown ups) and we thoroughly enjoyed ourselves! The food was good and there was no compromising to make this adult friendly... sure, you can hear them singing their "happy, happy birthday" song to the 5 year old at the booth next door... but that is part of the joy of the experience.  You can also see the Thursday Night Football game on... so they are trying to be "family friendly" but NOT to become a gymboree and cater only to the little ones (which I can appreciate) They have kiosks on the tables where you can only order appetizers or dessert (but not your meal)... I guess they are experimenting with doing away with waiters and have not gone all the way on that???  It was a little weird... however getting to split the bill at the table and pay separtely at the table with the machine was AMAZING!!!  This revolutionizes splitting the bill (you literally select what you had and it all gets split out...)  That itself is worth 5 stars!!!
Food service extremely slow, waiting half an hour for appetizers is ridiculous NOT COMING here again.

About a month ago, our group of five decided to go to Red Robin for dinner.  As usual, we had to wait awhile to be seated.  This was expected and not a problem.  When we were seated, we didn't see our waiter for quite awhile.  When he finally showed up, he took our drink and food orders.  The drinks showed up about 15 minutes later.  Dinner showed up about 10 minutes later.  Two of the meals were incorrect and had to be sent back.  One because he asked for no mayo, and it had mayo.  When he got his "new" hamburger, it was the old one with a new bun, however, the hamburger was now cold.  But, all the other burgers were only luke warm. The second meal was sent back because gluten free was ordered due to allergies and that's not what she got.  Her new meal showed up when the rest of us were almost finished.  However, the worst thing about the meals were the fries.  They were awful, hard and dry.  We asked for a new batch of fries and was told that "they are all that way, we are having a problem with the supplier".  Well, the fries are why we go to Red Robin.  I don't know why they would serve fries that they knew were bad.  I think they should have told us prior to ordering that they were having problems with the fries.  We could have ordered something else, like onion rings.  So, we didn't eat much of the "all you can eat fries" because they were inedible.  Also, just about when we were about to leave, our server asked if we wanted refills on our drinks.  By then, we just wanted to leave.  This has to be the worst experience we've had at Red Robin.  None of us are planning to go back anytime soon.  By the way, I did send an email to the corporation regarding the awful fries.  Their response, "we will forward the email to the manager".  That's the last I've heard.  So, the restaurant management doesn't care and neither does the corporation.

The foods is good when they get your order right!! Which is worth a star. Got a big order today and our food was cold and half of a plate was missing! I asked how many chicken strips came with the clucks and fries she said 4 so my coworker and i wanted to split it and when i opened it up there was only 2!! I called to ask management if i could come back to get the amount that was missing and i was put on hold for a while so i gave up. Not impressed at all and will not be ordering togo from here again

The service was 'ok' .... My disappointment was with the food ... first off the burger wasn't served in the traditional 'RR paper pocket that makes it easier to eat. Next thing ... I asked for 'medium' and it was served 'well done' ... lastly ... I ordered extra BBQ sauce on the side .... instead they skipped the BBQ sauce on my burger as if I had asked for the sauce on the side. Very disappointed!!!!! Will not go back. On the plus side the servers were nice and attentive and the beer was great. So I am changing my review from 1 star to 2.

The last time I came here was almost a year ago so I decided to bring my cousins here for their first time since they are all big fans of fries.  The burgers were smaller than I remembered but the bonzai burger was still pretty yummy. My mom liked her mushroom burger too. Warning: We're not really burger people so it's hard for me to compare with other burger places. We upgraded two of our regular fries to the sweet potato fries for 80 cents (still bottomless though!). The sweet potato fries were a huge hit amongst my family, parents included. Try it plain before you decide to add extra stuff on the fries because I liked it just the way it was (although I have to say that the Red Robin seasoning is yum-o, but way salty).  We came on a random Tuesday night around 7pm so I was surprised that there was such a long waiting time. We had a 7 person party and had to wait close to 40 minutes before we were seated. Red Robins doesn't take reservations either so if you're planning on coming with a 5+ party, I would come earlier than expected to put your name down and go shop across the street at Target or something.
My server had amnesia I swear. Much of our order was forgotten, and on the second round after asking for correction the same happened. Food was decent, not as good as I have had at other locations.

Our visit was 2/9 at about 7:45pm First off I want to start by saying this review is based off of the staff around me not my server, our server Alexa was very attentive and very respectful. Alexa gets a 5 star for the great service despite the other staffs behavior.  The first this that really shocked me and really gave me a sour taste in my mouth was Pricilla The hostess was walking with Amanda a Server and stopped next to us against the shelf where the lego Burger and fries are and Amanda whispered something to Pricilla and then Pricilla responds with a very loud, "Oh heeeeellllllllll no, I'm not f***ing doing that" and it really blew me away when I heard that come out of her mouth. Later right before we were leaving Pricilla became a puppy dog to Amanda just to keep talking to her and laughing.  Pricilla also was so stuck talking to the busser (who was clearly doing his job) and she was touching him and pointing at him with a pen and was going on for a good 3 minutes, while a couple is standing at the front waiting to be seated. The manager Nicole who I guess has only been a manager for a short period of time, which is no excuse. Nicole seats them and on her way walking to seat them gave Pricilla very dirty look, which shouldn't be happening at all.  Nicole the manager started off too friendly with her employees and then as the night went on she became increasingly rude with her staff, making rude smart remarks with very rude facial expressions, and while expediting the food she was being really rude to the kitchen manager clearly yelling and being very repetitive, which I can clearly hear everything she's saying and can see all of her facial expressions. I'm sorry but in my 5 years of coming here I have never had such a bad experience with staff.  Thank you Alexa for the great service and not falling into the carelessness of the other staff.

Don't even know why I gave this location another shot. The first time (about 2 months ago) service was mind numbingly slow and my food arrived cold. Not a good experience, at all. This time was even more frustrating. We didn't get seated with any type of smile or graciousness. Then it took once again waiting, waiting, and more waiting to get drinks and orders taken. I look around and oh, the hostess is chatting loudly at her front desk and over at the kitchen all the servers are talking and laughing loudly with each other....in fact both areas were having louder conversations than the actual patrons it seemed. Me and my guest sat looking pretty upset and got no acknowledgement or apology. I can understand a wait when it's busy, but at this time there was, maybe, five occupied tables? No excuse for the plain disregard for customers. I also went to the restroom and it was disgustingly dirty and zero empty tables had been bussed or cleaned and had used plates and empty cups. Overall, it was a week night and it was evident there are a bunch of kids working here who could care less about giving any type of customer service or keeping a clean and presentable restaurant environment. Waste of money and time.  Never, ever, EVER again...

my wife and I go here more times than we would care to admit. what can I say? I like burgers, fries and beer. sue me. look, they make a good burger.  bottomless garlic fries? yes please big fat glass of blue moon? you betcha the only reason they get 3 stars is because 75% of the time their service is lacking one way or another. not horrible, but there is usually some service hiccup that make the dining experience less than perfect. doesn't matter enough to me to stop going there. the place is close by and their food and drinks make me happy.
Nice Red Robin. Gets crowded due to proximity with the Cinema halls. Slightly more wait times than average because of that.

2 star because of service. I loved Red Robin. I used to visit often in the past because the service, presentation and taste of the food were beyond my expectations. I'm not quite sure what happened recently, but every time I've come here, there is such a long wait for any of our food orders (at least 30min). It's saddening that my experience here is not the same any more. I'm sorry Red Robin! I'll try again sometime.

OK I admit RR has good burgers - but 45 minutes and still no burger.  At 35 min we managed to get some french fries - ate all the fries - still no burger.  We finally left and went to Pizza My Heart.  Finally food and good food!  If there is a 45 min or longer wait after ordering tell me this is going to happen when I come in.  Don't leave us sitting forever at our - table for 2 hamburgers!!!!  That is not acceptable:(((

Saturday evening my girlfriend and I went to the Saratoga Red Robin about an hour before our movie was to start. After being seated we waited quite a while before we saw our server. She ordered a prime rib burger with tea, and I had the chicken crisp salad with a glass of water. The server dropped the tea and water as he hurried by after a while, but there was no sugar or sweetener on our table or any unoccupied tables nearby. After trying to get the attention of any of the wait staff, it was finally resolved by a trip to the bar and bringing the sweetener back to our table. Interesting that they no longer have sugar, just sweetener. Our food finally arrived and my girlfriend was delivered a french dip sandwich, not the prime rib burger she ordered. The food runner had to go find our server. Can you say: wait another 5 minutes? Of course he said he would take it back and get the right food but by this time we had only a few minutes to get to the movie. He told the manager and when she came by she asked if we wanted the burger, we said no, we have to go to the movie now. Manager asked if we wanted to take it to go. Was she unaware that you can't take food into an AMC theater? Did she think we would leave it in a car for 2 hours to grow bacteria and get all soggy? We deferred her offer to take it to go and she said she was sorry about the mix up. Then, in a tone that came across like she was doing me a favor, she said she would take it off the bill. Duh, did she really think I was going to pay for a burger I never received? I think when they screw up this bad that she could have offered a certificate for a burger in the future or some kind of compensation because the snack bar at the theater was my lady's only recourse after this happened.
