Will I go back?  If I have any time constraints, probably not.

Just tried to have dinner here. What an awful experience. We were seated after a 16 minute wait, our server took our order and we didn't see him again for 45 minutes later when we asked to check on our food.  After another 10 minutes the burger and hush puppies came out to the table. The burger had been over  microwaved and brought out.  It was so hot from the inside out and the lettuce was nuked to a wilted weed. The hush puppies were cold. Server showed no remorse. Horrible food and service.
Burger was ok, a little over seasoned for me. Cooked perfectly, fries were good. Would come again for a quick burger,  but not for a while.

I've been coming to this Red Robin for over 10 years, usually once or twice a year, and I'm finally writing a review.  First off, I really like the food here. The whiskey BBQ burger is my goto burger, subbing onion rings for fries and having at least one friend get fries so we get bottomless fries :) the jungle shake is pretty good too as I have recently discovered and red robin now offers some mini patty options for a dollar or two less.  Pricing is average, ~$10 a burger with fries. Nothing special.  The service on the other hand is totally hit or miss. In recent trips, I'd have to say I'm not impressed and last time I went the waiter never gave us any fries even though we asked for them the moment we sat down. He said he'd get them twice but never did, and it was a slow afternoon so that really disappointed me. In olden days, the staff would practically force feed us fries and keep them coming - that's what drew me to Red Robin in the first place and kept me going over the years. I even went for 3 of my birthdays in a row in high school! The location next to Amc 14 Saratoga recently remodeled and it looks pretty nice now. Food tastes delicious still. But the staff recently hasn't been too hot, which is why I'm rating this as 3 stars, because it really used to be the staff and fries that set red robin apart for me, and without it, I could easily go elsewhere. My friends feel the same and it's harder to get a group to go to red robin anymore :/ nonetheless, I would still say it is worth a trip every now and then! Carry on!

Always been a fan of Red Robin. The Royal burger with the fried egg on it is the best, however I wish they would bring back the Godfather burger! And no visit is complete without getting a side of poppy seed honey mustard for your fries! Its like liquid crack!

I've been to 4 RRs, on both coasts and really like them in general.  I'll be brief, this one was not like the other 3: -  extremely slow service, place was busy but not crazy -  order was wrong -  replacement order was a lukewarm burger, cheese didn't even melt -  no utensils delivered Mgr comped us the incorrect order but we (2 of us) were there well over an hour, (took for-ev-er)... ridiculous. Not going back here, will go to the RR in Rivermark.

Fast service at the bar during Happy Hour. Simply Chicken Sandwich w/o bun: It was ok.  With just the chicken, lettuce, and tomato, it's a pretty plain meal as is.  I got a side salad instead of fries which was plain, but what I asked for. Chicken Caesar Wrap: Tasty.  I like the creamy Caesar dressing.  The portion was huge.

I came here for the first time in a really long time recently and I was pretty impressed and left with a happy belly! I had a regular cheese burger with avocado and got ciabatta bread instead of the regular buns. Delish!! Also their fries were so good! They say it's bottomless but I promise you don't need more than that first serving! They also have this dangerous bottle of seasoning on the table.....!!! I swear I used more than a few tablespoons on the fries and burger! DANGEROUS but SO GOOD! I also got their Freckled Lemonade which was yummy too!

Two words to describe this restaurant - CRAP HOLE!!!!!! This place is AWFUL! The only reason they are getting one star is because our waitress was nice....we actually felt sorry that she had to work in this crap hole of a restaurant! We had to wait 40 minutes for a table. It took ONE HOUR and TEN MINUTES to get our food! I got a salad that was wilted and soggy, I barely ate any of it. One of us got the WRONG HAMBURGER!!!!!! He had to wait an additional 20 minutes to get the right burger and it came with the WRONG type of fries. He ordered garlic fries and got the regular soggy gross fries that they serve there. I am AMAZED that this dump is still I business. Please please please (I'm begging you) don't go to this place. A total waste of time, money and crappy food to boot!!! UPDATE: RED ROBIN CONTACTED ME REGARDING THIS AND GAVE ME A GIFT CARD SO I WILL TRY IT AGAIN AND GIVE ANOTHER REVIEW

Arrived here on a Saturday evening, 5: 30pm. Given that it is a busy weekend night, we expected for a wait time before being seated. We had to wait 1/2 hr to be seated. Once we were seated, our waitress greeted us. She was very nice and accommodating. We all (3 of us) ordered shakes before we ordered our meals. Water came right away but the shakes took about 20minutes. At this time, we each ordered out meals. The food took about 40 minutes to come! The waitress knew we were waiting long and was nice enough to give us some fries to snack on while we waited. My fiancé ordered another beer shake with an extra shot. When this came he said he was still not able to taste the alcohol. Word of advice: order drinks at the bar directly to make sure you get what you pay for. Alone, he spent $18 on drinks and they were watered down and not mixed well. In addition, there was a charity event going on ( sheriffs raising $ for special Olympics), and they would go to every table and ask for money. It was really uncomfortable and I would see them scout families. To make a long story short, waitress good- food alright, alcohol drinks boo, and the harassment at tables was annoying!

I've been coming to this Red Robin since after they replaced the Cucina Cucina that was previously there.  Mostly every time we've gone, we received great customer service, though, once in a while (as with every restaurant type establishment) the service was a little slow.  This last time that my girlfriend and I went, we decided to share a burger. We waited for about 25 minutes after we ordered, until our server came to our table. He told us that there had been a mix up with our order and that they were making it. Meanwhile, he brought us a basket of fries and told us our meal would be taken care of.  Within minutes, he returned with the burger, and left us to eat. We realized that the burger had been made normal(both my gf and I aren't a fan of the pickle relish), and asked if he could bring a bun without the pickle relish. He apologized again and brought his manager who informed us that they'd be making a second burger, and a bun for the burger on our table as well as a gift card for next time.  Talk about above and beyond.  Of course, by this time, we'd been there for about 45 minutes and were starving, however, her genuine concern for our meal by checking up on us a few times after they brought the second burger was reason enough to write a review. We left our server a tip and left with a smile on our faces.  Good Job Red Robin. You have the right people in charge at this location!

This is a fun restaurant. Don't come here for gourmet food or perfect service.  It is just reasonably priced burgers and fries. The drinks are pretty good too. I am vegetarian and the veggie burger options (they offer two different patties) are great.  I always tell my wife you see the real California here. It isn't just Silicon Valley techies who look like douche bags. Since it is closer to Campbell, normal humble people come here. It gives it an honest vibe. Minus one because the wait on weekends sucks.  It's also nice that they have lots of TVs playing sports.

These folks do a great job. My gf and I typically get their food to go, which is always well packed and still warm by the time we drive 10 minutes back to the house. The bartenders are always great to us, and the entire staff feels helpful overall.  Definitely consider joining their FREE rewards club (one aside-we visited several times before a bartender mentioned its existence) and you get a FREE burger in your bday month, plus other rewards if you eat their frequently. A note about my reviews: I only give FIVE STARS for places that absolutely blow me away and rock my world. FOUR stars means a place I would frequent and feel comfortable suggesting to anyone. THREE stars is a place with potential or an occasional visit. TWO stars means we had a neutral or slightly negative experience. ONE star means we will never return.

We arrived tonight, a Saturday, at 8 pm and were quoted a 30-minute wait time.  They called us shortly before the 30 minutes.  Hostess sat us at a table with a dirty seat, and a crayon still on it from the last guests. The waiter came over and asked about drinks.  I said that we definitely want 4 waters.  My husband and kids ordered milkshakes.  He brought only one water for me.  My husband ordered three more waters.  He brought the shakes over and again, my husband ordered three more waters.  He brought half the waters in the freckled lemonade glasses and half in their giant pint-style glasses. He took the order and that was the last we saw of our "server". The food took too long, and was not hot.  We had to ask the food runner to bring some cutlery and napkins.  No one came over to check on us to see if we needed drink refills, fry refills, find out if out food was okay.  Nothing.  I've never seen anything like it.  Also, none of the other staff made eye contact with us.  I was trying to get someone's attention, anyone, to get a drink refill, but no one even looked our way.  Finally, my husband had to get up and ask the hostess to have someone bring us a bill. I think we fell throught the cracks at Red Robin tonight.  All I can think is that our served got phased, or he started the table for another server - I don't know, but something went wrong and we got the short end of the stick. Then, the very casually dressed manager came over, did not identify himself as a manager, and said "It looks like you're all done here, can I get anything else for you?"  We said that we'd like the bill and a soda refill.  He brought the soda refill, apologized that I had to wait more than 15 minutes for a refill, and then said he was going to adjust the check and find out who was responsible for this.  Buddy, we don't care who is responsible, we just want to go home.  It was nice of him to take a random $13.30 amount off the check, but it took another 10 minutes to get out of there.  He dropped the check and said, "I know you want to go, so....." and kind of trailed off.  My husband was reaching into his pocket for his wallet as the manager was saying that, and yet he left the table and never came back.  We finally got the attention of the server who was waiting on a table next to ours and she ran our check.   This location was so good right after they remodelled the place about a year ago.  They were so on it.  The staff was smiling, upbeat, professional, following all the steps of service and they weren't raffling off the dishes when they got to the table, they just put them in front of who ordered them, which was very impressive for a casual family restaurant.  Well, that's all gone out the window now.  After tonight's lack of service and the quality of the food on our two most recent visits, we won't be back.  Next time it'll be Island's, or Five Guys, or SmashBurger, or The Counter, or one of the other MANY burger choices in the area for us.

Came here at 7pm on a Saturday night and the place was packed, but our party of 5 was seated after about 20 minutes.  It took a while for someone to come get our orders, eventually a manager came by and let us know our waiter was busy, so he took our orders.  Service was attentive and timely after that.   We came here for our 9 year old's birthday-he requested bugers-and everyone left happy and full.  I had the blackened chicken sandwich, which had a good flavor and a slight kick.  Everyone else had burgers and said they were great.  They even comped the Birthday Boy's burger even though he refused to order off the kid's menu (he wanted something bigger....and did eat the whole thing).   All in all, I would absolutely come back here for a good, family friendly meal.
My son and husband love this place. Good selection of burgers. Love their fries. All around good place for a family dinner night with a young child. My favorite burger is the burnin love

If I know it's going to be busy, I make reservations but I usually try to go when it's not rush hour. I get the Whiskey River BBQ Burger almost every time. It's one of the burgers with the most calories, but it is just BOMB. Also, get GARLIC FRIES with CAMPFIRE SAUCE! Sometimes they charge extra for the garlic fries, but if you have a table of at least 5, they usually don't (you can also order a chicken sandwich to get garlic fries). The Bottomless Freckled Lemonade is usually great when you are thirsting for some sweet strawberry lemonade. They just keep em comin' and they're tasty!

Arrived at 5 pm and sat at the bar for a drink while waiting for friends. Bartender completely slammed with to go orders, making ice cream sundaes, milk shakes, everything but liquor drinks. No one helping him. Really? He made me a Bloody Mary 20 mins later which was sweet? Let me say that only one other person was sitting at the bar and restaurant only one third full. When my friends arrived, we sat at a table. Service was good, food mediocre. Crab burger ok. Bacon cheese burger meh. Bottomless fries were not refilled . Management seems to be nonexistent at this location . Maybe we just hit them at an odd hour or maybe hard earned money can be spent elsewhere

I stopped by before a movie for dinner with my BF and his son. We were seated in a booth in the bar area. After about 5 minutes I noticed an  unpleasent smell coming from underneath my table. I reached down to straighten my pants and my hand was partially covered with FECES!  I ran into the bathroom and washed off the feces off the leg of my jeans.   My Bf was explaining to the servers why we were leaving and they just kind of looked at us like we were crazy or something. No body bothered to look under the table at all. They just sat someone else there at that booth after we left.  I know a lot of chain rest. are very dirty, but this was Horrible!!  Good bye forever RED Robin
This place has great sweet potato fries! good burgers and overall staff. they seem nice and come by quickly always friendly and attentive. i love the guacamole burger

I am rating this a 5 star for more than just the food. My friends and I have been coming to this location at a minimum one a week since the place opened, about 6/7 years ago now i believe. I remeber the opening day even, wasn't even that crowded. I have had good serice, bad service, ok service, and amazing service, servers have their on and off days, so i do not hold that against them. Food -- I have tried everything on their menu more than once, throughout all these years now, and I must say they are consistant with their food, in all the years I have been going I have only sent 1 burger back, and it was because it was cold, nothing else has ever been sent back. Service -- This is why i come here, I could be the "Norm" of this place where everyone knows my name. I am ok with that, being a single diner many times this place treats me the same as a family of 4 or more, that alone will keep me coming back. I do have my favorite servers as well Anna, Hailey, Seth, Rachael S, to name a few, and several who have moved on through the years as well.  One bit of warnign though, lunch service for food coming out seems to bit slower than the dinner food. The menu is the same, so beats me why it is that way!

MARKETING GENIUS Because of RR commercials, my coworkers and I run around our office all day going:  ME- "Reddddd ROBIN"  Coworker- "YUMMMM!!!!" And we do it so much we get hungry, then what happens when we get hungry??? BOOM You got RR on the brain, time for a burger and freckled lemonade, son

Really good food. Extremely long wait though. Waited an hour for our food and we saw it sitting in the kitchen for 30 minutes. I was tempted to just go and get it myself. Service is sometimes good. They are sometimes really nice or complete assholes.

The burgers are awesome. And bottomless fries are even better. I find the draft beers to be watered down. The last couple of times I've been here the service was great. This place gets packed quick, so come early.   Sign up for the Red Royalty Rewards program.

I went here with my 2 kids for dinner they said it would be a 30 minute wait but it ended up being 45 minutes. We ordered our appetizers and our drinks but my daughters chocolate milkshake never came. Our main entree came but they messed up on my sons order and it took longer. By the end of the meal I was already fed up with all this waiting and them messing up my order. The bill came and I looked over my receipt they charged me for the chocolate milkshake that never came. Told the server I didn't receive it and said sorry and she took it off. Bad service.

Super slow service. Waited 28 minutes for two burgers, and they were simple burgers; just burger, lettuce, tomato and bun.  Server didn't let is know if burgers were coming soon or offer us fries to munch on while we waited. He just kept walking by and looking at us.  Burgers were good but the service may prevent me from returning. This isn't the first time I've encountered such sloooooow service. At least, the last server was more attentive.

We have been red robin fans for years... Until our last and final experience. While the food was mediocre at best (it was Luke warm by the time we got it!) we were famished and did not want to have to wait even longer then we already had! We then proceeded to ask for more of their famous bottomless fries... And literally had to ask 3x and waited an extra 30 minutes! My husband finally spoke with the manager and was very diplomatic about the situation...and asked for the DM number... The manager finally came to our table with the number and acted as if it was our fault and that it was really not a big deal that we were still waiting for fries after we had been served Luke warm food! He proceeded to say "well would it make you happy if I gave you a discount? "Umm NO! Is our response .... "Well do you still want the fries or are you tired of waiting?" Umm we still want the FRIES! Seriously our kids are waiting ever so patiently for just one refill of fries!  Finally get fries yay!  Manager finally comes back and says he is comping the whole meal... And follows up with does this make you happy? In an ever so patronizing tone...  What would have made us happy is to have food hot and in a timely manner... And refills like you advertise, and most of all a manager   That actually serves customers without the attitude that we were bothering him. We will never go back to red robin!

If you like chain restaurants, here is another typical American chain that serves average food to the masses.  If you have tastebuds or a distinctive palate, you will be disappointed with their burgers even though that's what they market as their specialty. Meat was bland and a bit greasy.  Toppings are not that fresh, fries are big and generic.  Service during this visit was friendly but really slow.  It took over 35 mins to get our food. If you are a true burger fiend- go to the Counter- you won't be disappointed.
Horribly long wait for food 1 hour.  Kitchen apparently backed up, never saw the floor manager.  Sandwich bread soggy, very disappointing.  How they stay in business is a miracle.  Poor managers.

Our server Crystal is great. Attenitive, sincere, shows patience & listens well. Family ordered the following. 'Shroom Burger, kids cheese pizza, kids grilled cheese, fried mushroom appietizer & sweet potato and finally the Artic Cod Fish n Chips. Being this is 01/01/2013 place is not as crowded as one would expect. Though this is a high traffic area with a movie theater some 100 yards away our wait was only under 10 minutes. Will be back again.

My son picked Red Robins to come to eat for his birthday.  We were seated quickly and Brandon was our server. Brandon was on top of everything, our drinks were ALWAYS filled. Would definitely look for him the next time we come on. Thanks Brandon you were great!!!

Red Robin has a variety of food choices to choose from, but their food is whatever.  One day while dining with my Fiance, we were sitting near the kitchen and we realized that a lot of their food was already pre-made and came out of a plastic bag.  Since when did vegetables and macaroni and cheese come out of a plastic bag?  When we saw this, we were disgusted and told one another we would never come back to a Red Robin.  My Fiance's co-worker once had a bad experience from this Red Robin where the chicken burger his co-worker ordered was still frozen.  I can't believe they do not check their food before sending it off with the customer for their takeout.   We definitely had better experiences elsewhere.  I do not recommend Red Robin for any dining experience.  If you want a good burger or good food, go somewhere that will provide you with fresh food and not anything that frozen or comes out of a plastic bag.

RED ROBIN...............................y u u u u u c k....... I went here for dinner with a party of 3 around 8:45pm tonight. Being it was nearly 9pm on a Thursday evening, I didnt expect a wait, but there was a 20 minute wait, which ended up taking 25 minutes.  As soon as we sat down, the person I was with said "I bet the service is gonna suck tonight" and boy, were they right.  First of all, being this Red Robin is right next to a movie theater, and Batman is showing at midnight tonight, along with the movie's trilogy, the manager of this location should have had the common sense to over staff, rather than under staff.  Nearly half of the restaurant was empty, but due to the fact the customer ratio was greater than the server ratio, everything just ran as slow as Eeyore on heroin.  The chefs were more backed up then the Octo-moms birth canal.  It took nearly 40 minutes to get our food after we ordered. When we finally got our food, they said "oh they are making your sweet potato fries, so we brought you some regular fries to go with your burger for now". Oh really!? Gee, thanks.... because I had no idea that sweet potato fries took 45 minutes to cook. Maybe Miss Idaho herself was back in the kitchen peeling them?  A few minutes later, the sweet potato fries FINALLY arrived. I was hoping that after the first bite, my teeth would turn solid gold or something spectacular would happen, due to the fact... they took so damn long, but unfortunately.... nope, they were just plain ol' sweet potato fries.  After finishing up, we asked for the check. The waitress informed my party that she went ahead and comped our drinks and took off the $1.00 charge for the sweet potato fries. Personally, I feel she should have given us all mani/pedi's to make it up to us, being the entire experience sucked as bad as the Star Wars prequel.  But with some restaurant chains, bad service and bad food is to be expected.  Let's just say that the ride back, wasnt a walk in the park, and more like a rush to the nearest restroom.  I felt as though I was in labor all over again and with every red stop light, the pain and breathing got worse.  The pains in my stomach felt as though the lolipop guild were doing a kickline against my insides.  I began to sweat and feel more and more awful.  My burger flashed through my imagination still moo-ing at me, all pink in the middle, and giving me the middle finger, telling me, "payback is a b!tch".  I felt like I for sure got a piece of mad cow on my plate, and maybe now it was multiplying inside me wanting revenge?... Maybe all of my vegan friends back in LA werent just "food hipsters" afterall? Maybe this vegan thing wasnt such a bad idea? I thought to myself. Finally, after the pain subsided and I awoke next to the toilet ((kidding)), I realized that maybe it was time to end things with Red Robin. Time to tell the 'big red faced guy' that it was over, and I wouldnt be seeing him or his delicious drinks anymore (and no, I am not talking about Mel Gibson).  This might take some time to get over. Afterall, I never experienced anything like this before with Red Robin or my innards, for that matter.  Needless to say, I wont be coming back. It was a fun ride, but a bumpy one. It was fun while it lasted, but not while it blasted. Well, you get the point....

We have eaten at this Red Robin several times in the last 6 months and it keeps having the same problems no matter how many times we inform management.  Twice they have lost our order ticket and we had to wait over an hour for our food. The first time the server would come by and say that it should be out soon and it wasn't until a manager came by and told us what happened. They ended up comping our meal but we were there for a good 3 hours. Today they lost part of our order. How does that even happen? The lost order was a simple sandwich.  For every single visit we have had to wait for fries. You would think that a place that advertises all you can eat fries would make sure that they had enough fries ready. One time we waited over 30 minutes because the kitchen was so backed up. We got 2 baskets today and one was nice and fresh and the other was stale and had what I call "fry bits". Just pieces of French fries from the bottom of the fry basket. I couldn't believe they would even serve that garbage.  I have been to several different Red Robins in California and this is the worst one by far.  Management knows they have issues so why don't they correct them?

More of a 3.5 than 4 stars. The food here is pretty good, not great. But the reason I am giving them four stars is because of their early starting happy hour. Happy hour starts at 8pm and ends at 11 on weekdays and 12 on weekends.  I came here with 3 buddies for happy hour and we ordered some drinks, guac and salsa with chips, and chili cheese with chips. The guac and salsa was very underwhelming because they gave such a small amount of guac and salsa. The chili cheese was pretty good (better than the guac and salsa at least). But the best part of course was the drinks. Well drinks are $2.50, domestic pints are $2.50, premium pints are $3.50, and margaritas are $3.50. The drink prices and early starting time make me bump this rating up to 4 stars.

Im a vegetarian and it might be amusing that I love burgers :) But i love their veggie burgers not to mention their bottomless fries and their shakes are swim worthy (i,e- i can swim in it ). Nothing more to say  - great burgers, great fries, yummy shakes. Their alcoholic beverages are super strong and super good.

Last time we came I was convinced that I'd never come back!  Today was my sons birthday and this is what he wanted, so we came. So being with the horrible experiences before I didn't expect any better. We where seated... Less than a minute greeted and receiving our drinks! WOW that's a first!  Our server was Juan! He is outstanding! He took our appetizer and food order, brought out appetizers with enough time to enjoy them, without being overwhelmed by our main entree. He also brought the kids food first! Thank god for that! I was impressed!  My husband is very particular about eating and drinking, he needs to drink with his meal! So when he doesn't have to ask for a refill that's a great waiter for him already!  Juan was definitely on top of his refills and napkins! He was just awesome! He definitely bought us back! I hope to be treated to his awesome service again in the near future, with my family! So thank you Juan and RR I hope you guys can afford to keep him!

Worst service I've encountered in a long time. Tables seated after us were served and received food before us, and our food came out in 2 waves spaced far apart. The first half of group basically finished eating before the second half got their food. To top things off, water took 20 minutes to come even asking multiple times.
This place is alright- typical burger place with some good beers and french fries. Just mad that they never get my burger order right! How hard is it to not keep the pickles off...... :(

The hostesses at this restaurant were dumb and dumber!!! There was NOONE in the restaurant on a Sunday afternoon. They were like "It will be about 20-25 minutes."! REALLY??? I asked if they had a lack of servers and one of them said that they just needed to get the tables ready. We were seated in maybe 7 minutes, and our server was okay. But this Red Robin NEEDS to replace their lazy, inefficient hostesses.

did take out from her, there were multiple problems: 1). the online menu - printed version does not match their real menu 2). Hamburgers were the worst burgers we have had and expensive - in and out are much better at less than 1/2 the price 3). I waited for 5 minutes before they gave me my food because they were too busy trying to get the slushy machine in the bar to work - it apparently takes 3 people.  Therefore food was cold.

I ordered for pick up at lunch time a few months ago. The guy (bartender) was really rude and made it seem like I was intruding on his important Red Robin bar tending.  Thought I'd never be back but I was starving, and across the street today and thought I'd give it another shot. The hostess was very nice and told me to go to the end of the bar (like last time). I stood there for TEN minutes without being greeted. Luckily I knew exactly what I wanted because I was never offered a menu. It was not very busy but my order took a total of 40 minutes. I wasn't asked if I wanted ketchup or anything else, there were no utensils or napkins. I was just really disappointed by the service once again and unfortunately I will not be returning to this location again.  I give two stars because the food is pretty good and because they offer vegetarian burgers.
We ordered 2 burgers one was spicy and the other one a simple burger.  At the end we concluded that the simple one was better.  In general good food.

I've been going to Red Robin for a few years - they had one in my town that I moved from.  This one is a lot better.  It's been a while - so I dont know if they're upgrading, on a trial, or if they upgraded all of them - but this one is definitely a step above other Red Robins I have been to.  Your sandwich comes on a plate with your own generous serving of fries.  While fries have always been bottomless, other experiences have had me share with my table and they give you like 10 fries. The burger was delicious, the beer selection was excellent and the atmosphere was upgraded.  Dont really know how to explain it - but it didn't seem as "chainy" as it used to.

I had an unpleasant experience with a waitress, however, the management at Red Robin was kind and understanding and contacted me in regards to the issue I had.  They corrected the issue and I have been dining there ever since.  Their burgers are delicious and my kids truly enjoy the treat of going there every time.

It's .... LUNCH TIME ! And Alex K. and I are hungry after a 2 hour poli class so where do we go? Red Robin! ... Yum! We start with a Freckled Lemonade and Sand In My Shorts, the latter drink left Alex unpleased and unfinished. We also started with a single starter appetizer of Onion Rings that came with Ranch and Campfire sauce ( heehee ).  I noticed that they removed their Chicken Parmigiano Pasta from their menu and replaced it with the Roasted Chicken Pesto Pasta. So I ordered that instead, I do like a good pasta dish and pesto? Sounds like my kinda meal! Alex got the Crispy Chicken Sandwich, with steak fries. The food came out in good time, but then again there was only about 5 couples there at the time. My pasta was as described pesto infused pasta, the green color is a bit off setting and it's garnished with parm, diced tomatoes and red onion. It comes with 2 pieces of roasted foccacia which was pleasant, because they were tender and flavorful. Alex's burger looked large and filling and came with a handful of steak fries. We were served quickly and efficiently, only con was that our server was kind of hard to comprehend since he spoke so fast. Most of the workers were either watching the Giants game or eating steak fries in the corner, so that was kind of strange to wrap my head around. The food was good, service was okay, Alex didn't like his drink ... that is all. P.S. Freckled Lemonade is always a win!
Decent food. Nice staff. Good for a quick bite.

Tasty food.  Quick service. Cold beer. Waiting for my movie to start, I thought I'd have lunch here.  Found a seat at the bar quickly.  Server Lindsay was friendly and prompt.  Had a whisksey river BbQ chicken wrap.  Very tasty!   I also like this place because it is close to many other places.  Lots of stuff to see nearby. Definately coming back.

Red Robin is delicious and the staff is amazing! We ordered one drink, but our waitress gave us a free drink ON THE HOUSE. Okay, now how amazing is that?! Not to mention that the staff is super nice as well! And the food. Okay, don't even get me started on the burgers. It's like a hunk of delicious, dripping, fat. Except it's the most beautiful burger. Red Robin serves burgers but it's cheap and it's an ART. Their burgers are delicious! And so are the drinks. AND UNLIMITED FRIES. Okay, what more could you ask for? I would come here every week if I could! Definitely five star in my opinion, especially with its nice staff and price range.

Came here on a Monday night for dinner. There was no wait to be seated.  And the restaurant itself was not busy. I normally like coming here but when I got my soup it was cold. The pizza my son ordered was not that good. And my husband got sick off the burger he ordered. The only thing that night were the fries.

yes, I knew that it would be a long wait on a Friday night, but ... 50 minutes to get to the table, and another hour before the food was brought to the table. when they brought the food, my burger came out lonely, on a big plate with no fries. the server promised the fries would be out soon. meanwhile, my gluten-free bun was as hard as a football. it took another 10 minutes to get the server back to the table, and she did finally swap the stale hard bun for a soft, freshly steamed one. as soon as it cooled, it was hard and leathery like the first. so I just took off the top and ate it open faced - all the time with no fries. server kept apologizing and promising they'd arrive soon. finally regular fries arrived, when I'd ordered sweet potato fries. the served acted like I'd changed my mind or something, instead of admitting she messed up. when the fries finally arrived, we had finished every thing on the table. :( this was a very uncool visit to the Red Robin :(

The servers and bartenders at Red Robin are very friendly and cool. Sometimes I sit at the bar, sometimes I eat solo, and other times I sit at the bar or a table with friends. All have been good experiences.  I rarely actually  order burgers here; instead, I usually order a chicken salad or chicken sandwich. Those are good, but not great.  The burger menu is enormous, and the burger combinations are creative. I like that you can get healthy sides as substitution for fries (broccoli, salad, and so on) at no extra cost. Red Robin is really popular; often there are lines to get a table and it can get noisy. it is also a great place to take the family.

Update: for whatever reason I gave this place another shot and have been back a few times since. Greatly improved experience! Staff much more attentive and a more relaxed feel. Maybe the time of day I went? Change in management? IDK, but whatever it Is keep it up.
Great Service, Lots of Parking, Friendly Service. Also, can't go wrong with all day happy hour and bottomless root beer floats.

Veggie friendly: you can sub any of their burgers with a Boca or garden veggie patty. I recommend the 'Shroom burger. This location gets high scores for service. I was here with a group of moms with young kids, and the servers were super attentive (bringing kids' food first, checking on their refills, keeping hot stuff out of the radius of baby hands, holding doors open for strollers etc) Thank you! We left a big mess in our wake, and YES I do guilt tip :)

This is one of those places that you learn to avoid when busy. I have never had good customer service in this store unless it was half-empty. They just can't handle a crowd. The food is good, I had a bacon and guacamole burger and a great milkshake. But simple food shouldn't take so long to get on the table.  I'm giving this place two stars, but if they were able to deliver without a ridiculous wait I would give them four stars. (Yes, the service really was that unbearably slow.

Service quality WAY WAY down. Came here 6 weeks ago and ordered a kids Mac and cheese, 2 burgers, a beer and a lemonade. Wait time for our drinks alone 20 mins or longer. Wait time for our food (including the kids meal) over 50 mins after we ordered. Other tables that were seated after us, ordered after us, cleaned up their plate, paid their bills AND left the premises before our food arrived. I complained to the manager and they comped our meal. Tonight I decided to give them another try. If you call waiting for your food for 45 mins an improvement then please feel free to eat at this place. For me, I rather drive the 15 mins to visit another burger place.

Sign up for the birthday club, please! You receive a certificate in your email for a free burger. No restrictions. No buy one get one. You just get a free burger! How nice. I am not a huge burger fan, so Red Robin is just average to me. I personally think 10 dollars for a burger is not worthy, but if you are a burger lover, than you might think otherwise.  I must say though, I enjoy the tower of onion rings. I have received good service for the visits I have made to this Red Robin. The bottomless fries are a plus, but after I finish a burger & some appetizer, I am done after a serving of fries. A second round of fries would be forcing it..so the bottomless part is not too exciting for me. Their lemonade is good, but I am not a lemonader either...WOW red robin is just not for me huh?! The thing is, I eat practically anything so if my friends decided to go there, I wouldn't mind. I just would not be the one to choose Red Robin.  This is probably for all places with mozzarella sticks, but Red Robin has some delish mozz sticks and they are only good for maybe 10 minutes. After that, it's like eating rubber. My sister and I were sharing the appetizer and we had two left after our entire meal. We did not want to bring it home because microwaving it would be a bad idea So we asked if they could re-fry it for us, and they did! It came out super oily and hot, but hey, better than eating rubber.

I've been there many times, and the food here is great. Though, I don't go to many burger joints so take this review with a little grain of salt.  I recommended the Freckled Lemonade, though I would watch out on all those free refills because the calories ADD up fast. Same with the free Fries that come complimentary with the the burgers.  It can get quite busy and as a result their service may be a bit slow, otherwise it's a nice place for your friends or your family.

Maybe the "wood fire grill" got put out, but does it really take 50 minutes to make two burgers? As if the 30 minute wait wasn't long enough. Yeesh. Can't say that the food was spectacular either. When there's a 5 guy's joint so close, one would think other burger places would step up their game. Apparently not the case with Red Robin. Definitely not coming back.

I am a frequent customer at red robin and usally I would rave about how yummy and cheap they are, but the other night me and my coworker went to eat there after work it was around 7:30. And it was pretty bad.  So I forget our servers name but he was cool, joked around with us got us anything we needed, and got our food out fast.... But that's were it goes down hill. As soon as he drops off our food he drops the tab too. Now I've been a waitress for over 2 years and that is so rude. You don't drop the tab off until the customer is pretty much done with there meal.  But we just set the bill aside and try to enjoy our meal, not 5 mins later I'm not even half way done with eating, our server try's to pick up the tab... I told him we haven't looked at it yet and he looks super embaresed, and walks away.   And no joke, and soon as he leaves our table the manger comes over it's this blond guy with a mustache comes over and demands that we pay the bill. I've kept my cool so far but that just pissed me. So I tell him " this is unbelievable, were not even halfway done with my meal and your asking me to pay. What If wanted something more or dessert, I'm a waitress and I would never treat my customer like this!" He kept demanding that we "pay him now "so we did. But that was really one of my worst experiences eating out.

When we came in it was not very crowded but it still took a while before we were seated. It took 25 minutes for us to get our food. I ordered my burger well-done but it came undercooked with a lot of pink.
We live going here the manager is really accommodating and friendly, the staff are quick and the food is awesome! I have many options to choose from even on weight watchers.

I wouldn't say that their burgers here are the greatest. But if you're in a burger-eating mood, then this place is definitely an option for you.  They have a wide selection of gourmet style burgers. I happened to try the Santa Fe Burger the last time I went and it was pretty good. They offer generous portions with their selections.  The service here is mediocre. My cousin and I had to wait a while to get our orders taken. And we had to ask for a box three times.  But overall, the experience was not too bad.

So, I gave them the benefit of the doubt and after the bad review, I was given a $20 gift card with their apologies for my horrible experience. Which I am very thankful for their genuine concern. Take two....went with my two daughters and got seated right away. Not bad for a Saturday. Our server greeted us and took our drink orders. He came back promptly with our drinks, nice again. He took our order and this is where it gets bad. I ordered two items off the kids menu and an appetizer for myself. 30 minutes go by, I finally get my food and everything is cold. I ordered queso dip and when I got it, the top was like creme brulee. The top was a solid. I complained to management this time and they took care of it, so that was nice. It appeared the kitchen was backed up and everyone's meals were taking too long. I was more upset that nothing was said to me. I understand, things happen, but I was told nothing. I tried...but this is my last time at this Red Robin. Fool me once, shame on you...Fool me twice...U get the rest.

I am totally upset by the service we received tonight. After a two hour water polo game a few of us decided to take the players out to eat. These girls were hungry and ready to enjoy some greatly earned burgers. We were sat rather quickly, then nothing for 15 minutes .  it took us having to get up and ask for someone to take our drink order. At that point the server rushed over and stated he was ready. We then set a timer 35 more minutes to get our food no appetizers.  When the server dropped our food he couldn't even bring it all at once. When checking back his words were " everything ok,  good" and walked away. No time to responed or even ask for a refill on drinks. Would I go back. No

My boyfriend and I ate dinner here last night, we we're really excited because Red Robin (in our hometown) is usually delicious. We were seated within 5-10 minutes and ordered an appetizer and drinks while we looked at the menu. The waitress came back multiple times seemingly ever 2 minutes to ask if we were ready to order. It felt as though we were trying to be rushed out, granted it was busy but I don't want to be rushed when I go out to dinner. We ordered our meals and our drinks have yet to come. We ordered a beer and a mixed drink, it had been over 15 minutes. I FINALLY got the attention of the waitress, which was dang near impossible, and asked about our drinks. She apologized and mumbled some excuse as she went to the bar. She comes back a few minutes later and states they were out of the beer we ordered. So it takes 20 minutes to figure that out?! Uhh, no. Regardless we ordered a different kind of beer and received our drinks a few minutes later, which was after we got our dinner, which was both annoying and ridiculous. The fries were cold and the burger was not good. The buns were cold and tasted like they came straight out of a bag, which I'm sure they did, but they should at least warm them up. The BBQ sauce was insanely overwhelming and the crispy onion strings that were on the burger were a soggy flavorless mess. The whole rest of the night we were bother by how disappointing it was, and definitely not worth the $50.  With both the food and customer service being mediocre, at best, we will not be returning to this location.

Even though I'm usually not a fan of chains, Red Robin defies the norm by delivering a casual and satisfying dining experience on a consistent basis.  It's a burger place, so try to avoid the rest of the menu and just get a burger! The A1 Peppercorn Burger ($10.39) and the Burnin' Love Burger ($9.59) are my personal favorites, both delivering some serious flavor. Take note: All burgers are open to customization, so don't be afraid to substitute certain cheeses, sauces, or other items to make the perfect burger for your taste. The fries could be crispier, but they're bottom-less, and just cover them with Red Robin Seasoning or Dat Campfire Sauce! Everyone raves about the Freckled Lemonade ($3.99), and it's very good for sure, but for a change of pace, get the Root Beer Float ($3.19). Endless root beer float for that price is an absolute steal! The service is definitely friendly enough, and there are a few TVs scattered around if you want to peak at a game that's showing, which adds to that fun, casual environment.  If I'm struggling to think of a place toe eat, Red Robin is a solid standby.

So, here is a rather disappointing review of the Red Robin in the Paseo De Saratoga shopping center.  It all began with a burger craving, and neither of one of us wanted In-N-Out, so we decided on Red Robin.  Big mistake [tonight]. We were seated in an expeditious manner, as expected, by a pretty good hostess.  Next, comes our waitress, Ashley.  She was a little short thing, with what appeared to be a decent personality...at first.  We placed the drink order, which consisted of a patron margarita and two strawberry limeades.  It took her quite a while to bring them.  Next, comes the order.  I don't really know how difficult it is to write down on your little pad, "bacon cheeseburger, dry, with fries."  The next order was the Whiskey River BBQ cheeseburger (with fries), which somehow happened to arrive at the table, prepared correctly (amazing). So, during the entire time it took to dine, Ashley stopped by to 'see how things were,' just once.  We still didn't have any utensils or napkins about 10 minutes after our orders arrived.  Empty food plates and drink glasses began to pile up on our table, during which she showed absolutely no interest whatsoever in clearing them. This was not an enjoyable experience for any of the parties involved, including our little waitress, 'Ashley.'  She had a very apparent attitude problem tonight.  I just hope it gets fixed before she forces more customers to feed their appetite elsewhere.

I came here on a whim because my usual go to quick lunch Chipotle was packed... as in line out the door (ew sick). I was hoping for better but I know not why considering its a chain restaurant.  The problems I have with this restaurant cannot be fixed with another experience but only by avoiding the restaurant at all costs.  Every single appetizer was over 2000 calories and I assure you my daily needs are somewhere around 1800. Regardless, that was JUST the appetizers, the burgers were even more, a gruesome total I dare not mention. I'm embarrassed I consumed something that cray.  Anyways, while I was there I put the caloric experience aside and just decided to eat the damn burger. I ordered the Royal Burger (topped with bacon and a fried egg) because for the longest time, since I went to Burger Me in Tahoe-Donner, I've been yearning for a burger with a perfect fried egg on top. This was more like a piece of rubber with no yolk. It didn't do anything for the burger aside from add calories.  I opted for a side salad and I was seriously disappointed. Such a weak salad, probably to encourage you choose bottomless fries next time. The price to food quality ratio is out of control. Honestly I'd rather get a flat burger from McDonalds than waste my time energy and calories here at RR.

I've been to Red Robins all over the place.  Generally love them.  Not this place. Was told 20-25 minutes to sit.  40+ minutes later we got seated.  10 more minutes to order.  10 more minutes  and we had to beg for some friggin fries to stop my son from gnawing on the table.  Wanted to pay for out drinks and leave.  20 more minutes for our orders; one patty still icy in the middle.  Should've left.

Everytime my bestie comes into town we have a reunion at thie Red Robin. I'm surprised to see the comments about how long the waits are for people, then again we usually go around lunch time not dinner. Never a wait more than 10 minutes. We are usually catching up the whole time so if the food service is ever slow I have never noticed. Food is always yummy and the prices are not too high. I will continue to come to this Red Robin. (YUUMMMMMM)

Today they get 2 starts specifically because of the food.. I order the Whiskey River BBQ chicken salad and UGH.. there was sooooooo much sauce on/in the salad it was horrific, the Jicima was the size of hubba bubba bubble gum..NOT A GOOD LOOK, the tomatoes....let's just say it was some bullshit. I cannot believe a restuarant would serve tomatoes that looks like they've been parading in the Tomatoe fair or something..like on Highway 101 after a bad accident. I politely took my plate to the waiter and informed her I was eating or paying for that.. she was sweet.. I think I lost my appetite but I placed another

This place is horrible. I went in on friday at 7-25-14 at 710pm, my wife was asking a simple question to the two younger female hostesses.  They were very rude and both had attitudes so we decided to leave. Quickest three minutes I've ever spent at a restaurant.  The two girls looked 16 one Caucasian blonde and the other maybe Hispanic with brunette ponytail.  No smiles and not even a greeting at the door. Horrible customer service skills and will definitely turn away customers.  Hopefully the owner will see this. We went to smash burgers after and had a much better experience there and the burgers were delicious.
Spoke to the Gm and am ok with the info I was given and feel they are trying to better the location and staff. I will give them another try .

I like coming here because the burgers are really good, plus you get all you can eat fries.  What's not to like about all you can eat. I have gotten a few of the different burgers they have to offer, and I have never been disappointed.  For the price, I'd like the burger to be a little bigger, but the unlimited fries more than make up for it.  The meat tastes great, and the produce is fine.   The fries are really good too, and I always upgrade to garlic fries because that's how I roll.  Again, the fact that it's all you can eat is awesome to the max.   The service has always been top notch and that makes me say yaaaay.   All in all, you can't do bad coming here.

I've been here many a time before and the food is pretty good, at least the burgers and fries. I really haven't had much else he before. I often go here because it's a cool place to meet up or go before seeing a movie at the Amc theaters.  I am mostly writing this review because of the exceptional service I had he on my most recent visit by the waiter andres.this guy was on top of it! He was nice yet to the point. He brought us some fries while we were waiting for our burgers and kept the refills coming without us ever needing to ask. He was like a mind reader.  When we were done he offered to split the bill for us, this is the first time I think any waiter has ever offered this to me before. I thought that was awesome. If I had this sort of service every time I would probably come here more often. Me and my friend made sure to tip Andres well before we left. I may even ask for his section next time I go back here.  I would say red robin is more of a 3.5. The burgers are pretty tasty but a tad over priced. I would say a burger at Carls Jr. is similar yet much less expensive.
I hate the table terminals.  Last thing I want my kid doing when we go out for a meal is to play games that cost $2.00.  I had a double tavern burger that was way too greasy.  Probably won't go back

I came here with a party of six for dinner on a Sunday night. Let me requisite my next statement with this: the place was completely empty!!! "It's going to be fifteen minutes." the hostess says.  WHAT?!?! FIFTEEN MINUTES? There's no one here! I think she might have heard my friend grumbling so she sat us in a few minutes, but she did not do it with a smile on her face. We're seated and our waiter takes our orders and asks how we want to split our check. When we asked for six separate checks, he says that he'll do two. At this point, I felt as if they couldn't split six checks so I tried my hardest understand. Fast forward to the check, and one of the managers told us that they could definitely split the check six ways.  So why the two separate checks? I can only come up with two possibilities: 1) you're lazy 2) you're stupid It's part of your job, dude. Is splitting two checks three ways really any harder than splitting one check six ways? Okay. I might be a little harsh, but the situation just baffles me to no end. The onion rings stack were delicious and the game day nachos were good as well, but not enough to get me to come back. Main courses were mediocre burgers at BEST, but the endless fries were awesome. I really love the Red Robin seasoning they give you at the table. TL;DR Better burgers and service at In-N-Out

Bumped up to a 3.5! Lately, my experiences at Red Robin have been great.  I love cheeseburgers. It's the perfect sandwich. Umami Burger has become The Best Burger Of My Life, but unfortunately, you won't find us driving to San Francisco every time I'm craving a burger (which is at least once a week). I still think In n' Out is better than Red Robin, but if I'm not feeling Animal Style-y, we go here.  I usually get the regular cheeseburger. Sometimes sesame bun, sometimes onion.  I don't always get the relish because it's sweet. Always American cheese because I like the way it melts. Lately, they've been cooking the beef perfectly - whether I ask for medium or medium-well. And it doesn't matter if it's steak fries, sweet potato fries, or onion rings - always ask for a side of campfire sauce.  Service is hit or miss - depending on who you get.

Undoubtedly one of the worst meals ever! I should have known that the story would not end well when we were told out wait would be 15 minutes and clearly half the tables were empty. We.ordered the onion rings and zucchini for appetizers. The rings were ok but we only got half an order of the zucchini and the waitress made no move to fix the order after it was brought to her attention. The riblets and clucks was the most awful dish. The riblets were literally broiled in a pile causing them to char and stick together like a pile of meat marshmallows which were then dumped into a soup of nasty bbq sauce. The only redeeming aspect of the dish were the French fries which came out 5 minutes after the rest of the dishes but were at least hot.
This place rocks, the burgers are just the best in the area. Staff are so friendly.

My favorite RR location other than the Newark one where my roomie works at. Fast and efficient service and the food is always good. Parking can sometimes be a hassle, but other than that the food and service is right on target. Love the RR Royalty Card free appetizer when you register it and free birthday burger for your bday month. Campfire sauce is awesome for dipping those bottomless fries.
Cold food after waiting for over 45 min for it to get here. Broken salad plate is somehow an acceptable thing too. How disappointing.

Food is okay but the service rather the management is much to be desired. Service is really slow and it's not the fault of the servers but rather management trying to maximize profit but having the bare minimal amount of staff possible to keep the servers running nonstop and constantly behind. It took over 30 mins for them to take our food order and took over 1hr to get our food. Went to the bar for drinks the poor bartender was so slammed that it took him 20 mins to pour me a beer and 10 mins to run my card.

It started off so great. The host and our server were super friendly. The server even flirted with my friend's baby boy and chatted with us a bit. Shortly after she took our order, she disappeared. Thankfully, we'd had the foresight to ask for both our drinks and a separate glass of water. By the time the server reappeared, all our glasses were empty. It took about 30 minutes to get our food and it really just seemed our server was in the weeds. That confused me, seeing as how the restaurant wasn't even halfway full and it was a random Thursday night. We had to ask for a few things multiple times (like drink refills), and my friend was disappointed when her mac and cheese came out SUPER al dente, not to mention COLD. My burger was super tasty at least (and hot!), and I got to sub out the bun and a salad for fries, which made me happy. But would I go out of my way to come here again? Nope. There are better burger places with better service.
Good food and good service. Rarely let down and with the redesign there are more unlimited options(fries,  broccoli and sweet potato fries)

I would have given this restaurant a 5 start if it werent for the fact that our waiter did not put our order in the computer and after about 45 min., we started to wonder why our food wouldn't come! We asked to speak to the manager and she apologized for what had happened. She was very nice and our whole lunch was on the house(it was 7 of us total). The waiter was also very nice I just think it got really busy too fast and he lost track, I don't know but either way he was ok. The food was amazing, we had fish and chicks, onion rings, burgers and kids meal.  This incident wont stop me from coming back.

Since when has happy hour excluded beer on tap Really. Service was ok I waited for more then 5min for an extra basket of fries.  I finally got frustrated and asked for the bill. Over all the burgers are great but will not go back for happy hour. I would rather got to Applebee's for a real happy hour.

So this was the second disaster on my nephew's 3rd birthday extravaganza~  We were seated at 7p.m, we didn't receive our food until 40 minutes later!! There were other customers who were seated in the same area after us who received their food before us! When I spoke to the manger about the issue, he gave me a lame excuse about how maybe we ordered something that took a little longer!! We ordered a damn burger! The same thing the other customers ordered and got before us! When we finally got our food it wasn't hot and we had to ask for fresh fries! I'll just be. This just wasn't our day of good customer service~ Its okay nephew I'll make sure you have a good time at your big birthday party this weekend~

Awful, awful, awful.  Went just before the AMC movie and got burgers the size of McDonalds but McDonalds would have tasted better and cost less. Bun fell apart, burger burnt. Service was excellent, however.  Saw lots of people with children and felt sorry for them paying these high prices for terrible food.  I'm not a fan of Mcdonald's but at least they don't totally rip you off with their food and prices.  Worst place I've ever been for hamburgers and will never go back again. Paid $34 for crap and would have complained but had to rush to movie.  Hate this place.

Hollar for $3.50 gold margaritas during happy hour!!!!! Went here on a Friday afternoon with my lil fambam right before the rush. Got seated right away, in the patio area since it was a beautiful day. Plus I have two boys that are under 4. Server was great and drinks always makes any situation better. Hubs ordered the chophouse burger which is huge burger and tasted FANTASTIC. I had the tavern burger which tasted like a whopper but cheesier!! I thought it was very tasty. My boys had the mac n cheese, they just love anything cheesy.... All in all, burgers are good and drinks are perfectly priced. def going to swing by if we are in the area.

Came in on a weekday with my brother around 11am, and the place was very quiet and empty.  I forgot our server's name, but she was very attentive, probably because she only had 2 other tables.  My brother and I decided to split the SAUTEED SHROOM BURGER, and I appreciated that the waitress didn't give us the why-you-so-cheap-2-people-equals-2-burgers look. Our burger: YUMM! Fit for a mushroom-lover! The burger came with a delicious juicy patty and almost 1/2 an inch of grilled mushrooms! Also, we were able to switch to a ciabatta bread bun which made the burger even tastier.  The patty was cooked just the way I asked which was medium rare.  Not dripping with sauce and cheese.  As promised, it came with bottomless fries, but we were so full from our burger, we only had 1 basket.   For next time, my friend recommended the Chicken Pesto Sandwich because it comes with bottomless GARLIC FRIES!

First off, I don't typically come to this one, because it's the furthest from my house. Secondly, my future husband really doesn't like this place. at all. ever. But after last night, I think I might have changed his mind. Rather successfully, I might add! After a shopping trip at Westgate, he wanted Amatto's. I like the sandwiches, but I just wasn't in the *mood* for it. So after much deliberation, I conceded and started to drive towards Santa Clara. Finally, he said, just go where you want! I said, but you don't LIKE where I want! Eventually HE conceded, and we turned around and headed to Red Robin.  The wait was pretty long - we heard they were short staffed - so we put out name in and scouted for a place at the bar. After about 10 minutes, a place opened up, so we snagged it. John, the bartender, was quick, friendly, and poured with a pretty heavy hand, and was really nice to look at! By the time we were eating our appetizer, our name was being called (even though I had told the hostess we were sitting in the bar, whatever). Our food came quickly, and John was always quick to fill out drinks and ask how things were going for is. The future husband decided he liked his Blue Ribbon Burger, and of course, I loved my Baja Turkey Melt. REALLY sad that they're no longer serving their AWESOME french onion soup anymore! Overall, I would come back here tomorrow to sit in the bar again. Also! Happy hour prices are seriously DIRT cheap. I'm a whiskey drinker, and their well whiskey is Barton's. Not too bad, especially for $2.50 for a whiskey and coke! Small domestic drafts are also $2.50, big ones are just $3.50. Happy hour runs from 3-6 and 8-close. If there's a wait, sit at the bar!

Again horrible service. I don't know why I keep coming back.  Slow service, never enough servers, poorly managed. Empty Ketchup bottles so the servers can't or don't do their side work. Waited 45 minutes for food. ..probably won't  be  back. Last time we walked out without anyone greeting us except the hostess, andshe doesn't bring drinks. .

Our server was nice and helpful. But we were there over an hour before we got out food and it was cold when arrived. Heared other people complaining about the service to. Maybe they need more help? Hire more people!

The good: Gluten free menu, the server Andres!!  the bad: fry seasoning is not gluten free, tricky. the ugly: the wait This was the first place I ate out since I began my gluten free venture. I have to say Red Robin BRAVO, because you made my first experience a good one.  I have to admit I was scared. Eating out is almost impossible when you are gluten intolerant. SO imagine my wonderful surprise when I heard they had a gluten free menu. (I took pictures)  During the wait for the table I looked at my choices, I was disappointed because no Bonzai burger but soy sauce is like 60 percent wheat so I understand.  Ordering: I tried not to make my gluten problem a problem so I didn't tell my waiter, much to my boyfriends dismay. I ordered the cheeseburger. Protein style when I asked if they had a seperate fryer for their fries He said yes but looked at me weird. I asked for fries with no seasoning. My boyfriend couldn't handle it anymore and said "she can't have gluten" A big look of realization came across the waiters face and he said "we have a gluten free bun."  GLUTEN FREE BUN!!! I almost died. YES please.  I ordered my food feeling so happy and when it arrived I was so happy because apparently when you have allergies you get a yellow basket that means the manager prepares it or whatever so you are sure it is perfect and gluten free. I still thought the fries looked like they had seasoning so I asked if I could get different fries. THe waiter took it all in stride and I thanked him profusely.  My food was good. Yes good and the bun was not lacking. I have to say though they added relish to my burger which I hate relish but  that was probably my fault. The bun is an extra $1 but it is worth it. My fries we amazing and my $2.50 well drink was also amazing. (happy hour after 9pm, M-F) If you go and you are gluten free Eat without being worried. Andres is also an amazing server.

Red Robin is definitely not the best burger in town, but provides consistent quality. Unfortunately, that quality is only deserving of 3 stars. As far as ambience and service go, this place is very good. But the food is consistently good. That is all. Just good. Not great, Not deserving of 5 stars.

We went into this restaurant after not going in for over a year due to bad service the last time we were there. What a difference a year makes. Billy was our server and he was great. Supper friendly and polite. We had a $25 credit from that bad experience from a year ago. He was helpful in making sure we were able to use that credit (which we were not planning on since it was so old) and apologized for our experience then. The food was good and the wait for everything was fine. The reason they are getting 3 instead of 4 stars is I had ordered my dressing and walnuts on the side for my salad and when the food runner brought our food out she did not bring those items out.

Not only did  Red Robin serve us cold food the service was terrible.  The fish sandwich that  my mom got was cold so we sent it back thinking that we were going to get a new sandwich but we got a heated up soggy fish sandwich.  The server must have said sorry about ten times.  I had to go looking for a refill for coffee.  I will think twice before returning.
I love their bottomless serving of french fries, their onion rings and teriyaki burger! Still my favorite burger.

(you thought I would forget, didn't you, Red Robin!) Red Robin, YUMMM! Yummm is right, they have some pretty delicious tasting burgers. But the staff? NOOOPE! Side note: If you guys frequent Red Robin enough, sign up for their email club thing. You'll get a coupon for a free birthday burger, which is the reason I was dining there :)  I always order the same thing -- Royal Red Robin Burger, no lettuce or tomatoes, medium rare, cut in half, campfire sauce and ranch on the side for my french fries, and a Strawberry Freckled Lemonade. Dang, I'm at what, 2,800 calories already? The food was good (and 5 stars for that), but what was starting off as a great dinner experience took a bad turn that just left me pissed off the rest of the night. I gave our waiter my birthday burger coupon when she first took our order for two reasons, 1.) I knew it would make her job easier so she wouldn't have to void stuff out and blah blah, and 2.) I wanted my birthday sundae to be ready, as well as have the staff be prepared to sing Happy Birthday to me (oh come on, birthdays only come once a year and for that one day, you're allowed to be as self-centered as you want). Ten minutes after our food was taken away, I kept glancing around for my waiter, pretending to be unaware that I get a free sundae and ready to act embarrassed when everyone sings Happy Birthday to me and the surrounding tables clap for me. Then I see my waiter. She has my sundae. She sets it down on our table. And then ... "Sorry, none of the other waiters want to sing Happy Birthday to you." -____- SERIOUSLY? Talk about unprofessionalism (not sure if that's a word) and just downright rude, I pretended that I didn't really care when in reality I was crying that no one wanted to sing Happy Birthday to me :( lol. Then she went on this rant of how she tried finding a group of people but no one wanted to do it, and blah blah. That's funny, I just saw a group of your people serenading three different tables prior to you coming out, but then again, what do I know? I'm just a customer. She also added something along the lines of like, "And I'm sure you don't want me to sing by myself." (to which I responded in my head, "People at Cold Stone do it all the time.") Someone didn't get a tip from me that night!

Very slow service! Came here at 6pm for dinner before a 7:45 movie. Got seated 30mins later, which is fine since it's the weekend. Ordered our food right away, however the food came out 45 mins later. This place has gotten slower throughout the years.
We love Red Robin Burgers! My hubby and I have been here several times to eat and we've never really had a bad experience. The food is always good. Service is usually good. 'Nuff said!

Service was absolutely terrible the last few times I visited. If I am going to see you once the entire night, AT LEAST get the orders right...  On top of that, this location has the worst, most meek and useless managers that I have ever seen. It will be a while before I visit again, which is a shame because I love the bottomless fries.
Bar seating available at this time wow.. Well I guess baseball season just started soo anything could happen.. So what I am trying to say is.. This is about the best time to come..

Warning!!!!! If you ever get sick from eating their food and want to complain,  please take a medical examination ASAP. Because they will treat you like SHIT if you don't have any hard prove! Red Robin is not just a terrible restaurant, it's also a very immoral and dishonest  company! The dishonest and rude employs I've talked to are: Jeff Mueller( Restaurant Assistant Manager), Terrisa( customer service).

I do not recommend coming here in groups.  Even though it was non-peak time on a Sunday afternoon, I waited a long while and asked twice for water.  A glass of water.  The ice-blond chubby short hostess was pretty bitchy too.  Well, if I were working there wearing what she was I would be grouchy too, I guess.   The burger was good but the service was most disappointing.  The waitress didn't want to accommodate us and made my friend with her bday coupon ask whether she could use both coupons (she had two different ones for some reason) even though it was clear what my friend was asking for.  The waitress was really difficult and was placing re-filled glassed on the table as if she didn't want to work there (drops of soda or water would splatter on the table).  We didn't get napkins other than the ones that come taped around your silverware unless we asked.  The service was so bad! To top of all off, the bathrooms are really gross and they do not clean them every hour like they should.  They have no system of cleaning the bathrooms or checking them every hour, just a sign that says to seek an attendant for service if something is wrong.   No more Red Robin!  Maybe to-go?

This place has good television sets and ok food.  My southwest chicken salad was poor...the dressing was inadequate, few beans, limited cheese and tortilla strips..a very lazy effort, in my view. The wait staff is young and absent much training.  Go here for the beer, but, really needs a step up for families. Nice location, but management needs to get on the ball, seriously.

Slowest red robin I have ever been to. Took an hour and a half to get seated, and then another 30 minutes before we ordered. Granted it is a crowded area, but still hire some more workers so the manager can sit in the back and not be running around waiting tables. Our waiter was super nice, just feel bad for the guy.

I have frequented this location and I must say last Thursday evening was a very pleasant experience.  My family and I all have food allergies and going out to eat can sometimes be a burden on the wait staff, but not for Bruno. He was very helpful and went out of his way to make sure we had the information we needed. He is one for the newer staff, I gather from what was presented to us, but was not bothered by all our requests and questions. He grabbed the ipad with the new app that listed the menu breakdown. He did everything he needed to do make sure we were given the correct information. Thank you Bruno, great job

What the heck happened? Waited over an hour for a burger. It arrived as the wrong burger and wrong fries after 1 hour. They took it back and the only thing bottomless about the fries was the container to hold them. After 15 min I had another burger. Great, this time it was not Cooked well done, but medium. Guess what, wrong fries again. They apologized and started to take my plate away again. I begged them not to take my food again. By now it had been forever without any food. They left the raw burger and I just ate it without complaining. The right fries finally showed up (garlic season). I should have just gone to in-out-burger but my friend saw a TV commercial and had to go here. The waitress was great, we tipped her just fine, but what the heck. Don't come here on a weekend unless you plan on staying for a long time. Bring your friends and maybe a board game, but don't bring your appetite.

We've been long-time customers of this particular Red Robin restaurant, long before it was given a facelift and calling itself a "bistro."  Let me tell you, from one burger lover to another, that it has pretty much gone downhill since then.  While the menu has expanded, offering new things like chili cheese fries and a myriad of dipping sauces, the quality and consistency of the food (particularly takeout) has taken a serious nose dive.  For example, a couple of nights ago my husband and I ordered our usual takeout meal, including chili cheese fries and mac and cheese.  We've ordered these items a dozen times in the past, and let's just say that we have gotten something a little different each time. It all depends on who is in the kitchen and who is packaging the food.   To be fair, there have been times when there has been a lot of love put into our meal, and it has shown through the quality of the burger, the amount of chili put on the fries, and how neatly it was packaged. This time, when we asked for chili cheese fries, we were told that they were "out of chili."  Out of chili??!??!  How can you be out of chili???  The mac and cheese was literally buttered pasta with shredded cheese sprinkled on top.  On TOP, and not mixed into it.  ARE YOU SERIOUS.  Who the hell makes their mac and cheese like that?  Were they banking on the heat of the pasta melting the cheese while it sat in the to go container?  I literally had to throw it in a saucepan and add our own cheese and milk.  Really??!   Also, the packaging of the food was horrendous.  Foil sloppily wrapped around the burger, burger boxes a little smashed with shreds of cheese stuck to it... you get the picture. That reminds me, one time when we dined in the restaurant, we were actually told that they were out of mac and cheese.  What?!?   It's just pasta, cheese, butter, and milk, for Pete's sake.  How often do they stock their kitchen??? Regarding quality of service, we've actually had quite pleasant experiences with all of our servers.  So, that's why I'm being pretty generous and giving two stars instead of one. All in all, when Red Robin is good, it can be really good.  However, when it's bad, it's annoyingly AWFUL.  And, unfortunately, we've experienced more bad than good lately, so we're hesitant to come back for another dine-in or takeout experience.  Just not worth the money.

This location is hit or miss.  Sometimes it's great and everything from service to the food is on point and other times it's so bad you don't even want to pay.  If I didn't love bottomless fries...I'd skip it

Red Robin's has transformed! Great service, full bar, and sign up for their rewards program. Get a free burger on your birthday, visit 5 times in the first 5 weeks and get $20 gift certificate,  AND buy 9 items get the 10th free! Plus they have this $6.99 double cheeseburger right now that just can't be beat. Add a buck more to add bacon or mushrooms. So,  turns out the Red Robin's chain has a new CEO,  well I say bravo.

Shout out to Annette for the best service ever.... NOTTTTT!!! this bish provided the WORST service ever. You are a waitress/server whatever tf u are DO YOUR FREAKING JOB. She is so slow, and not only that but she never came to check up on us even when I made eye contact /had to stare down. Me and my group Of friends sat in the middle when this freaking bleep was helping and paying attention to the table in front of us and the table ALLL the way in the back corner. She completely ignored our table and only check up on us once and that was when she us our bill. Not even that, but I distinctly said CHEDDAR cheese but I got American Cheese. Uhm I work at a burger place I know the difference between cheddar and American cheese. Oh don't even get me started on my meat. I distinctly said WELL DONE NO PINK and what the eff did I get? I GOT PINK. I WAS PISSED AND STILL AM TILL TODAY. My fries were cold aka not fresh, neither was my food. I like to think of myself as a food critic and have been to different red robin's so I do know the difference between what's fresh and unfresh and my food was NOT FRESH. it was cold, it was ugly and it was sloppy. So long story short, this location sucks balls and so does that server. Just because we are younger than the people she was also serving doesn't mean we should be treated any different. She was rude she was a slob she was bleep bleep bleep. My experience here was NOT GOOD, it was TERRIBLE and terrible isn't even the right word to describe it because it was FAR WORSE.
