I wasn't even able to enjoy my meal because the food was DISGUSTING and thank you Annette for the lovely service. I just wanted to eat in peace but was not able to. So You deserve the worst server award ever. Thank you and I hope you do not have a great day.
Food was good... But service was extremely SLOW, almost an hour before our order came up.

Came here with my friend and my girlfriend this place is terrible. First, we had a ton of people pass by us as we sat in the front (even the host passed by us a couple times before stopping to seat us). Then we sat at our table for a little over 5 minutes before being greeted by our server. Then when we finally got our food which took longer than it should have, we all got wrong items. I ordered my burger  with peper jack cheese and received provolone cheese. My friend ordered garlic fries and receiver sweet potato fries. I order Mac and cheese and had to wait another 5 minutes just for my Mac and cheese which should have came with my burger, and it came out ice cold in the middle and only luke warm around the edges. And my girlfriends drink was super watered down and when she said something to the server he said that he realized the color wasn't right so he tried another machine but it looked the same. So my question is why would you bring someone a drink if you noticed that it didn't look right? I will not be returning to this location.

Absolutely horrendous service! Avoid at all costs during dinner time unless you enjoy a minimum of a 2 hour dinner. Servers don't even know what's in the burgers. Asked for the bill multiple times. Mine as well take your cup of water to the bathroom and fill it up with the faucet. Every employee needs to get canned and corporate should consider hiring people who actually want to work. I feel the waiter should have tipped me.

They get two stars based on their delicious food, minus the fruit which is clearly frozen and thawed out (not fresh). One star only for the one server we had who was great, he was attentive, nice, did everything right but that's where it ends. I went on a Sunday and the place was so dirty, there was papers and food all over the floor, even where new guests were being sat, they didn't bother to even sweep before sitting new people to the tables. The bathrooms were gross, especially the changing table, I had to use paper towels to line it so my daughter wouldn't get dirty, it had used and dirty Napkins in it and was just filthy, as if they never even once cleaned it. The hostesses were now welcoming and just sat you down, don't bother to make eye contact or talk to you. I'm not sure if I'll return yet, maybe for just to go orders.

The place was packed, people were 15 deep at the door. We were seated in 15 min. and got a small table. After waiting for 7 min. the General Manager came over with menus and asked if she could get us drinks. The waiter for that station was serving a large party of 18, so she filled in and made sure we were taken care of.  We ordered the Prime Chophouse Burger and the California Chicken Sandwich. Both were juicy, delicious and hit the spot.  I worked in a restaurant for over 10 years so I commend management who support their staff when it's needed. The customers looked like they were enjoying their time there.

We love this restaurant. Great place to bring the whole family. The burgers are great, plus they have a variety of other menu options. We do miss the family-friendly games they used to have in the lobby - We wish they would go back to their original format. The staff is great. Parking can be a challenge at times - so be patient if you come on a Friday night or a weekend.

I come here for two reasons.   First, endless fries.  And second,  I want to be punished with the absolute worst service possible.  There's a reason there's usually a long wait.  It's because their wait staff keeps effing up.  Want to know where Denny's and IHOP recruits?  Right here.  But I don't fault the wait staff entirely.   Management is just as much to blame for poor training.  Getting comps for messing up is growing old.

I havne't eaten at a Red Robin for 10+ years. Never would I have thought I will become a fan. I had the hamburger with egg and it was delicious. Service was great. Price was a bit expensive and we had to wait 20 minutes for a table but, overall a good experience. I'll will return the next time I'm craving a burger.

Location/Ambiance: Located in the Paseo De Saratoga shopping center which is full of things to do, eat, and buy. I usually go here before going to the AMC in that plaza and appreciate that I can have dinner before a movie without having to get in my car in between. Red Robin is a chain restaurant and has that chain restaurant ambiance. Clean, large, with ample seating. I went one weekend and the wait was 30-40 for two people.  Food/Prices: I'm usually not a fan of chain restaurants but Red Robin is not too shabby. They have consistently good "gourmet" burgers at a good price that are served with delicious, BOTTOMLESS steak fries. I always get the Guacamole Bacon Burger ($9.89) - SO good! Fresh guacamole with a hint of lime, crispy bacon strips, and swiss cheese - droooool! You can customize your burger so that's a plus. One of the best things is their HONEY MUSTARD. Sometimes I crave that more than the burger. Also, their Red Robin seasoning turns those steak fries into a party. It's mainly a burger place but there are also other entrées like pasta and sandwiches but I'd avoid anything but a burger. There's a bar if you'd like an alcoholic beverage with your meal as well. Service: Good. I'd give Red Robin 3.5 stars if I could.
Great food - great service Great for the whole family TV for sports  Service was quick and accurate Very helpful Friendly to kids Good drink menu and food options Burgers are the best choice

What were we thinking coming here on a Friday evening?!!!  luls, actually we were starving and our first two attempts at dinner failed so we "settled" with Red Robin's delicious burgers! We left the crazy lines and waiting in the cold rain at Orenchi and Kahoo and decided we were too hungry to search for another ramen place. Got here and saw the mob of people and started to silently sob. It worked out perfectly though because as we were about to become forced anorexics we saw the sign for happy hour, which starts at 8PM. It was 8:02! Yaaay $3.50 imported beer! Put our name on the 45 minute wait list (with the assistance of a very organized, hardworking host =] ) and headed to the bar where we had multiple beers and raspberry margaritas :D The bartenders were kinda lame, carding us multiple times... whaaa they don't take the time to remember their customers' faces anymore? The margaritas were a waste of time and money because they were so weak and the glasses came out stickyicky.  After about an hour, my boyfriend left to check on our spot in line and was told we just had a couple more minutes. We attempted to finish up at the bar so other people could sit but no bartenders were around to charge us! Being the good people that we are, we told the host that came to get us later that we never got charged for anything. he said he'd take care of it... more on that later.  got seated and our server was super friendly! We weren't even in her section! Our section's server was on lunch so this server just picked up an extra table... so nice of her considering it was madness in the restaurant.  I had the Bleu Ribbon burger and my boyfriend had the Whiskey River BBQ Burger. I have this unhealthy addiction to their honey mustard sauce so I generously poured it onto my burger, which took away the already subtle melted bleu cheese taste. The blue cheese was definitely there though because my tummy reminded me starting an hour later =)  Random note: I never have room for refills of the steak fries. So much for "bottomless" =(  We got the check and they still hadn't charged us for all the bar drinks! But of course on our way out, my boyfriend stops by the bar and tells the bartender she never charged us (what a stand-up guy!). She gives us this look, "Who are you?" but then remembers and for the first time all night, smiles at us and makes light conversation -_______- Confession: I used to not like Red Robin all that much because I'm so bad at eating burgers... gets too messy! But I've slowly but surely overcome my awkwardness eating burgers, and with my new skills, I had a delicious (tipsy) meal at Red Robin!  BUT the next day I saw a commercial for their $6.99 promotional burger =( missed out!

Warning!  Don't go to this restaurant after 9pm at night because the cooks have checked out and don't want to make anything.  The rest of the staff is standing around or chatting in a corner.   This is the second time this has happened to me and I should have learned the first time.  It won't be happening again!  We ordered burgers with sweet potato fries.  We also ordered appetizers before the meal and I specifically told our waitress that I wanted them first.  Everything came out together and the fries were burnt.  The bun was all soggy also.  I was surprised she even brought those fries out.  We told her they were burnt and we wouldn't eat them and asked for some fresh ones.  I saw her go and talk to the cook and he says there will be a long wait for them because now he has to make more.  I also had to ask someone in the front for some sugar because our waitress took our order and didn't come back till she brought our meal.  And we had to ask for napkins and silverware too.  I did ask to speak to a manager and told her that the cook had an attitude and she should talk to him.  I didn't blame the waitress because she was taking care of too many tables by herself.  I blame management.  There are many burger places and I won't be back!
Shannon was awesome. One of the best servers I have ever had. No joke. She improved my 1 star to a 5 star+.

This location is located in my hometown. With the recent closure of Kirk's Steakburgers, Red Robin has been pushed into the spotlight as the leading burger(s) within a 5 mile radius of my parent's house.  The restaurant is SUPER cheesy. Its like since Bullwinkles and Chucky Cheese filed for chapter 7 decades ago,and Red Robin bought up all their gadgets and put it in their restaurant; which in turn, makes it very child-friendly. Their walls are also filled with a bunch of theme-less random pictures. I thinkt they're going for an 50's American thing, but there are movie posters of the Matrix, and maybe even Speed 1. Maybe its a  Keanu (sp) Reeves theme. Anyway, the burgers are (not) gourmet but they are delicious. And to define not gourmet i mean that the quality of meet is not any where up to par. When they ask for temperature they ask "a little pink or no pink" which means that the quality of meet is unsafe to eat anywhere below medium-well. Um.... scary? But their Bonzai Burger combines sweet and hickory flavors which is enough for me to risk being sick for 3 weeks with food poisoning.  Oh yea, service is shoddy. Once i waited 50 minutes for a togo order.  Go here if you are: A. A family looking for a fun night out. AMC theateres is right next to it so burgers, kids, movies. Fun for everyone! B. Craving Burgers with the boys. Or you could go to Johnny Rockets, who is closeby as well.

Terribly slow every time we come, thought it was just a fluke but happens every time, so we had to ban this place. Foods decent but the service is so awful no matter what time you come. Took 2 hours even after we sat down

I AM LITERALLY SO DONE. The service is terrible. our waiter is just goofing off and took a shot of beer. i am never coming back. the food is such a rip off. go to in and out people. because this restaurant is not worth it.

2.5 stars, primarily due to weakness of the service Red Robin, even though a chain, has decent burgers but their service is suspect, especially when the restaurant is busy. I went here with friends one Saturday evening. The bulk of the menu at Red Robin is (of course) burgers, though they do have other things such as fish and chips, and something they call clamstrips.. which I assume are chicken strips except with claims.  I had the Royal Burger, which has a fried egg on top. It was a solid burger, but the egg was a bit overcooked (and not runny enough). For around $10, the price isn't too bad for a gourmet burger given that you get endless steak fries. However, when the restaurant is busy, they seem to be stingier with the fries.. perhaps because they don't have enough. At the same time, if you're going to pay $10 for a burger, you may as well go to a non-chain place that has (likely) better and fresher ingredients.  It's the service that really hinders Red Robin though. We had to wait about 15 minutes before anyone even came for a drink order... and even then, we had to get a server's attention. Even for a chain restaurant, our server was a tad incompetent.. she messed up two of our orders, and inexplicably only filled my root beer float halfway. The service all throughout the meal remained slow.  Basically, Red Robin is only good for the occasional burger, but if you want something a tad bit better (with infinitely more capable service), there are a lot of places in the Bay Area with great burgers.

Red Robin is a great place to go if you are looking for a great burger and a kid-friendly restaurant. We were at the Saratoga location this past Sunday after seeing the Lorax with our 2 1/2 year old daughter. The restaurant was quite crowded when we got there around 6 but the wait was not bad. The manager on duty that night was extremely friendly and patient with our daughter when she asked for a balloon. Although they did not have any strings for the balloon, she went out of her way to get a straw to tie her balloon to.  This may seem like a small or insignificant fact to some but as a mother, I was very pleased to see her take the time to make my daughter happy. She even got down on her level to talk to her and when a couple approached to put their name on the list for the wait, she told them she would be with them in just a minute. She seemed to be doing it because she truly cared and not because she had to. In this day and age, when most staff/managers at restaurants seem like they never want to be bothered by children, this small act of kindness made my daughter and in turn me, very happy!

Really disappointed with the service we received last night.  My sister and I took our Mom out to dinner...we arrived around 5:15PM and were seated...our waiter came by and took our order and brought our drinks...that was about the last time we had any contact with him....We waited and waited for our salads...yep that was all we ordered...it took at least 45 minutes...once our waiter rushed by and said your food will be up soon...15 min later we asked the hostess who happened to be walking by...can you find out what happen to our meals...she wasn't very nice...but said she would check with her manager...she came rushing by and said your food will be up soon..hmmm...we had heard that before.  Eventually, another server came by with our meals and while trying to balance everything on a tray shouted out the different items and handed them to us!  The only other time we saw our waiter was when he came by to give us the bill and a half hearted apology for it taking so long....We had ordered a meal to go for our Dad who was at home...but this guy didn't remember and we didn't remind him because we didn't want to wait another hour...Yep think I will pass on this place!

It was date night with the boyfriend and we wanted to go somewhere we could watch the Sharks game. When we walked in none of the TVs were playing the game but they were nice enough to put the game on. Although I liked that we were able to watch the last period and overtime in it's entirety, it made me upset that we had to wait about 30 minutes for our food while tables seated after us got served before. I ordered a Crispy chicken salad and my boyfriend ordered a chicken sandwich. To me that shouldn't take that long of a time. I give them three stars because I would probably go back.

On Monday, we arrived before 12noon.  We had a party of 8, and it was very quiet and empty (about 6 small tables were occupied at the time we walked in, and there was no wait to get seated).  Great!  We should be able to get a yummy lunch and be back with plenty of time to spare.... Or so we thought!  :( Although there were very few customers, it took a little while before our server came to take our orders.   At 12:30, we finally had to ask our server what happened to our food... She said it was coming in a minute... Some more time passed (a lot more than 1 minute), and we still hadn't received any food, so we asked them to take the food to go, as we were now going to be late for our work meeting.  It took over 15 minutes just to get our food packed up!  If indeed our food was just about ready to be served... We could have managed to scarf it down in the time to get it packed for us!  I do have to say at least they managed to pack the hot foods in a separate bag from the cold foods.  BUT, of course, they didn't include utensils for the salad, nor did they include any Ketchup for the fries... Nor the extra orders we asked for since we would no longer be able to cash in on our unlimited fries!  :(. She also said we could get cups for our drinks... And while she gave us Togo cups for our waters and two of the paid drinks (which they didn't get any refills on while we were seated...)... The other two of the paid drinks never actually materialized! The bill took a really long time to arrive after we asked, even after our server knew we were running extremely late.  Then it took even longer to get the bill picked up to run a credit card.  When they finally picked it up, it took a really long time to get the slip back, so we finally gave up and went to the front register to get it ourselves.  One car stayed behind to take care of the card and wait for the forgotten drinks while my car left first. Of course, but the time we got to work (less than 10 minutes away), the fries had that sogginess to it (which we couldn't hide with ketchup even, as our waitress forgot, even though we asked for it and she said she would get it for us) and the burger just didn't hit the spot. Needless to say, definitely NOT my best Red Robin experience.  I guess we won't becoming back here again for lunch.  (We had come with a large party a few years back and had great service... So unfortunately, I guess things have gone south since.). :(

This place sucks. Don't go here unless you want to wait 50 minutes to an hour for your food. Once the food gets to you its cold and tastes like the troll in the Hobbit part 1 not 2 took a crap on your plate.

location: West San Jose, San Jose, CA
review: NEVER COMING BACK! Ugh worst service ever! Came here on 2/26 with my boyfriend and I have never experienced Red Robin this way. We have been coming here for years and occasionally we've had to wait longer than usual, but the food was always decent. Tonight, we got there at 6:40 and were told it was a 20 minute wait. Not bad, so we waited. We were finally seated at 7:05. It took about 5 minutes for the waitress to come and greet us and take our drink orders. We ordered our appetizer and our food at the same time. The appetizer came out really quick. We finished that and then the waiting began...we waited. And waited. Until I finally asked the waitress about our food. Meanwhile, I had seen my salad sitting on the line for about 15 to 20 minutes. She brings my salad out, the chicken was cold. The waitress tells us that the burger was just being put together now. They hadn't even fired it!!! The burger finally came out about 8pm and it was raw inside!!! The cheese wasn't melted, and the fries were soggy!!! I couldn't believe it. We asked for a manager immediately. She came out, offered to cook the hamburger herself and get me a fresh salad. Guess what? The burger was STILL raw! The manager was apologetic, but kept touching my boyfriend on the arm, inappropriate if you ask me. I ate a bit of my salad, but we were so turned off, we left without paying.  Needless to say, we will NEVER go back. How can a hamburger place fail so miserably and not be able to cook a damn hamburger properly!?! And by the way, the habits of the staff while pulling food from the line, is disgusting. They will touch your food, fondle your fries and be sure to touch the hamburger buns after touching everything. So gross. We saw it all tonight.
Bartender Cristal was very helpful and friendly. Burger was cooked as ordered and the fries were heavenly. Too bad the fries aren't on my NY resolution diet!

I love Red Robin, just hate this particular location.  This has been my third visit to this location as I normally go to the Rivermark location very consistent food quality .  This location really needs some help on how food is prep, as my table ordered four burgers that was completely over cooked or technically "burnt".  Not only was the food burnt, but the burgers served was only slightly room temp warm and not hot like a gourmet burger should be "fresh".  I think this location needs to remove the "Gourmet Burger" title from this location. I will definitely will not be visiting this location again.

my friend adn I took our kids here this past weekend for lunch before we went to the movies. As usual the FOOD was A ++++ The service was great. Our server was Billy and he was very attentive and our glasss were never empty As usual RED ROBIN you ROCK! thank you!

I like coming to this location because i usually do dinner and movies with my boyfriend since AMC is just across the parking lot. So I came in on 3/16/14 and the experience was just terrible!! I came with my boyfriend and 2 of his buddy's  to do dinner and movies, We arrived and got put on the wait-list at 7:09 they called us in around 7:29. We got our beverages as soon we sat down. They took our food order at 7:45 and we didn't get our food until 8:30!! Our movie started at 9!! 45 minutes just to get our food. We didn't even get to enjoy our food! As soon as we got our food we literally gulped our burgers down and left around 8:50! 1 star for the food because it was good but I didn't get to enjoy it..
SUPER excited about the gluten free bun!!! They have a gluten-free menu, but last time I was in the bun wasn't listed on it. Ask for it, though! It was great!

HORRIBLE experience. We received a text message saying our was 35 minutes. After waiting for 70 minutes we finally got seated. The waiter came over and said he "would be with us shortly". It took 30 minutes to get our drinks. Total time we were there was 2 1/2 hours. Not acceptable!!!

Hmm. I ate here twice and both times I was pretty disappointed.  I ordered their special burger and split it with a friend, the vegetables on it might as well have been fake, they didn't taste like anything. The burger was so-so, I couldn't taste all of the ingredients it claimed to have.  I asked for garlic fries and somehow we ended up with 2 baskets of regular fries and a basket of garlic fries. I remember their fries being so good and now I had way more french fries than I could eat and they tasted like nothing but the ranch I was drowning it in to salvage it. Bleh.

Not impressed. Last time I was here was great. But this trip we had two people in our group whose food came out wrong. One had a raw hamburger. Not rare but raw when I was ordered well done. The replacement burger took at least another 20 minutes. Just awkward.  Not sure if I'll be back. I'll try other places first. Food was ok once it was cooked properly but service needs a lot of help.

Real close to a 4 but nothing was extremely spectacular enough to stay in my memory. What I like about red robin is definitely the fries the fries are huge crispy hot and just plain delicious I mix the ketchup with the seasoning they have at each table and I create my very own delicious concoction. second, I love the freckled lemonade... soooooooooooooooooo gooooood It seems like it doesn't take much for them to create but honestly I dont really care its delicious. the bacon burger was pretty good but I'm always expecting more from these 10 dollar burgers. It might be perhaps that I have a rather extreme attachment with in n out that when ever I see another burger the comparisons fly in :X anyways not a bad place to take your friends out to eat if you've never tried it before.

I really like this place. But I can't bring myself to say "I love it". When my wife used to work at The Rack across the street (and I was unemployed) we would meet during her lunch breaks and eat here pretty frequently. Now we're hardly ever in the area and haven't eating there in a long time. Their food is delicious and ample. I never left hungry or without leftovers. The price is a TAD bit high. Like $10 more (for two) than Chili's, but cheaper than The Counter. Quality is almost on par with The Counter. Since it is a family restaurant and it serves American food, expect a lot of birthday songs, and fat, noisy kids running around.

We had a very enjoyable time here, we do not know why we see the review with the service unacceptable.  We showed up on a Tuesday night and we had very good service, the only reason I am not giving this a 5 star rating is I had order extra fries during the evening and the kitchen had to make them which took forever, and we needed to get back home and get the kids ready for bed. Other than that the waitress was great and the hostess got us to a table fast with our drinks right behind that.  We look forward to coming back with our kids, as they do love this place and yes before you ask, we have been here on weekends when the place is crazy busy and our service has been just as good if not better.

I hate fat fries. You know what I'm talkin' about- The cut of potato your mom tried to pass off to you as a french fry when you were little. No thanks! The only redeeming factor is the seasoning. Salt, paprika, a little garlic and lord knows what else..... If you're into grease and artery clogging - try out their tower of onion rings. If nothing else, it's aesthetically pleasing. Ok, not really. But it's a sight to be seen.  The mushroom burger and the whiskey river BBQ burger are fantastic... bring your appetite, these bad boys are big.   I hear the turkey burgers are some of the best around.  It's not where to write home about but they'll suffice.  And so my hunt for the perfect burger place ensues.

Red Robin is delicious. Their burgers are a little pricey, but they are the best I've had. My current favorite is their Royal Red Robin Burger. The ranch dip is amazing and goes really well with their Bottomless Steak Fries, I never go without it. My only complaint is they replaced their Grilled Chicken Pesto Pasta with Southwest Chicken Pasta, but they seem to change their pasta every now and then anyway, so I have hope they'll bring it back eventually. :)

Food was alright, nothing to special I've tried it all, the menu didn't seem to impress me! What I didn't like is the fact the tables don't have napkins, you have to ask for them! What kind of shit is that! Don't recommend this for a date night! Go to in n out instead !

Always a hit with the kids.  This chain started out of Seattle across the canal from UW. Once a week they parade an employee in a red robin outfit to hand out ballons to the kids (don't remember what week night). They specialize in hamburgers, but also have a few chicken items.  Mac and cheese is typical kraft, but you can substitute fruit for fries on the kid menu items  Vegetarians can get a veggie patty which is actually pretty good. Unlimited fries and drink refills allows you to be a glutton. Their cookie magic Oreo shakes are great .  They've got one of the better mixed drink menus in town.  If you got room for dessert try their mud pie, it's huge!

Food was 3 stars :( got a turkey burger...correction. "SANDWICH". It didn't blow my mind, but it was palatable. The steak fries were pretty on point though. However, the reason I wish to review my experience here today is based solely on the the CHARMING waitress we had *insert sarcasm* named Shannon. When she took my order I told her I would take the grilled turkey burger. She read my order back to me as the turkey sandwich, which in my experience is a completely different dish. So I wanted to clarify with her that the "sandwich" would come with a turkey PATTY (not deli slices) and would come on a hamburger bun! And she replies impatiently... "yes, the sandwich." Ok. Maybe she is having a bad night, I'll let that one go. What really bugged me was when she actually brought my food to me. She says and I quote "Here's your turkey BURGARRRR. Don't take offense." Is she serious?! Not only that, she was not attentive to our table at all even though there weren't many other patrons at the time. The other members of our party complained that things we asked for were brought to us at a much later time. Average food, bad service. I will not be back.

I've been back several times since my last review and I'm quite impressed. With new management comes progress. Their staff have increased in production instead of just standing around and their new menu is fantastic.
Poor service. Subpar burgers. This is suppose to be a burger joint right? Only upside are the steak fries.

Red Robins has one of the best burgers in town.  I have come here so many times and I like to try any new burgers when they come out with.  The service isn't always top notch but that's because it's always so packed, so I can't complain.  My favorite is the California Chicken Sandwich.  I haven't had a burger here that I don't care for except the new low calorie turkey burger.  Of course, I was warned that it taste like sausage.  If you like sausage, then your fine.   You can't beat the bottomless fries, which are the bomb.  If it weren't for the burger and fries costing around $10, I would have given it 5 stars.

Red Robin 1 : mmzzyeahh 0 Great service by Anna though! 2.99 rootbeer float unlimited...I could only conjre up 2. Bleu Burger, now it was great until the cajun sauce of some sort mixed the cheese up and it wasn't true bleu. The compromise here left us hanging...and the burger obviously didn't look nearly as big or as good as the pictures. JUMP START DOUBLE 5.49, DO NOT ORDER THIS 5 pieces of mozarella and just jalapenos mannn total rip! too much batter on the jalapenos and the mozarella was not heated enough to get the cheese melted to perfection!
Very poor service and cold food makes for a waste of money and never a return trip. Good chain but NO one is paying Attention at this location.

My boyfriend really likes the burgers here and they do have a pretty hefty collection of them but the only reason I wanted to go because I was getting a free burger for my birthday! Go on their website and join their birthday club and you'll get a free one where you can print out your e mail and bring it in hassle free.  It says to participating Red Robins but this one took it no question.  There was no wait on a Saturday late afternoon, our sever was nice and cordial, and the food was timely.  I got the Pub Burger which was one of their newer ones with the onion bread, mushrooms, cheese, meat, etc and it was good.  Had them cut it in half so I could eat the rest later and substituted the fries for fruit.  My choice was watermelon or cantaloupe.  While I was waiting for my food I noticed the nutritional menu and there is an entire menu basically telling you how much calories and fat you're putting in your body. lol.  I couldn't believe how high some of the items were.  Maybe that was part of my motivation for only eating half of my burger.  Anyways the burger was good and their free burger on your bday is cool.  Not the healthiest of foods but hey what isn't.

First, let me say the waiter was great, trying to keep us happy, my order the seafood one was fine, but my wifes burger had sweet potatoe fries with it, plus, they charge you more for sweet potatoe fries, hers came ice cold, like right from the fridge, next they have these idiot boxes on the table, probably named after the guy that invented them. You can call the waiter or ad things to your meal, well, maybe not, it only flashes a red light on top & IF your waiter sees it, he comes over! He eventually did about 10 minutes later, by this time my wife was almost done with her burger, he apologized for the cold fries & ordered more, 10 minutes later by the time they came she was already done with the meal, so was I, they still sit on the table for the next VICTIM, uu, customer! The manager comes over to see how the meal was, we give her the spill, she offers to take fries off bill, WOWWW, really, $1.40, definitely makes us feel like NEVER coming back, slap in the face!! Only been there twice in my life & I'm 60, WILL NOT EVER BE IN AGAIN,....YAHOOOOO!! Oh Yea, #UCK OFF!!

I think the drinks are really the best thing here. But, they have decent food and decent pricing. Endless fries and endless drinks on strawberry lemonade, root beer floats... I'll be back, but mostly for the drinks!

Great place to go eat if you have kids! I will bring the family out every once in awhile and we usually have another family join us for dinner. This place always has balloons and crayons ready when we show up to eat. The kids menu is standard eats, but we have never had an issue with the little guys not finding something they like. Its usually loud inside due to all the family's around. We usually go during dinner time, i don't know what the sound level is like during lunch. They have a great selection of burgers and endless french fries. You also wont break the bank eating here. Awesome place to enjoy a dinner out with the family.

Okay so I'm normally a fanatic about this place. REEEED Robin YUM! But someone totally dropped the ball the other night on my to go order. The lady who took our order over the phone asked us three times "no pink"? I told her "well done" "no pink please". She explicitly asked me several times so I imagine she wrote it down right, but come to find out by the time I get the food home my burger was bordering medium rare.  I ate it anyhow, it wasn't like it was inedible or anything, and I'm not super picky about it as long as it's not going to make me sick, but I do prefer well done. I've had way better from this place. If you want to try something good go for the banzai burger, just go when they're not super busy if you want their highest quality eats.

Service is ok here, but the food is meh. 1)  The home made wing sauce they have is funky, some weird aftertaste in their recipe.  Also, they were fatty and low quality. 2) Burger was tasty, but the buns are oily and sticky, felt like I need to wash my hands after every time I picked it up.   Annoying.    Generally this place is like Bj's and many other chain joints, looks nice but I always walk away feeling unsatisfied.

My husband and I came here to eat after seeing the suckiest movie we've seen in a long time, Cop Out. Don't waste your money on that movie unless you're a die hard fan. Pun intended. Anyways, the food here is the typical greasy, fatty and unheatlhy food that you'd find at most American places. I was hungry though so ordered the chicken burger with onion rings. For a $1.00 extra, you can subsitute onion rings for the bottomless fries. You can also get bottomless refills on almost all of their nonalcoholic drinks. There is a nutrition chart on the table which I read of course and found out that most of the items there are about 900+ calories and that excludes the fries.  The funny thing is the fat content wasn't included, just the saturated fat was listed. I guess they don't want to scare people too much. My guess is that my fried chicken burger had  twice the amount of a McDonald's McChicken sandwhich as it was big but a little bland. Honestly, the McChicken sandwhich is much better IMHO. I feel so ashamed for eating over a whole days worth of calories late at night.  Ugh! I'll try to eat healthier from now on as hard as it is for me at times. BTW, the salads aren't low in calories either, so you might as well have a burger or a bunless one. Still, you'll be consuming close to 600 calories. Also, if you happen to be a little larger than average, don't let them sit you in a small two person booth as my husband who is only sort of overweight had a hard time getting out of the booth. I'm not kidding. I guess the table is just too close to the seat. One last thing, finding parking at this location can be challenging, especially on the weekend.

I have become a huge burger lover thanks to my BooBear and of course, a FRY WHORE, so hearing on the radio about their bottomless fries, I made an executive decision and had J take me to Red Robin to carb it up! We were seated in a booth by the kitchen, which was a bit distracting but our server made up for the crap table. Sabrina (our server) was very upbeat and patient with us (and the other tables she was looking after) and I really appreciate that, for it was my first time coming here in about 6 years and was unsure of what to order. I ended up choosing the Chophouse burger and J picked the Burning burger(?). The flavors in my burger were nice but the portion size was ridiculously small and Jason didn't like his burger much either and both of us agreed that for the price, it was a rip-off. However, the massive amount of steak fries that Sabrina kept bringing over to us made up for the pitiful sized burger. If we did come back, I would stick to stealing fries and maybe getting an appetizer instead; getting a burger smaller than a single In N Out burger for 3 times the price is ludicrous.
I don't think we've ever had bad service here. The waitstaff often go out of their way to refill drinks and fries quickly. They are very accommodating regarding special orders.

Why do any of you blame this Red Robin for parking issues?  They have no control over that.  Also, many of you complain about not being served promptly or not getting refills on your drinks or fries rapidly.  Every time I have been here there has been no problem with the service.

we kept hearing how busy our server "Billy" was. No napkins , no utensils. Went to ask the girl behind the bar, but I had to wait while she finished texting. They brought the wrong order, then brought the right order minus the avocado. The only things paying us any attention were the gnats flying around the tables. We should have left as soon as Billy said "I'll be with you as soon as I POSSIBLY can"  J. Alves

I love red robin!! Their service is usually great at times you'll get the servers who are slower then the others, but the food makes up for it, haha! I always get the Chicken Ciabatta! It is the best with basket of endless garlic or regular fries with ranch & camp fire sauce! THE BEST! The whiskey burger is DELICIOUS too!! All at good prices (around $28 for two chicken ciabatta's and endless fries!

Terrible! Three times I ordered food here, it comes out ice cold.They made a huge mistake downsizing the menu, so the foods I did like are no more. Its not just this restaurant,  but all of them. Cold food and poor service. Never again will I or everyone else I know will eat here.

My family and I went the other week to this place.   Service was fine, but my food was horrific... I decided to get the steak sliders.  It came with 3-4 sliders, but i could barely put one down.  It was the worst meat I have ever tasted... I brought it home let the wife try it and she thought it was the worst thing she had ever eaten.  I gave the rest to my dogs(one ate it up- he eats everything, the other one wouldn't touch it).   This isn't the first bad food experience from this place(in the past the wife has asked for well done burgers, and the meat came out still alive).   The only reason I gave it 2 stars, was the service was decent.
1st time visitors to RR...won't be the last. Speedy service, excellent wait staff, friendly atmosphere, GREAT food, excellent prices. We will be back.

Craving for unlimited steak/garlic fries and a good burger? You found it!  Red Robin's gourmet burgers come at 'gourmet' prices, but the quality and service has been worth the extra $$.  The hubs and I came here for dinner and got a server who was trying a bit too hard to keep us happy, but I ain't complaining.  I was able to substitute fries with a house salad at no extra cost with my fish burger. The server brought us a basket of steak fries while we waited, then refilled when our order came. He even asked if we wanted to try the garlic fries.  After the meal, he asked if we had room for dessert, we were pretty full, so said we were going to pass. Then he said he would even give us a free scoop of ice cream, tempting, but it was too cold and we were stuffed from three baskets of fries!  Overall, an above-average burger joint.  We will be back.  If it's your b-day, Red Robin even will come out and sing for you. :)

tasty burger and love the steak fries.  they have a fully stocked bar which also creates a palpable and necessary barrier between people not wanting to be surrounded by kids hopped up on mike shakes and soda floats and the parents that have to deal with the sugar rushes.
Good burgers, steak fries. I had the mushroom, Swiss burger, so yummy!! The fish and chips are really good too.
Good food worst service that i have ever had order drinks 10 min later you see them ask for more frys 20 min latter nothing wont be going back

Went to dinner with my wife and kids today I was a little reluctant after reading the reviews about their service . Didn't know what to order and our waitress Kristen suggested the banzai burger and the endless fries. It was outstanding. And the fries kept coming. Its not often when I have a waitress that is so nice and sweet. Thank you Kristen for making our dining experience so enjoyable!!! Will be back again for sure.
This place gets packed at dinner time so come early.   Awesome burgers! Bottomless Fries! Cold Beer!  What's not to like?
Service is not the typical Red Robin quality. Looks like they're having management problems. Serious ones.

Don't waste your time or money.  There is no management at this place and it is a zoo.  We waited 20 minutes for water and another 30 to get our food.  My burger was supposed to be "a little pink" and it was well done to burned.  Nobody every came back to check on us so I didn't even have a chance to send it back.  We waited in the lobby for a table for 20 minutes to begin with and there were several empty, dirty tables sitting there waiting to be cleaned.  You could drive to In N Out by the airport or Oakridge and get a better hamburger, eat it and be back to Saratoga before you get your food at Red Robin.  Go down the parking lot to Mimi's, they have a fabulous hamburger and good service.
Wonderful service, very good food. I like how they have substitution options, like gluten-free or broccoli instead of fries. I'd go back!

Been to a lot of red robins and this one confuses me more than any of them. I cannot understand why its a 20 min wait to get seated when you can blatantly look in and see a whole section empty. Warranted i can understand if there is not enough staffing, but considering the one in Eastridge or Rivermark will fill the whole place while short staffed i am sure this one can too. Also if i have to flag down a buser to find me a server or to refill my drinks there is something wrong.

My family and I came here after we participated in the Luminate 5k run in San Jose.  This location is close to home and we frequent quite a bit.  My kids and I love the menu and how kid friendly it is.  Normally I wouldn't bother with a review except that this was my worst experience in the restaurant.  We got there at about 9pm and it was a 20 min wait.  Not bad for a Saturday night.  The new app allowed us to view our waiting time and how many parties were ahead of us.  When we were seated(about 20 min wait) the hostess gave us the menus right away.  We already had our order ready since we go so often.  Plus the kids were getting antsy since it was past bedtime.  It took about 10 min before our waiter Brandon showed up.  No apologies or intros.  Just "Are you ready to order?"  Yes of course we were!  We've been waiting for 10 min!  We placed our orders and food came out in a timely manner.  Brandon however was not the one to bring out the food nor did he check on us while we were eating.  No drink refills extra napkins nothing!  1 waiter checked on us in passing and a hostess offered placemats and crayons.  That was all the service we received.  He was not on a break because I had plain view of him checking up on his tables across from ours.  When we were all finished eating, I had my credit card ready to pay.  We waited about 20 min before he showed up to ask how we were doing finally.  I gave him the card and told him we were loyalty members which he did not ask.  Worst service we have received here.  I don't have high expectations for chains but we have never had an issue here.  Makes me want to choose another kid friendly restaurant so that i can avoid the server!

Pros: Great burgers & fries. Try the onion rings! *drools* Cons: ALWAYS HAVE TO WAIT FOR A TABLE! Servers are often forgetful/ditsy. Don't expect many refills on drinks or fries. Even if you're name is on the list for a table, doesn't matter if it's for 2 or 10 people, they often call the wrong name or somehow "forget" you were on the list. Cocktails totally not worth the price (watered down). Parking can be a hassle (right by movie theater).

I have been coming to this location once or twice a year for about 9 years and recently went for my birthday. I ordered the Beserker (promotional burger tied in with the Wolverine movie). It was supposed to be a burger with aoli and Sriracha onion straws on a brioche bun. I asked for the aoli on the side since I don't usually like my burger slathered with greasy condiments. When I got it, the overall taste was okay, but I didn't taste the Sriracha at all. So, I asked the server if I could have some extra on the side. He came back with a little cup of some kind of powder and said that was what they used. Sriracha powder?! That stuff is awesome! I sprinkled it lavishly all over my burger and fries, and that was the best burger meal I've ever had at Red Robin. Overall, I like coming here with my family. The service is usually pretty decent, and the updated decor is nice. My kids like having their junk food treat here and love stealing sips of Freckled Lemonade and the big, fat home fries. I wouldn't come here if you're watching your calories, though. Even the salads are pretty calorie-dense. I miss the free burger on your birthday without the hassle of getting the silly card, though. The last thing I need to tote around is another plastic "rewards" card - especially since I don't really eat there that often.

I love this place! My favorite server is Kristina! She is always friendly, you never have to ask for drink refills, and everything we asked for was brought quickly. Food is good nothing amazing but its  consistent.

Good service.  Probably the 2nd biggest quality I like to see in a restaurant (Number 1 of course being the actual taste of food).  Unfortunately, I've been here twice and it just wasn't there.  The 1st time I went here, our waitress complained to us about a party she had recently and their inability to resolve a problem.  Also, the server didn't write down our order and reversed the cooking doneness for our burgers.  The 2nd time we went, our waitress gave us our food and we didn't see her until it was time to pay.  No refill on water, no checking to see if we wanted more fries.  The funny thing is that we watched her talk to her co-workers at the bar right next to our booth.  We had to flag her down about 15 minutes after we took the last bite. As for the food, it's normally good at Red Robin.  I love the extensive menu and who can beat unlimited steak fries.  Their strawberry freckled lemonade is the best.  It's even free refills!  Since it's close to my house, I will probably give them another shot.  I like RR so much and I really want this location to succeed.  If anything changes, I will update my review.  ::crosses fingers::  However, it's like they say, 3 strikes and you're out!

REEEEEEEEEEED ROBIN... yyyyyuuuuuummmm.. i like a great burger, and red robeezeeeeeeee delivers.   i like the regular cheeseburger, as well as the hawaiian one.   the fries are awesome - steak fries!..  not sure about that stuff you shake on it, but i'm happy with a side of ranch and some ketchup! bring it!

Red Robin has always been pretty good. Service was good but i really usually just come for the bottomless fries. the burger that i like to get is the whiskey river burger, but i have tried the bacon guacamole burger before. I like the whiskey because its got great sauce, and the combo of the rings and bacon are great. the guac burger isnt that great because they usually put too much bacon on it. always get the tower of onion rings. DONT COUNT YOUR CALORIES CUZ YOULL BE DISSAPOINTED!

I took my 3 kids there for Mother's Day dinner (I can't wait until they start taking ME places!) and it was probably one of the best eating-out experiences I've had in a long time. Our waitress was ever-so-sweet, and SINCERE, and kept the sodas a'comin.  Yeah, baby, that's what I'm talking about.  Another coke before I finish this one!  Hey, my kid wants more fries! It was totally affordable, incredibly kid friendly, and super duper clean, including the bathrooms!  A novelty for a large chain. (was it wrong of me to fantasize about the crew lead, Dylan, with my kids at the table?) "Can I have some Dylan, I mean, bacon on that burger?" "Ooh, when you get the chance, can we have some more Dylans, I mean napkins?" "Can you point me towards your Dylans?  I mean, bathrooms?" "Nope, nothing else for us tonight, thanks, just bring the Dylan, I mean, bill." Yeah.  I'll be back.

Gourmet burgers my *ss . . . overcooked crumbly beef slathered in secret sauce is more like it. . . which in itself would have been tolerable if there hadn't been a half hour wait when we were pretty hungry . . .as in, gr8888888t we can wait outside in the 90 desgree heat with the guys sprawled so their bellies hang over their belts. Oh! Or we could get appetizers at the bar!! But no, they won't let you take take kids into that area.  No problem the host cleverly offers, you can just order appetizers to go. But no, says the barkeep, because it'll look to other customers who are waiting like you're getting served ahead of them. That's a hassle says me. . . What? Like it's my fault that people are too thick to start appetizers before ordering mains, or the wait staff is too clueless to care about their customers enough to suggest the alternative, or to offer even so much as a cool drink   I swear, the cattle on the menu were treated better than those made to wait in line at this place. The staff doesn't give a sh!% about anything except looking smug.  We left, and went to Kirk's.  The food was *FAR* better tasting, with fresher condiments, properly cohesive fresh meat in the burgers, and way better grilled. There was also zero wait, couteous service, and it cost half as much. I'm pleased to recommend the experience to anyone reading this review     For my money, the best burgers in Silicon Valley are at Kirk's, unless of course you'd be interested to try the the grill at the SJ Muni Golf Course.

I was there for dinner yesterday for a friends birthday and the waitress that we had wasn't as nice as I hoped she would be. She took a really long time to come and get our order, but she didn't even ask what drinks we wanted before we started to look at our menus. Instead she comes back after having taken our order and says, "oh, you guys didn't tell me what you wanted to drink". I was just thinking isn't that your job?  But the waitress that delivered our food was really nice.  I don't really like the whole new Red Robin look, the sign and the menu. It's just too much.
Way better than I remember Red Robin from past visits.

I've never liked this place, mainly based on just how much my annoying college roommate utterly venerated it. She would go at least once a week and come back with mountains of left-overs that would sit in the fridge until death overtook whatever  was once in them. I guess this was another case of Paramore: love the band, hate the fans. So Red Robin is actually a lot of fun. And I really have to hand it to my boyfriend. He was able to hype up a restaurant he enjoyed (and knew I would enjoy) if only he could get me there to see it. Great job, Love. Not only is Red Robin fun, it's quirky fun. From the crooked glasses to the collage motif, this is a pretty neat little diner. Of course I had to order the tortilla soup. I would rate it 3 in my Top 5, but that's not a bad ranking. It's just white-person tortilla soup with no spicy kick. I could see how lots of people like it. Boyfriend had a famous burger and (bottomless) steak fries. He greatly enjoys the (rather tasty) freckled lemonade. I got a strawberry milk shake. Chili cheese chip dip was generous and delicious. Great recommendation, waitress-who-looked-like-a-grown-up-Tammi-Seckle-3­rd-grade-best-friend.

We stopped in the other night craving restaurant-style burgers and were in the neighborhood.  We ordered regular cheeseburgers with unlimited fries & free soda refills.  Red Robin is very popular with families - so prepare yourself for lots of screaming kids & wait for a table.  I unfortunately had one right behind me grabbing my hair and throwing fries at our table.  But I digress - that's an issue for his inattentive parents and not Red Robin.   Our burgers were great - steak fries were just ok.  The cost of the meal seemed a little overpriced for what it was.  We were sorely disappointed by the service.  Our waitress simply brought us our drinks, our food, and never came back.  We would have loved refills of the fries with our actual meal but were never offered more.  By the time we asked someone else for drink refills, almost 30 minutes had gone by since she dropped off our meals.  When we finally did ask for more fries, she made no effort to hide her annoyance that she had to go get us more.  Again, another 30 minutes went by we had to grab a busser to ask for the check.   I don't think we'll be back, but may stop in for take-out.

My 10 year old and I got to spend the afternoon together since Daddy and big bro were watching a movie that was too mature for him. So he got to choose where we had lunch. Server was ok, but it took over 30 minutes to get two chicken burgers and fries. At least the chicken was juicy, the fries were hot and crisp, and my little man ended up being very happy with our lunch.

great bugers well thats what they are known for.... the burgers are also very big so its easy to split with someone plus you get bottomless fries so that always good.  Please don't come here and order something else other than a burger yes the other stuff is still pretty good but come on the burgers here are just so dang good.

Is it just me, or is this chain going down the toilet these days?  I used to LOVE coming to this restaurant, but after the last two trips, I'm going to pass on it in future.  Even though the food tends to be pretty good, it's over-priced.  The service at this particular location also happens to suck like a Dyson Vacuum.  The waitstaff are never around to serve anything - probably because they are too busy sitting at friends' tables, on their cell phones, or just standing around gossiping with each other.  The last time I was there it took three of them to figure out where to seat us - even though the place was empty!   There are too many other great restaurants in the immediate area to waste on this place - instead, treat yourself to the provincial charm of "Mimi's Cafe," or even the bluster and good eats of the "Hometown Buffet" across the street, in the Westgate Mall.  There's also a "Johnny Rocket" in the same mall - their burgers are as good if not better than Red Robin's - and a real bargain compared to the Robin's prices!  Yummy :)
My friends and I enjoyed a tasty meal there this afternoon. The waitress was very helpful with my friend who has recently stopped eating wheat, making some great suggestions.

Michelle was our server. She was quick. Interacted with our little one perfectly and made our entire experience enjoyable. The only thing that kept it from being a 5 star score was a few of the food items were cooked incorrectly. Over done fries. Under done cheese sticks.

I love this Red Robin. As long as you avoid super-crowded times like weekend nights (it's across the parking lot from the movie theaters), you can get seated pretty quickly. I have had great service here every time. I take my 4 year-old niece frequently, and they are so good about working with kids. If you are on a gluten-free diet, they are happy to work with you to put together a tasty meal. I always get the burgers, of course, and they are always delicious. The fries are endless. Parking is a piece of cake in the huge lot unless, of course, you go during the aforementioned movie nights.

Impressions are deceiving!  A restaurant where the door is opened for you.  From the start the staff seemed compentent and friendly. I lost my faith in our waiter really quick, he mixed my appetizers with my sisters, thank god I don't mind my food touching someone elses.   My Turkey burger was great execept I asked for regular french fries and he brought and charged me 50 cents extra for Garlic Fries.   What part of my order of plain fries did you not understand.  I didn't enjoy my meal or experience at this Red Robin.

I definitely enjoy the burgers are red robin, but this location isn't the most impressive. Nothing wrong with the staff or environment whatsoever, I just enjoy a little more pep in employees step and general excitement. Trust me I know it's an exhausting job and people suck when ordering food, so again. Really nothing upsetting with this location. Maybe quicker service? Or perhaps not sending everyone on break at once.
love love love their onion ring thower thingy!

The food was very good, however, the restaurant was very busy and due to that, the service was not what we expected.  10 minutes to order beverages, asked for sugar and a glass of ice when they arrived, 10 minutes later nothing, waiter came and we asked again - he took off without taking order, so another 10 minutes before he returned and our meal order was taken.  30 more before we got our meal.  Don't get me wrong, the waiter was nice and they gave me a to go order of what I actually ordered, but I started out with the wrong meal.  My Passion Fruit Lemonade and my dining companions Iced Tea and Soda were all to be bottomless, but none of us were offered refills - not even on our water.  The sweet potato fries are also supposed to be bottomless, but again, no offer was made.  I didn't ask only because I was afraid it would take 20 more minutes to get my refill.  I will rethink this location in the future.

Don't go to this restaurant unless you like horrible service and improperly prepared sandwiches.  When I told the manager, Brian about the bad service and food and how I was not going to pay for my sandwich, he starting yelling at me "don't tell me how to do my job"  he then pulled out his cell phone and threatened to call the police on me for "running out on my bill".   Red Robin should know better than to put this guy in charge of a restaurant who knows nothing about customer satisfaction and being respectful of customers especially when the customers are senior citizens!

Big fail Red Robin! Went craving there onion rings our server took the order, her name was Charlotte! She placed the order and we never got our onion rings and our food came out after it was sitting on the counter for ten minutes! The manager brought out our food and we basically told him we no longer were going  to be eating there and our service was unacceptable! Charlotte you need to work on your serving skills cause you are not a very good one! I will not be going back anytime soon!

This place is alright to go and have dinner, I wouldn't recommend it since it does get packed at night and during lunch the waiter and servers are slow and it seems like they don't care much for their job. The burgers are amazing here which earned them 3 stars, but everything else is so-so, the price is ridiculous pricey. But what do you expect? It's a burger joint!

When my girlfriend suggested we try to Red Robin on a Saturday night before a movie, I had my doubts.  Sure enough, we were told it would be a 25 minute wait for a table.  However, if we were to seat ourselves at the bar, there wouldn't be a wait at all.  The (metaphorical) clouds parted, and there was a little table for two waiting for us by the bar.  Hooray! We didn't have to wait long for our food.  My avacado bacon burger was well done (at my request), and done well.  Gf enjoyed her chicken ceasar wrap and fruit salad.  We also drank tasty lemon drops, recommended to us by our server.   All in all, this dinner was an integral part of what made our date night a success.  Excellent.

I've only been here for lunch and 2 out of 3 times were bad experiences. First time, they forgot my order when I was eating with 2 coworkers and they had to bring it to me last-minute (I should have asked for it for free).  The manager even came by to apologize, but ugh.  I didn't even get to eat it because I didn't have enough time. Second time I got some fried chicken or something and it wasn't anything special.  Service was mediocre. Third time was the charm.  I got the Guac Bacon Burger and added the garlic fries.  Pretty delish, but not worth the price.  I also got the freckled lemonade which was good but a little too sweet.  Do they add a bunch of sugar to it??  Anyway, I'll take In N Out over this joint any day.

By far the worst dining experience I have ever been apart of. Came in to eat before seeing a movie and what a mistake it was. We get sat for about 10 minutes nobody comes to table until another server said she would start us out while our main server is busy. I work as a server so this is normal. I order my food and begin to wait at this point we still haven't seen or even know who our actual server is. The female that talked to us first came back with drinks which was fine. We notice one server keep passing our table at least five times but never saying anything, not even hello. He comes later on about 25-30 minutes into being the restaurant telling us our food is almost up, I asked for a refill of water. Now here comes the fun part, after getting our food still hasn't got me some water. I asked about 5 times before getting a refill on my water. My friends also had to wait forever to get a refill and when our server came to our table he would even let us get a word in before he would leave. It took me for ever to just get a knife to eat with my salad. We were planning to have drinks before our movie but for how long it was it would have taken another 20 minutes. I've worked in a restaurant and it seems like Nobody trained this kid how to serve. I ended up giving my tip to the female that was even our server. Plus our server decide to give all his attention to the table that just sat 45 minutes after us. I would not come back here and little shock I even pay for the food. Only good thing is the salad and chicken was good to eat. I would have rather gone to Denny's

Good Happy Hour Margaritas and Bottomless fries... Although, I wish they would be more generous with their fries servings especially if it's shared by a group, lol. It feels like we have to beg for more all the time we ask for more.

I have not been to this Red Robin in a few years and I will never ever go to this one again.  We walked in, no one waiting to be seated and restaurant table areas less than half full.  We stood at the front hostess desk while employees passed by us for about 10 min's and just when we were about to walk out a male employee came up and said let me get the hostess.  She came out and said wait here while I clean off a booth (we wanted a booth) and she walked away.  the same male employee came over again and said did she help you we said yes she is cleaning off a booth to which he replied I can sit you over here come with me.  after he seated us we realized we had no menu's.  I got up and walked over to the still empty hostess stand and passed by the hostess, I asked her if she had any menu's for us and she said no, I said don't bother I will get them.  As I was looking for menu's another female employee came over and said oh did you finally get seated, I saw you  waiting there.  After we figured out what we wanted the same male came over and said well now let me figure out who is going to help you.  the waiter Rojelio was nice enough but never asked if we wanted more drinks or fries and basically all he did was pass by us with a tray full of food for another table and as he passed by said "everything ok" and that is the extent of his service to us.  Brought the bill never asking if we wanted anything else and that is it.
Bonzai burger is my favorite.  Service sometimes is lacking.

I love this place! I'm always greeted and seated right away and the servers are all really nice and helpful. Wither I'm there for a freckled lemonade (which is amazing!) or a full meal, I always have a great experience at this location!

We were there last night.  The sever, Ashley, was wonderful however the kitchen timing was horrible!  We waited quite some time for our meal and  when it did arrive, only half of our group was served.  The balance of the order came 10 minutes later!

This place has slipped so far it's a joke.  Honestly, any good review is most likely from a manager trying to save their job.  Really not even sure if there is a manager on duty.  To start, I had to go to the bathroom, which was thrashed, to get a wet paper towel to wipe down my own table.  All of the condiments at the table ( ketchup, salt, pepper) were sticky and covered in bbq sauce or something.  After about 20 minutes a gal who was not our sever came out and took our drink and food order.  20 minutes after that we received our drinks.  My beer glass was covered in crumbs and frosting from a milkshake our server had previously made and my wife decided not to drink her water because she was so grossed out.  Every table around us outside was also experiencing the same bad service.  We ate as quickly as possible and left, praying the kitchen wasn't as filthy as the rest of the restaurant.  Side note, our servers pants were completely ripped in the crotch.  Whoever was in charge of this restaurant on Sunday 6/28 at 7:00, please pay closer attention to your staff and customers.  Take responsibility.

Okay, I am not one to rate something 1 star unless I really feel like the establishment DESERVES it. Oh, wait in fact I am pretty sure I have never rated anything a 1 star before. Well, there is a first for everything.......  My family, friends and my Honey all LOVE Red Robin, I have gone here on my birthday plenty of times because I like it so much! I am a fan, asked me 6 months ago and I would have rated Red Robin 4 stars (due to their service somethings being a little slow).  Any who, my boyfriend and I went there one evening (Saratoga location) and sat down, actually got great service and shortly after ordering we were served our food! Everything was going fantastic! I was eating my sourdough Patty-Melt and my bf was eating his choice of burger (can't really remember what it was he ordered) that is besides the point, he goes to bite into his burger but was looking down at it prior to biting into it (good thing it was his burger and not mine, since I don't think I hardly ever look at what I am eating, while I am putting the food in my mouth) and he finds a STAPLE, a 1.5" ELONGATED STAPLE in his burger ( mind you, this is like the 3rd bite in that he finds it!). He pulls the piece of metal out of his burger, we flag down our waitress and she apologizes and grabs the burger away from us like it was a bomb needing to be defused! She comes back over and says, here is our manager (Hispanic guy- Can't remember his name I was in such disbelief my Red Robin dreams have been shattered FOR-EV-ER! (Sand-lot tone there). --- Back on subject, The Manager states he will get a new burger made promptly. My BF states that he is pretty sure he has lost his appetite at this point (as had I) -- The Manager then says, "No problem Sir, we will put it in a to-go box"!?!?!?!??????? WTF!!! Um, yeah, NO! .................... .............At that point my BF no longer played the nice card and stated to him, "Sir I just found a 1.5" STAPLE in my burger and you are asking me to be happy with my burger TO-GO?" At that point I am pretty sure the manager was taking this a little more serious (I honestly think they were trying to speculate we were the plotters of this horrible disaster-- yeah, NO, we are NOT the lady who "found a thumb in her Chili at Wendy's!")  By now, as you can guess, they did comp us our meal, we did leave a $25 tip for the waitress being it was not her fault but we will not only not eat at THIS Red Robin but we refuse to eat at any Red Robin ever again!  ADVICE TO YOU: Check your burger prior to each and EVERY bite!!  Good Luck my fellow Yelpers!

Our favorite place for the whole family to get our Steak fries satisfaction! The custom gourmet burgers are delicious! You should bring your appetite but be prepared to starve since service is quite slow. Tip: ask for the bottomless fries right away.
Awesome food, awesome service. Really like the cocktails here. If you are a single or couple, you can nearly always sneak to the front of the line, even when it is busy.

I like coming here. The wait isn't long, probably 15-20 mins max for me. The service is decent, seemed like a bunch of college kids--hey I once was a waitress during college..its a tough life. THe food always came out fresh, it didnt taste like it was sitting under a hot lamp. The place is clean, no sticky tables so far! I'd come back, especially since they have the new rewards stuff going on for frequent customers =]

We just visited tonight for dinner and yeah, we liked it.  Kids got spaghetti & corn dog from kids menu with fries & soft drink.  They liked them.  My wife got teriyaki chicken sandwich that remind us Japanese burger... she loved it.  I got Whiskey River BBQ Burger and it was good, too.  1st diet coke came a little bit flat, but maybe I was too thirsty...  Anyway, price was ok(calories/$ :), it was around $40, I think.  Since it was Monday night and not much people as weekend, so service was quick and we enjoyed meal well.

Taking my oldest daughter here were fairly good experiences. Over the years and two more kids later I now come to realize that just as Denny's is for senior citizens, Red Robin is just the Denny's for middle aged adults with children. My kids like the burgers, but my kids would like the food anywhere they go just as long as they are out anywhere. Good burgers and generally average food. But, just that, average. I find my family just coming here when we're too lazy to go anywhere else and maybe the fact that my wife is just one visit away from getting a free burger.

RED ROBIN GOURMET BURGERS If you're looking for good burgers, come to Red Robin, located in the Rivermark plaza in San Jose. The burgers are thick and juicy, and come with bottomless fries! I had their $5.99 special, and simply put, it was awesome: a giant Prime Chophouse Burger with bottomless steak fries. The burger was juicy even after I requested it to be well done, so kudos to the master burger griller. Topped with fried onions and mushrooms, this was a damn good burger. Went very well with the thick steak fries. Dip the fries in the poppey seed sauce, and it tastes even better. Next time, I'm going to have to try their $5.99 Southwest Grilled Chicken Salad - it's absolutely huge!!! The atmosphere is very cheerful: pictures hanging over every knook and cranny of wall space - parts 1950's classic diner feel and modern. The staff is very friendly and quite prompt on your drink refills and fries reorders. Come in a large group and enjoy the food! Let's just say that once you have a burger here, the ones you eat at McDonald's or Burger King is only a memory...
I love this location, ive been coming here for the last few years love the beer and i LOVE the fries, the staff is friendly ive never had an issue here.

I have been to this location only once.And that was enough. The server was irritating.Everything that I asked him or anything that I ordered was met with a plethora of  "Huhs?" or "Whats?". I ordered my burger 3 TIMES.I dont think he was paying attention,or was daydreaming while I was ordering.I told my girlfriend that "Watch,its gonna come out f'd up" and I was right.I checked the food right away and my burger had their special sauce on it [I had requested mayo] and it was well done [and I requested medium rare].Well,it had taken a good 30 minutes to get our food,so I wasnt about to send it back.I just took it,wiped the sauce off with a napkin and then somehow ate the dried up burger. Left no tip and have not gone back.The tip that I would have left would be "The one in Newark is wayyyyy better". Reddddd Robinnn YUUUUUUUUUUUUUUCK!

I really want to be able to give this place more than 3-stars, but so far, just can't. It is the closest game in our hood for an above-average-better-than-fast-food burger at gourmet prices sort of place.  Four of us:  Double Banzai Burger + Orange Cream shake for son  Reds Rice Bowl (on a plate) + Speckled Lemonade for son's GF  Bacon Cheeseburger + chocolate malt for daughter  A-1 Peppercorn Burger + Iced Tea for me  One side of onion strings  Plus a special request side of fried jalapeno rings (yum)  $63.11 (ouch), $75 total with tip.  Our server was wonderful and attentive. Very friendly. Service is always hit or miss here. Sometimes you get a good server like we did, other times you get a blah to terrible one.  The kitchen is slow.  Now, I cannot comment on what my kiddies ate, but I can sure comment on my A-1 Peppercorn Burger: "Sizzling, hickory-smoked bacon, melted Pepper-Jack cheese, A-1 Peppercorn sauce, crispy onion straws, onions and tomatoes on an onion bun."   This was not a meld of flavors, but an all out brawl with the bun being the bully. Note: Not so much an onion bun as it was an herb bun, totally overpowered the burger, and was dry and crumbly.  Save for the tomato and onions, everyone fought with each other - and not in a good way. The Pepper-Jack cheese lacked flavor but delivered an unpleasant gooey sliminess to the burger.  I usually like to try a different burger each time, but definitely will not be revisiting the A-1 Peppercorn burger!  In the end, I think we are still St. John's fans. Better burgers, better onion rings, better fries - and better prices on half-off days! $63 for four lunch plates. Ouch.  (Isn't RR supposed to be family friendly?  Yikes.)

The food may be good (especially the unlimited french fries), but some of the servers here are terrible! Tiffany in particular. The first my two friends and I had her as our waitress, the service was alright up until she commented on the fact that she received a smaller tip than she thought she deserved (not in so many words), and told us "we shouldn't do that."  Ummmm, what???  My two friends had her AGAIN last night, and when the bill came, she had already added a $5.00 tip! And here I thought gratuity was only included with parties of 6 or 8 or more. My friend told the manager and Tiffany (the waitress) denied the whole thing.  I've been in food service for over 3 years and I know that you NEVER, ever ask for a tip. You may think you deserved one, but it is totally out of line to ask or even demand a tip, and especially out of line to add on to the bill of a party of two! If you go here and get Tiffany, beware.

It was my birthday Saturday and hubby was taking me to see New Moon at the AMC so I said I wanted to try Red Robin. It's one of those places you see every time you go to the movies...but I'd never tried it.  We walked in and like a previous review...I wasn't quite sure what I was supposed to do. There were families everywhere with kids running around. I see a hostess with a clipboard so I walk towards her. Ask the wait (15, not bad) and tell her two. She says ok..."Don't you want my name?" "Oh, yeah, sorry." Friendly enough but it is really chaotic in the entrance. Ok, so first impression is rough. I"m a little worried because it seems very kid oriented, hubby looks anxious, I'm thinking, "oh crap, hope the food is ok." Anyway, we get seated, luckily in a section with very few kids. Right away we are super excited by the bottomless drinks. A bottomless root beer float? Hubby was all over that. I got the Raspberry Limeade, also bottomless. The waitress asked if we'd been there before and let us know about the bottomless fries (my weakness, uh oh!) so we're pretty stoked. We decide to get the queso and the Blue Ribbon burger to split. The staff split everything for us. The burger was really good and the steak fries were perfect. Our drinks were never below half (bad bad for the waistline but so nice!) The queso was ok. It had very little salsa and we'd hoped there would have been more.   The manager stopped by once to say hello and was genuinely surprised neither of us had ever been to a Red Robin. He was very nice and made sure my drink stayed full. Total bill was $23 and hubby wants to go back for his birthday. My only suggestion is to get the lobby/hostess situation more organized. It is really disorienting that they don't have a hostess stand.

There is nothing horrible about Red Robin, in fact, some people may love it BECAUSE the burgers are big, greasy, and fatty. But I feel like you can get a great burger that's healthy (Sliders, Grill Em, etc.) without all the fat. But if you are looking for that burger/diner experience, you won't be disappointed in Red Robin. The portions are huge, you get never ending fries (those aren't greasy, they are good!), and a ton of other menu choices from salads to steak and other dishes. Big compliments to the bartender who was friendly, attentive and anticipated our needs! Maybe we will come back for happy hour :-)

i like stopping by here after church on sundays.  we've beat out the crowd by getting in around 11:30 or so.  we've always been seated promptly with sometimes great service.  i like the food choice for kids.  our toddler son loves the free balloons.  our service has been hit or miss.  i also didn't like how my RR card didn't work well.  my husband had the same issue.  the server seemed to not have any idea how to work w/ the card.

Really a pleasant experience today. Seated quickly, served promptly, and the food was good and got there fast. Our server Raul was attentive but not in your face and took care of keeping my soda filled as I took down a pretty sweet jalapeno burger. Nothing incredible, but good stuff to be sure. Worth it!

Good burgers, nice selection of beer, and - most importantly - kid friendly. Look, this isn't a fancy, foodie restaurant. But, you don't go here for the gourmet.
