YUou go here for consistent, tasty, not fast-food burgers. It's loud inside, which works for me because I don't have to keep telling my kids to lower their voices. My husband loves that he can keep an eye on the game score. Basically, it's a great spot for your weekly family dinners.

I go to this place a lot and every time i have gone the service has been horrible! Every time i have been here we have had to ask for more napkins. But this night we went and all ordered! I got the whiskey river BBQ chicken wrap (which is my favorite) and fries and m brother and mom ordered fries too! we waited for about 40 minutes and our food was still not here... we asked out waiter where it was and he said he would go check and then 15 minutes later he said its almost done. ITS ALREADY 9:30!!!!!!!  Finally he comes out with are food and the hot food we ordered and fries are ice cold literally!!!! If i am going to pay 40$ for a meal i want it to be hot and delicious! so we called the manager and apparently it was his first day ! so they got us hot fries in less than a minute!!! and he also took 15 bucks off the meal! so overall i come to this place because the food is okay and its a good hangout if you want fries and a milkshake. And i am not just saying this to be rude but i go here alot and the service is always bad.

I always enjoy coming here with my boyfriend. They always accommodate special requests. For example, I don't like their veggie burger.. it's just really bland. So I order some other south-western spicy burger, but with the boca patty instead of the real meat. SO GOOD! I took off one star though because even though they have bottomless fries, they always take a long time bringing over a second helping. Also, their drinks are really foofy. Other than that, love!

I have been to other locations and have had great food and service, however, I've been disappointed every time I go to this location. Today was just terrible. Our server never did bring us out sugar for our iced tea even though we asked 3 times, I just took it from another table. Our food came out cold. One of our dishes came out hot and the rest were just lukewarm. Clearly, they were waiting for the one dish. I had soup and warm soup isn't the best. My son also asked for no mayo which didn't happen. We didn't send anything back since we had already waited so long to be seated and a long time for our food, we just couldn't wait anymore. There burgers are good, but not any better than what is available at other restaurants nearby. First time, we chalked it up to just a bad day. This is our third and last time. If I really want Red Robin, I've had good experiences at the Eastridge location. Our server was nice and kept our drinks filled, but that is about it positive about today's experience.

TLDR version: horrendous service, poorly prepared food I've tried coming here a couple of times, and usually end up going somewhere else due to inexplicably long wait times.  I once tried to come at lunch and the place was half empty with no one waiting, but was told that there would be a 30 minute wait time. But I decided to give them a chance and came here relatively early on a Friday night.  The place was busy, but wasn't totally packed.  As usual, they said it was a 30 minute wait.  One hour later, my friends and I were seated.  I don't think they actually do any estimations; they just say 30 minutes regardless of how busy they are. A friend of mine has the menu here memorized, so as soon as we're seated she orders a bunch of appetizers for us.  It takes 45 minutes before the food shows up, and the waitress disappears for 20 minutes at a time.  Our burgers come out a little over an hour after we place our orders.  Water and drinks were left empty, and they didn't even give us utensils until 10 minutes after they brought our food. If the food was awesome I might overlook the bad service, but other than the awesome onion rings the rest of the food sucked.  The burgers were all burnt.  We had one child with us who ordered the grilled cheese, and the cheese wasn't melted.   A side order of mac and cheese came out cold.   I've been to other Red Robins, and they're not my favorite place but they're a decent place to get burgers.  I'm staying away from this one for good though.

I love burgers. And I love fries. Especially bottom-less fries. Even if they're not that good.  I've only been here once actually and I got the crispy chicken sandwich. Sure was crispy, not much flavor, but I was starving and it hit the spot. I also tried the garlic fries, which were much better than the regular fries. I would come here again simply because their menu is full of that yummy artery clogging goodness that I love. Our server was cool- he saw me oogling my friend's strawberry lemonade, so he brought another glass of it for me to try. Woohoo!

Yum! I had super been craving burgers today. So I bugged the coworkers and most were like ok In 'n Out, but because our PM of lunch Henry L. refused to go to In 'n Out, we ended up here.  I guess the burger that I would compare this most to is Carl's Jr. I ordered the Bacon Guac burger because I just love bacon and guac. Carl's Jr's guac is better because it's more tangy, but here the meat was better because I could order it medium rare. Totally juicy and delicious and the endless fries with the honey mustard sauce was perfection.  It was a nice change for lunch from Chipotles, In 'n Out, and Pizza My Heart.
Food was okay, moderately priced. Only thing is, the waitress complained that we ordered to many orders of ALL-YOU-CAN-EAT fries. Lol serious?

I love this red robin!The servers are super friendly and attentive! The manager always comes around and asks if everything's ok...The food is always amazing,however sometimes the alcoholic drinks are super weak! I rarely get one here because of that but the tap beer is usually cool...But i'm a sucker for that dang freckled lemonade!!!

Gourmet? Um, really? C'mon guys... you're not fooling anyone by slapping a fancy word like that in your name!  Although I wouldn't call the burgers here gourmet by any standard, they're definitely edible. This place served me quite well on several "working lunch" occasions. I've actually only ordered a burger maybe once or twice. I usually end up with the Whiskey BBQ chicken wrap. It hits the spot when I'm looking for saturated fatty goodness.  I've noticed lately that they're being awfully stingy with the "appetizer" basket of fries that they used to bring automatically. The last two times I've been my friends had to ask for them. The seasoning salt they provide on the table is quite good- don't miss out! Another thing worth trying is the strawberry lemonade, although I think I'm more enamored with the glass they serve it in than the actual drink....
Cold food but at least the service was really slow and the server kept the comment card.   Gee. Wonder why?  Really poor.   At least McD's serves warm food.  Inexcusable.

What's said is already said by most people.  I usually go on Sunday evenings and it gets packed around 6-7pm.  After 7, it does die down a bit.   Ordered several items from them, mostly burgers.  One of the good thing about RR that I really like is that they post their nutritional info on a placard for you to see.  That's a pretty good, as some major chains like IHOP still hasn't done that yet. Service is okay, and the ambiance is pretty consistent with most Red Robin.  My friend had some chicken wraps, but it wasn't as delicious as a nice Royal RR Burger.  Appetizers are not necessary as well.  I say just stick with the burgers and a soda and you'll be fine (for about $13 before taxes + tips).

Tower of Onions, Bottomless Fries, Decor Galore Don't forget your 37 pieces of flair here, as this place could fit right into the movie.  The burgers are customizable and pretty good, the tower of onion rings is a fun novelty, the bottomless fries are good, but the decor galore is what makes this place interesting.  They have all kinds of signs, pictures and "stuff" to look at and make you happy.  They have a couple games, they blow up balloons for the kids and the drinks are syrup sweet and sometimes come in strange multi-colored glasses which I have to say doesn't really add to a good margarita, but can make a 10 year old's day.  As an adult I would stick to the beer, burgers and fries here but don't forget your flair!

I would give this place 3.5 stars. Good place for a burger or to take the kids out to eat.  The fries are awesome. In my experience, the server tends to hold back the fries a bit after your second/third request for another basket depending on your table size.

I had the grilled chicken sandwich. It tasted OK, but was such a pain in the hind end to eat that I will never order another. The bun  couldn't absorb (or repel, I guess) the condiments they put on it, so it turned into a pile of mush in no time and fell apart in my hands. I had to finish the sandwich with a fork.

It was interesting to see the TV on the ground when me and my mom walked in here.    We ordered the Raspberry limeade , cup of Clamdigger's  Clam Chowder and a Bacon Cheeseburger.   I've had the bacon cheeseburger before and it's my favorite; but i was tempted to try the guacamole Cheeseburger.   The Raspberry limeade was yummy too  and of course we got the bottomless fries.  The house bread that came with the soup was good too.  Our waitress Annette was great at checking up on us and I got another refill :) yeah. And there are other dining alternatives at this plaza: pizza my heart; Mimi's cafe; panda express and Noah's bagel.

Red Robin yummmmmm. LOL Ok... I have mixed feelings about this place. Usually when we come here they aren't too busy but we always have to wait awhile to get seated. The hostesses very rarely acknowledge us until they are ready to seat us which I find to be quite rude. It seems as though they are a bunch of high school kids that just don't care. Once we get seated it's always hit or miss as far as the server goes. most of the time the servers are pretty bad. I know this may sound really mean but there is this one server who has terrible acne and he has made me lose my appetite on a few occasions by touching his face and then handling the food.  On our last trip to Red Robin we ended up sitting in the bar and our server was phenomenal. So like I said it really is hit or miss with the servers. Let's talk food... we have tried the onion rings, fried zucchini, cheese sticks, and Kettle-Cooked Chips and all of them are yummy. My favorite is the zucchini though. We have also tried the guacamole and it wasn't good at all. For burger time I always order the cheese burger with pepper-jack cheese, onion straws, and avocado. OMG my mouth is watering just thinking about it! Pros- Good food Cons- the service can suck pretty bad

Service is just dreadful! They hide behind the fact that all staff are students but if they are they definitely failing all their classes. Common sense lacks at this red robin. I gave them chance after chance because my kids love the food and its close to where we live. I rather pay and enjoy time with my family instead of eat free and leave mad because of the horrible experience.  Management changes too often at this place, waiters have no training or experience, you will wait all night for your food and when it comes it will be wrong so you will never sit down with your family and everyone begins to eat at the same time.  The last 5 times (months in between) I have came here with my family and left mad.  One time waiter came out with one entree like me and my wife was sharing a burger because we ordered the same thing .  Another time we waited a hour for our food and they brought the appetizers with the entrees. Tonight a ignorant bus boy dropped a glass that completely shattered everywhere right by my table and he left without checking on the safety of my kids and my wife who had on sandals. Then he came back with a broom and did a half-ass job cleaning the glass...and he still did not ask if we were ok or apologize.  I understand the accident but not to feel the concerns of my table safety or other tables around the incident was completely ridiculous.  Never in my life will I set another foot inside this poorly managed, long wait for food, dumbass waiters having ass piece of shit establishment.  Don't waste your time unless you want free food in exchange for a horrible experience !!! !!!!

Red Robin? I guess it's okay for a burger joint. I heard it was considered a fast food place. It's good for a burger place. They have house fries (for free when you get a burger I think). I recommend adding the "garlic parmesan" to your fries for the extra .50 cents or how much ever it is. It's really tasty. Although it is fattening. Their burgers are pretty good as well. I have only had a few. I don't recommend the fish burger (I forgot what it's called).  Their bacon cheeseburgers with bacon was really good if I recall correctly. I highly recommend the wraps!

Bottomless French Fries.....nuff said! I think the burgers here are top notch and when you add the Red Robin salt on the fries you've got the perfect combo. I'm a big fan of their mushroom swiss burger and their Jalapeno burger. The crispy chicken salad is also pretty tasty.  Get it with the honey mustard dressing and you've got one good meal.  Its going to be high in the calorie count, but its worth it in my book

My co-workers and I came here for dinner after work. He said there's always a long line. We came here at 6pm and there was a long line, so he wasn't kidding. We waited for about 30 minutes before we got seated. I usually get the Jamaican Jerk'd burger but I think they took it off the menu cause I couldn't find it anymore. I got the Burnin' love Burger cause I thought it was spicy. Honestly, I couldn't taste any spiciness but the burger was still good. They actually messed up on our order. I had well-done for my burger and my co-worker had medium-well. When they brought out our food, we saw that our meat wasn't cooked the way we wanted so we told the waitress and she apologized and brought us new burgers. The manager came by to apologize and said that dessert was on him. I was like wow! That's great customer service! Acknowledging your mistakes and fixing it! Our burgers came out and it was cooked correctly the second time around. Honey mustard is always good here and must order the strawberry lemonade!! Free-refills! I usually drink about 3 cups worth! I love the strawberries in the drink. We got our free dessert. I forgot the name our dessert but it was a big slice of cake w/ oreo cookies and alot of whip cream. It was really good and big! Other items I recommend are Whiskey Burger, Banzi Burger, and the Chili Cheese Burger. There's probably other ones but I haven't tried them. All Burgers come w/ bottomless fries!

Good for a quick bite, before or after the movie. I always manage to find something that can meet my needs. This could be their typical fare or a surprisingly nice selection of fresh wholesome choices. I usually order a Turkey burger with mushrooms. This is not a low key place, somewhat over stimulating decor, balloons and glossy menu's.  Draft beers, fun margarita's, ice cream drinks, tower of onion rings and unlimited french fries are crowd pleasers.
Gosh why did I come here! The wait is so long and the food is so-so. The bottomless fries is pretty cool but I wouldn't want a refill anyway.

I took my daughter there for lunch today and was completely blown away by the service.  The hostess was extremely friendly, and our server was great as well.  Our food was ready in less than 10 minutes, and considering it was Noon on a Friday, that was impressive.  We have been to this location many times, but today was just awesome.

I was hopeful when this place opened -- I'd liked Red Robin (in another state) in the late 80's.   We went twice I think, and the second time was a disaster, bad food and bad service, I don't even remember the details but remembered that I didn't want to go back...  ever. Tonight we let our 11-year-old pick an un-veto-able dinner for a special occasion.  He normally has pretty good taste, and my biggest worry was on budget rather than quality, but an afternoon trip to Target gave him unusual motivation, and I cringed when he said, "Red Robin!" So we're seated, and no one comes.  And no one comes.  Waitrons are just standing around doing nothing, the place is half empty.  Finally I see some of them pointing in our direction and having a heated discussion.  Finally someone comes to the adjacent table and  I overhear him mumbling something about a mix-up and how he'll take care of them for now.  He takes their order. A good 5 minutes later someone else comes to us and says he's not our server, but can take our drink orders. Finally a waiter shows up, explains that this is his section and he was on his break, and says he wishes the hosts would use their brains.  I dunno, at my company we cover for each other when people aren't available, and we also don't bad-mouth the other employees in front of customers, but what do I know, I don't work in a restaurant.  Whatever, we could have been assertive or bitchy or something and gotten served faster, this in and of itself doesn't take them down to one star. Dude drops our food on the table, and says, "let me get you some silverware" and we also order a drink refill for one of our kids.  He repeats the drink order, comes back and drops one set of silverware on the table and vanishes.  Problem is, three of us need forks for our food.  I've been known to rob other tables or even bus stations, but that's not an option here -- everything's in the kitchen.  Finally I walk over to the kitchen, where all the waitstaff are standing around looking stupid.  I asked for two more sets of silverware, and they get them, and I remind the guy about the drink, and he says, "yeah, I have a shift meeting coming up here, I can't get it right now." So let's talk about the food.  Burgers ordered medium-rare are well done (big surprise); salad greens are Oklahoma quality, not California quality;  salad is covered in institutional cheddar shreds, the kind they'd give us in elementary school that we joked was government surplus.  The menu lacks diversity, and the special flavorings of all the individual burgers are all in mayo, so if you don't want the mayo, you don't get the flavor.  Quality for price is really weak.  Why would anyone ever come here, other than boundless love for their 11-year-old?

i was very unimpressed .. i decided to take my mother out  for  dinner we don't spend too much time together with both of our busy work days  we were both very excited we normally love red robin but had not been there in a while  when i went  decor was completely different  it looks fantastic i said oh they change the decor well apparently there service and food quality went down to maybe im picky because im a server  my self but i didnt not like our service one but nor my food  now i got my normal thing i have gotten every time i went  and it was terrible fries were cold chicken was rubbery  my server looked extremely unhappy this was not  what i was paying for  my mother and i could not get over how horrible our experience was  our server look as if we were bothering  her to order our food or drink no thanks  i might try it again but something would totally have to change

Overall ...OK food.  Place was crowded,  being next to the AMC movies makes parking a mess too. Burgers were OK did not seem as great as I have heard other say. Service was quick once we got seated.  Happy hour drinks stops from 6-7 PM,  guess they know when the movie crowd lets out.  Just remember unlimited fries and sodas including the root beer floats justifies  the over priced items.

Mine and my daughter's favorite place for lunch.  Great burgers and shakes.  I love tall Matt.  Super attentive and friendly, and scored points with my daughter by bringing her a balloon.  Yummmmm.....

first i must add a little personal note and state that i was raised with small portions and organic meat and with a dedicated and talented mother that cooked excellent meals nearly every night. it was my first time coming in today with the family (family of 4 - two kids) and might I just say now my last as well. I came in with a fresh mind and hungry stomach and was excited to try my first American restaurant. As soon as we got seated after 25 minutes it took the waitress 10 minutes to bring drinks and be ready to take our order. we ordered an appetizer specifically so we can munch on before the meal, however the appetizer didn't come until 20 minutes later along with the food! I thought appetizers come immediately(?) or else we wouldn't have ordered it in the first place!! now I ordered my first prime ribs and i was extremely displeased. not only was it expensive but it really doesnt taste like meat. it tastes like a bunch of hormones and false tenderizers. I'm sure right now if I were to apply extensive research and figure out what was in those ribs I would be very displeased; and not to mention how my stomach just didnt take that sandwich at all well. fries were okay, I just felt that everything was extremely greasy as well as one of their classic burgers on the menu (I stole a bite from my brothers burger). now not to mention how LOUSY the service at that place is. no towels on the table? two time request for hot sauce? forgetting water? extra refills on things we never requested? I'm sorry, but I've been to other places which is a little bit better than that. I don't recommend this place for good food. if your coming just to fill yourself up and fatten your figure, by all means I recommend.

Spoiler alert! The fries here aren't endless. After the 2nd batch they stop coming to your table. The burgers are good just as they should be for the price of them. The service is the same as it is most places. Either over the top joyful people who seem like they are over perscribed to prozac or dull mindless waiters. Either way come here if you have some extra money and want a good burger.

I always get the same thing here, turkey burger with added avocado and pickles. Around 8 bucks, it is worth it because their burgers and steak fries are big & tasty. And unlimited fries? Oh boy. I don't have much to comment on, in terms of their decor and such because I mainly pay attention to my hunny or my food, lol. But when you first get there, the host person/s always seem awkward and slow.

Service here is awful and slow. The waitress forgot one of our dishes, and completely messed up the order of the people next to us. She also had a bad attitude, as if she really didn't want to be there.

I usually come to this red robin and sit in the bar area. Tonight I came with some friends and my husband and we sat in the bar area. I'm not sure what the deal was but a guy named John was the server. We waited forever to even get our drink order. People who sat after us got their drinks and food before we even got our drinks. It took 25 minutes to get our food. We asked for fries before our meal came, never did. We asked for lemon wedges, had to get them ourselves because they never came. We finally got our food which was cold, and no utensils for the salads. He tried to redeem himself but the whole meal took almost 2 hours. I will return but I may not sit in the bar area.
I love their  burgers and fries. I normally get their bacon burger and it is always well done as I request. service is fast but I would arrive early (6pm) so you do not have to wait

I am new to gluten-free food. Headed over to Red Robin at the suggestion of a GF friend.   Had been here many times in the past as we have two young children.   Yesterday, our visit was through new eyes.  Explained to the waitress that I needed gluten-free.  She didn't hesitate and grabbed the allergy-menu. Plenty of options to choose from. Picked the cheeseburger with a GF bun with fries.  Waitress explained that the GF fries are cooked in a separate fryer.  Waitress was very accommodating - didn't make me feel awkward for ordering off a special menu at all.  Food was great (even the GF bun!), hot and the service was even better. We will definitely be back.  Not the fanciest place around, nor the quietest or quickest (usually there is a wait for table).  But 5 stars overall.  Thank you, Red Robin!

I was researching places for dining fundraiser so my cohort in crime and I went there  One star missing because of price.  I am giving 4 stars only because the waitstaff was bored so they can't be held responsible.  By the end of our meal we both had three glasses of soda and water ( I never got my beer I asked for )  We both had two trays of fries ( but never got our salads )  We didn't get what we ordered (salads) but a complimentry burger... I never got to meet the manager to find out if they do dining fundraisers.  but I did get Paris a bunch of fries and my cohort got a free glass. The bill did have the salads on it and my beer so I asked for the right check.  It took 30 minutes for the right check . In that 30 minutes we got an extra tray of fries, another drink, and an offer to join a club... For $35. We should have gotten the right order the first time.

I don't think this place is all that is seems to be.  Its a little to expensive. the garlic fry's where soaked by the time we got them. The burger was good but for the price i felt like you can make a better burger at home for less.

Ugh! Why do I keep coming back? WORST service, I'm always flagging people down for napkins, ketchup, refills, checks, spoons for desserts, REALLY! You hand us a sundae, walk away and didn't even think of spoons? I flagged down the manager to ask for spoons. He said "I'll get your server" WAIT NO that's not gonna help me. I've already been waiting that's why I flagged down you. Ice cream melting before my 4 year olds eyes. GEEZ guys!

This place is a total zoo, all the time.  I don't know if it's just because it's near the theaters or what, but it takes forever to get a seat around here and it's really loud and the service is slow!  Also, there are way too many little kids running around all the time.   As for the food, it's typical chain restaurant status, pretty salty, standard family restaurant fare.

Been to this one a few times, and a few different experiences, so just splitting the difference with the 4 stars. Love the fries & campfire sauce, and you have to order them right when you sit down so they (usually) will come out ahead of your meal. We've had a couple instances with less-than-stellar servers (not knowing the menu, not bringing fries till the meal is already out, etc), but fortunately our experiences have been more on the good side. I like that this one has also incorporated the SMS messaging for your table, so you can pretty much go off and do whatever you want, and then just go back when your table's ready. Way better than carrying around a big ol' pager that can only go 10 feet away.

If one were to list every burger joint in the world from greatest to worst, there'd be numerous fights about what place should be on top, and which chain (probably McDonald's) should go on bottom, but I don't think there'd be one person who could argue that this particular Red Robin would go directly in the middle of the list. The service is pretty good, they never seem to mess up the orders. It can take a little time to get the check and then have them ring you out. The waiters are nice, but they're not TOO nice, so you never have to worry about your food being delayed because they can't stop talking to you about the new Twilight book. The best way to describe the food here is this- Think of Denny's. Now add a little higher quality beef with a little less grease, and recipes that actually sound good. That's a Red Robin burger. Also, if you only like a touch of mayo, definitely make sure to ask for Mayo on the side, because they buy lettuce that's been marinated in Miracle Whip for 18 months. Easy to find, the parking isn't bad, the bathrooms are clean. I wouldn't say you should avoid it, but it's probably not worth going out of your way for.

This place is under rated by word of mouth anyways. Their burgers are wayyy better than applebees, mojo burger, taxis, or johnny rockets. They have a unique menu with a great selection of unrivaled burgers and entrees. They also have a great bar staff that really separate this place from your typical burger joint and add quality to the atmosphere and overall experience.  The refillable non alcoholic specialty drinks and fries are a nice touch too that serve as a great feature to broaden their customer base.

Definitely nothing special. We went there on a Wednesday night and the service was pretty slow everything took a long time which is weird because it wasn't even busy. The burgers are OK, You can find the same quality at Carls Jr, if not better burgers there. The fries are nasty I got a few that weren't even cooked all the way. I like that they offer you a bunch of different chicken sandwiches instead of the normal chicken, swiss cheese, bacon sandwiches that most other restaurants have.  Overall it wasn't bad but it just wasn't that good. ...$20 on two burgers when I can go to Carls Jr for $13 for two burgers that are just as good if not better..this place just doesn't seem worth it.

Been going here for a long time and a Red Robin member.  Recently the place was remodeled and it was a nice change.  But another thing changed around the same time and quite frankly it has me annoyed.  I'll explain.  My wife and I share a sandwich there because we're older and watching our calories.  In the past we've asked that the sandwich be split and it's never been a problem.  But following the remodel things changed.  We've been told under the "new system" they don't do this.  Really?  I don't believe this is good customer service, especially for people who are regulars.  Hence the 2 star rating.  Hopefully somebody in RR upper management will read this review and do the smart thing.  Otherwise there are plenty of other places that will gladly do what I request when I dine there.

I loved this place ! Great people great service great food great everything I love how the guy who helped us saw we had our baby and offered us anything for her usually in other places people just ignore her but here none of them did and I lied that also it was fast I recommend this place ! It was our first time here but forsure not our last

Very friendly and industrious staff. I stopped in at around 8:30 on a weekday, not expecting it to be crowded. I would be surprised. Absolutely packed, I was contemplating trying somewhere else, when one of the hostesses offered to get me a spot at the bar. Service was so quick, it didn't seem as if the restaurant was full at all. And that's just the service! Bottomless root beer floats and fries were excellent, as were the chicken tenders. Definitely will come here a bit more often.

Great place for kids. This chain has been in Cali for years. My guilty please was the peppercorn burger but I don't think it's on the menu now. I have many fond memories of coming here on a date and ordering the mountain high mud pie.

Ran the San Jose 1/2 Marathon again this year with my cousin.  We both ran great times and were exhausted, but not that tired to grub.  So his family and I went to Red Robin. I could've eaten anything, but I got the Royal Red Robin.  Yes, the one with the fried egg.  That one.  Absolutely delicious!!!!  Even got garlic fries.  YUM-O!  Pair that with a Freckled Lemonade and I was a happy camper for the rest of the afternoon. Our server James was pleasant and attentive.  Got us refills on drinks and fries very quickly.  Good job James!

If I hear "happy happy birthday" one more time, I'm gonna puke up my shitty burger. I feel like last time I had Red Robin the experience was way better. This time the burger Wendy and I shared was just pathetic. Everything from the bun, to the meat, to the bacon, it was just bad. I should have known something was off when they didn't ask me how I wanted my burger cooked. I was expecting a good sit down burger but instead got a bad fast food burger. The only saving grace were the onion rings, but then again, O-rings for $8? Makes me sick.

I signed up for their B-Day club and I got a free Burger and Ice Cream Sundae! My buddy and I always come here before or after a movie. Their burgers always hit the spot and their wraps are excellent too. Hey, unlimited steak fries too!!! Love this place!

service was soooooo slow and there were hardly any ppl when we were there. while a table of 4 was being pampered constantly for a mix up with their order, we were forgotten...:) the food was actually fine but it took forever for the servers to come to our table,even when it was just about taking care of the bill.

I'm not a fan at all. This place is so busy, mostly with teens which isn't a problem except that they don't know the food isn't all the lines make it out to be.  I guess this is what you get for a giant chain. I've had a few burgers here and haven't liked any of them. Over cooked food. Grilled should taste grilled, not burnt. I had a to-go order they messed up on and they waiting area for the pick ups is not convenient for other bar patrons. It's like right on top of them. Awkward!

If I hear "happy happy birthday" one more time, I'm gonna puke up my shitty burger. I feel like last time I had Red Robin the experience was way better. This time the burger Wendy and I shared was just pathetic. Everything from the bun, to the meat, to the bacon, it was just bad. I should have known something was off when they didn't ask me how I wanted my burger cooked. I was expecting a good sit down burger but instead got a bad fast food burger. The only saving grace were the onion rings, but then again, O-rings for $8? Makes me sick.

Wow I'm surprised at all the bad reviews for this place, I've been here twice at least in the last couple of months on a Saturday during lunch and never had a problem. Hostesses are always very friendly and we were seated right away. Also, the servers have always been nice and helpful. But I'll talk about this most recent experience: Food:  - Meh, my "medium" bacon and guacamole burger was pretty well done for it being ordered medium which made it dry. But tasty ...I love guacamole in my burgers.  - Chicken wings were yummy though I wish they'd give more hot sauce. He messed up by giving blue cheese when I specifically requested ranch but no worries he gladly took that away and replaced it for me. - Chips and guacamole and salsa. First he brought out a large salsa and chips, I was like wait where's the guac...is it under the salsa or something? Anyways he apologized, said he brought out the wrong one and brought us out the right one eventually. Which was fine no worries but then when it ended up on the tab i was like hey um....but one it was pointed out he removed it. Drinks- I had the freckled bottomless lemonade. Tasty and refreshing. I loved the fresh strawberry pieces in it. Also he was pretty quick on the refills so that was nice. Overall despite a couple of mishaps in the service and that he forgot to give me back my credit card and the bill after he swiped the card, we had a great time. He was very nice and helpful, food was pretty good overall and ambiance was very chill and relaxed.

Two simple rules to follow when dining at Red Robin: 1.  Don't come with high expectations for the food and service.  Would you expect any more out of a burger chain with high school aged servers? 2.  Order the burgers.  Duh that's their specialty.  Don't even bother with anything else on their menu.   Follow these rules and.... [sings] Red Robin... Yummmmmm

I had never been to a red robin before, but this is one of those Johnny Rockets type All-American place with its own unique style, decoration and food.  The place, for instance, is well decorated with a number of portraits and frames, many of which relate to NY/East Coast. I went on a Sunday for a late afternoon lunch, and the number of kids at this location was incredible.  There were more balloons than hamburgers in the place, and the noise level was pretty high.  There were maybe about 4-5-6 t.v.s playing baseball, a small bar to the left by the entrance, and everyone scattered throughout the restaurant with their screaming kids. The food was great, although you have to be prepared to pay at least 7 or 8 just for the burger, but they do come with fries, which are bottomless.  The fries really taste like potatoe, and they're big and fluffy.   I got the California Chicken Burger and it was excellent.  It was heavy, filling and tasty.   The fries were heavy. I ordered water. The waiter was very attentive, almost to a point where it became weird because he'd come to our table just to chat it up. The place and the bathroom was clean. The total came to 35 dollars for three.

Great place to hang out/ catch up with friends. It's nice because it's right across the parking lot from AMC 14, so if you have the time, I'd highly recommend you to head on over here. I go to Red Robin's for the bottomless steak fries and the drinks. man, are those smoothies good. It does take a while for some of the food to arrive sometimes, so bring someone to make conversation with in order to pass the time.  Oh, and the decor is pretty chill.

Worst. Service. Ever. I've eaten at this Red Robin five times. On one occasion, the host apparently sat me in no-man's land (a table that's not currently covered by anyone on duty). A waitress did eventually notice my situation and picked up the table. She was quite friendly and contrite, but she wasn't particularly good at handling me in the out-of-section booth. Another time, the host sat us in a proper section. Unfortunately, the host staff had also assigned multiple large groups to the same waitress. She was rushing around trying to cope with two ten-tops at the same time, and three overall! Furthermore, the neighboring servers completely ignored the problem. I'm very mild-mannered about service mistakes (having been a bad waiter myself), but eventually I had no choice but to complain. After that, we had the server and a manager both waiting on us, and the service was still terrible. Just as an example, the two of them together couldn't get our drink orders right. I asked for one of the drink specials, a milkshake with alcohol, and my guest ordered Dr Pepper. My meal arrived before my shake, and the waitress kept getting the Dr Pepper order wrong. She would ask, "What did you have again? Sprite?" She even got confused about whether Red Robin was a Coke or Pepsi house and would offer the wrong one. Nevermind that we didn't even want cola, she brought us Diet Coke. On my fifth and final visit, the same waitress served us again. She was less busy and less incompetent, and we acted as though her mistakes were entertainment rather than inconvenience. The meal was OK, if a bit chaotic. Unfortunately, I got quite sick that night. I have no way of knowing whether the food made me sick, or whether it was an unrelated illness, but I don't want to press my luck. That's three terrible experiences out of five visits, and almost every part of the restaurant contributed to the problems: the host staff, wait staff, bar, management, and possibly kitchen. This earned this Red Robin the dubious honor of being the first restaurant I've ever permanently banned from my dining list. I actually enjoyed the food, but the rest of the experience is just too miserable to bear.

This is one of my favorite places to go on a Saturday afternoon after I've had a serious workout and feel like treating myself to some high-cal food.  I've not had a poor experience at this Red Robin so it surprises me so many people wrote about bad service.   Large selection of delicious burgers and bottom-less steak fries - what else could you want?  My favorites are the mushroom-swiss and the fish burger.  Garlic parmesan fries are very tasty and if I'm with a group, we'll usually indulge and order the onion ring tower because it's so dang hard to resist. Full bar and of course, very kid-friendly.  There can be a wait on weekends but it's usually not bad.   They don't take reservations so plan ahead if you're going with a group.  Oh, they also have a birthday club that you can join online and you'll get a free burger coupon for your birthday - works for me!

it's hard to rate a chain restaurant cuz each one is its own situation. i am generally pleased when i go to a red robin and usually never have cause for complaint - meaning the service is okay and the food good - nothing outstanding. so this review starts with a complaint - i ordered the artic cod sandwich and when the waitress brought it - it smelled like 2-day old ling cod!! took a tentative nibble and promptly spat it out (i was past being embarrassed - it was that bad) flagged a waitress and told her the sandwich was not fit for human consumption...then the customer service we foodies dream about happened. the manager came to the table and said he was gonna make it right. And he did! that sandwich looked and tasted like it was made with the highest care - fresh out of a fryer with fresh oil in it. pretty dang tasty... so i'm not giving a 1-star cuz they messed up and almost food-poisoned me...i'm giving them 3 for doing the right thing and without an attitude. of course, i would have given them 5 stars if they had made that 2nd sandwich on the house... but red robin retained a customer - the bottom line is that i'll be back when the urge for a burger hits me...

My husband and I went recently with another couple.  It was early on a Saturday night, like around 6:00.  We ordered the tower of onions rings for our appetizer.  When they were brought to our table, we were told they had run out of dishes!!!  We were asked to eat off of napkins!  How does this happen in a restaurant that busy?  Won't be going back there soon.  With so many people out of work, perhaps they should be looking for a new manager.  Unbelievable.

We go here often, a lil too often! When I take friends they always tease me that we know all the staff. Its so close, easy, cheap and super family friendly. My kids love the mac and cheese and you get free refills. You cant beat that! Come on! Thanks to all the staff for always making us feel welcome and saving me from making dinner!

If you're craving a burger and all you can eat steak fries, look no further.  Red Robin has that lovely burger joint feel without the greasy air feel that fast food restaurant chains can give off.  I love how you can get their onion strings added to your burger for free and the service is almost always excellent.  They're nice and will help you as fast as they can whenever you have a request, especially when you ask to get started off with fries before the burgers/entrees come.  The burgers usually come out cooked the way you want your meat cooked, the presentation is well done, and the follow up after food has been served is timely and not irritating as some servers can become when they almost seem like they're pestering you.  Overall, I definitely wouldn't have a problem coming back here at all.

Gourmet...*cough cough* Ok. Well, the waitress we had was VERY attentive and friendly.  Especially since two of us arrived, ordered, ate and then two more came in later to do the same. If you want a stiff drink, this is not the place.  The limeade thing I had was tasty just not buzzy. Food was ok.  That's all I got to say about that.  Edible, just not great.

We ate here yesterday for lunch. Apparently they were understaffed, seeing that our service was utterly terrible. First off, our server barely spoke English. I am not racist in any way, I just believe that for that position speaking English is kind of important. He totally forgot my salad, was nowhere to be found for most of the meal, and made uncomfortable comments to us over the course of the meal. In general the food at Red Robin tends to make me sick to my stomach but this time was worse. I won't be returning to this location because the service was that bad, and it may have turned me off to Red Robin for good.

Came here with a friend to celebrate her home purchase.  We sat at the bar area and each ordered one of the Nuclear Ice Teas, which did not have much of a kick.  I was expecting something similar to the old Long Island Ice Teas served at TGI Fridays, but these were very tame in comparison.  We wanted to have some appetizers, but after glancing the menu decided on a couple of burgers.  I had the Red Robin Cheeseburger while my friend had the Turkey Burger and substituted onion rings for fries at an added cost.  Our burgers arrived within about 10 minutes of placing our order.  My burger was okay and my friend said her burger was pretty good.  I had some of her onion rings and thought they were very good.  I probably would hav given 3 Stars if the drinks were better.
Fun place for kids and price is good.  I love the Santa Fe burger!  Easy location to get to and parking is plenty on mots nights.  Not easy parking on weekends due to the AMC traffic.

Had a great experience at this particular RR.... took a friend for lunch~~ her first time ever eating at any RR!  We were seated very promptly and our server (Heidi) was friendly and helpful! She answered any questions we had and explained all the "substitutions" we could make. The BLTA was wonderful and my friend got her burger cooked exactly to HER specifications.  The Freckled Lemonade is absolutely wonderful and something I would not do without at any Red Robin! Will definitely be back!

Sub-par food and service, even for a Red Robin. This chain is just a disappointment. I have been to several locations and always the result is the same: crap service and overpriced chow.  Lunch today for a three-person party: Onion rings to start, 2 salads and a veggie burger along with 3 sodas. $50 dollars. Seriously. For lunch. NOT WORTH IT.  The waiter mumbled, the veggie burger was still frozen in the middle and apparently silverware and soda refills are unheard of.
Looking for a typical chain kind of take out or eat in? I definitely recommend Red Robin A good choice for a family with kids n toddlers  and an appetite for some juicy burgers.

My 4 other girlfriends and I decided to go to Red Robin on a Thursday night; I was really excited about the food but once I saw the crowd of people outside, I was intimidated. So we walked in and saw a host/hostess stand but no one in sight. We didn't really know what to do then all of a sudden, a woman and her 3 children walk around us. She had definitely cut in front of us to get to the hostess that had shown up right as the woman had cut us off. The hostess had seen the woman cut in front of us but did nothing about it; she motioned for us to come forward and I tried to ask her how long the wait was going to take. She couldn't hear me with the phone ringing, the music blaring, and the loud chatter in the tiny lobby. She got frustrated and wrote the amount of people in my party and what I was wearing (as well as racially profiling me).. she then said, "WE'LL CALL YOU WHEN WE HAVE A TABLE OPEN!"  I'm thinking.. what the eff? She didn't even get my name..  So my girlfriends and I stepped outside to wait for our table-- a moment later, we realize the outside tables are open and the weather was nice so why not? I went back inside and flagged down the other host that had seemed to be coming back from a break. I had asked if we could possibly sit outdoors and he said no, right off the bat. I asked why and he said he didn't know and that the waiters told him not to seat anyone outside. I asked to speak to a manager and he panicked for a moment and ran to a waiter. The waiter approached me and said he'd take care of us if we wanted to sit outside, so I agreed to go outside (I decided not to complain to the manager just yet because my stomach was growling hard!).  We sat down out in the patio and ordered -- I got the Royal Red Robin burger which was absolutely delicious but I hope there was no spit. The waiter was nice but he ended up forgetting about us for half an hour straight while we waited for our check. I walk in with one of my girlfriends looking for him and we see him sitting at a booth in the back.. eating. He saw that we had been looking for him so he looked alarmed, he jumped up and rushed to us. He quickly apologized and got us our check. We paid, but then we had to wait even longer because we had asked for a to-go back. I had suggested not to ask (to my friends) because I knew it would take forever and I was right; it took another 20 minutes and we were late for our movie at AMC14.  Overall, the food was awesome but the service was bad. Booooo.

Great Place To Take A Family Or Friends To. Friendly Staff, The Hamburgers Are Just Ok? But The Whiskey River Chicken Wrap Is Somethin Else. Be In Mind That The Food Here Is A Little Over Priced!  Enjoy Without Going Bankrupt! Nick P.

I swear, I do know fine cuisine....but seriously, I would rather eat here than The French Laundry.......I am so in love with the Bleu Burger here and their fries........I hate myself afterwards for consuming so many calories, but its worth the following week of 800 calorie days!!! The service is always good, food always arrives hot and the waitstaff is always attentive.  My only complaint is that there are always screaming babies,hyper kids running around like its a playground.....they should have a "family section" and a section for adults.

If you are going here anytime soon, you must get the sliders! They are three little mini STEAK (not ground beef) sandwiches with onion strings, cheese, chipotle mayo and of course the bottomless fries. Seriously, what more could you want? A perfect pairing! I think this is just a promotion so try it before they're gone. Hubby got the pesto chicken which was also pretty good.  This place is obviously a chain and sometimes a little cheesy in decor but it hits the spot when you want good burgers and fries.

I compare every Johnny Rocket-ish joint with ..you guessed it..Johnny Rockets!  Red Robin has everything - great food, that perfect ambiance and a sleek bar-but customer service.    I went to this place two times and both the times i left huffin n puffin.   The first time - my french onion soup was dead cold - yes...it was! It took forever for the server to heat it up.  She brought it back AFTER i was done with my burger. The second time - my food was served promptly but the server forgot my friend's who waited atleast 20 minutes after I finished mine. Despite all of that, if you are willing to discount forgetful servers, Red Robin is worth a try over Johnny Rockets because of variety in the menu, better tasting burgers and ofcourse, the best strawberry lemonade on the planet.

Okay...unlimited steak fries.....need I say more.  There are plenty of burger options, but none of the burgers are flat out fantastic. The salads are okay and so are the pastas. My old co-worker, Sam works at this one, she's so cute!! Anyhow, it's a great place for the price!

This restaurant always seems to slide back into my life even though I really don't like it.  I mean, don't get me wrong, I do love a big fat juicy burger but somehow I am not that crazy about their burgers.  My family, in-laws in particular absolutely love this place, so on b-days, we always end up here... probably because since we all have kids - the noise the children make are acceptable.   Most people find the bottomless fries awesome but to me, every additional basket is like adding inches to my ass.  I do love me some fries but in moderation people, not bottomless... because let me tell you bottomless is not something I'm going to be after I eat them. Had the shakes a few times, not very exciting... can't say I will order them again. The drinks are always very weak with loads of juice or tonic - not worth the price. Like I said, I know I will be back here again because one of my family members will say, "Yeah, let's go to Red Robin, that is such a great idea!"  Ummmm, 'NNNNNOOOOOOO'   I will have to scream, maybe this time they will change their mind and will end up somewhere else.
Came here Monday with coworkers and one of my bosses. The server that started with us, Tyler, super friendly and made great recommendations. Server that took over.... she was ok. Food was yummy!

For some reason, I enjoy these specialty burgers better than Johnny Rockets, Peggy Sues, and others.  The food is heavy, tasty and filling. The latest time the service was wonderful and on point. Had extra napkins when the food arrived and responsive to empty drinks. Provided fries to start with. The one before was a dude who needs to be fired pronto. We requested a batch of fries to start with and that never came. Used the excuse "cooks are backed up". Food didn't sit well in the stomach. Been to this location about 5 times.  Note: Avoid the Chicken Chimidilla. A salty deep fried burrito thing.

Quite loud.   Difficult parking.  Not a place I would choose on my own. Decent food - my sixty-something inlaws were very happy with their burger variations.  Fish and chips is good here - thick "steak fries" and they use arctic cod, one of the least-endangered varieties so you don't have to feel guilty.  Salads dull but fresh.  However, the kids' menu cheese pizza was pretty terrible, apparently. The big surprise was the great service - usually indifferent at these chain places.  Our server, hostess, everybody worked very hard to make a nice experience.

This place is consistently good and have good prices. The burgers seem   awesome on the menu but when you order them they're good but not awesome. Because the food is still good but not out of this world like Sliders or Vivi's they get 4 stars.
Was here opening day... got in before the dinner crowd picked up, no wait.  Royal Red Robin Burger and bottomless Steak Fries and bottomless soda!!!

Burger joint. There was a Red Robin in Boulder when I was growing up. I had no idea that I would be eating here so many years later. I go here for the burgers and the tower of onion rings. They once served an A-1 burger that was the bomb...then they took it off the menu...and then it returned, albeit it was more like A-2. The service is good. The wait staff is broken up into a complicated heirarcy of sorts. It's not uncommon to order from one waitress only to have someone entirely different fill your drinks and bring your food.  Red Robin is another chain restaurant. I wouldn't go out of your way to track this place down; however, if you are seeing a movie at the nearby theaters, it might be a good option. Or, if you are looking to tie one on before shopping at Petsmart give it a go.

Red Robin has all the food that makes me want to go there, and just as much of it that makes me wish I never went. The first couple of bites are enticingly tasty, and the rest usually seems greasy and over done. If you're looking for culinary sophistication, this ain't it. But if you just want a well-cooked hamburger to sit in your gut for the rest of the night, this is a good option. If you have kids, it's even better -- it's too noisy for them to really bother anybody. WTF is with the TV in the floor of the lobby? There's a TV. In the floor. It's kinda cool, good thinking if you're stuck with a long wait.
LOVE this place! The fries are the BEST! Also really love the cripsy chicken salad..YUMMy!

I had actually stayed away from Red Robin for years because of their reputation for being discriminatory against gays.  But all that aside, I actually like Red Robin.  The bottomless fries are great, especially with the Red Robin seasoning.  The burgers are good, but don't stray too far from that.   I deviated from the menu once and had the teriyaki bowl.  Oooh..bad call, but hey, this is a boigah joint; have a boigah.    And you'd  better like kids 'cause there's a bunch of them around screaming.  The staff is young but surprisingly attentive and friendly ( on a non-culinary note: whats up with the female wait / seating staff  and those low low low rise jeans they all wear?  All their asses look scrunched up and very unflattering.)  Anyway, Red Robin is a good place to have a burger and shake after or before a movie.

Ehh... We thought we would take the kids to a nice lunch after a movie at AMC 14. The service was alright but the food we ordered was really bad!  I ordered some sort of salad with pieces of disgusting chicken on top. My husband ordered a sandwich and said it okay. But the worst was my child's mac and cheese; it was like soup! She refused to eat it after 4 bites.  Red Robin's...Yuck!

Good burgers. And a great place to have a beer. But the last two times I've been there I have wanted to sit outside and each time they have said no. The tables are all set and it's a nice summer day but you can't sit outside because the server is too lazy to go outside to serve us. Avoid the lazy staff and go to a different location. ....
Damn you, Red Robin. Damn you for your delicious un-ending basket of fries. Mmm...

I've been here once. The burgers here are pretty decent; it's good.  I tried the Royal Red Robin burger (it has eggs, smoked bacon, lettuce, tomato, and onions). I also love their bottomless fries. Their garlic fries are good. Nutrition wise their burger selections are about 1,000 calories alone. The service here is okay.

I sent an email to Red Robin and they forwarded my concern to the El Paseo location whose manager contacted me.  I explained what happened, with the intent to educate not extort but she really wanted to make it right so I requested a free appetizer to replace the one we ordered but never received.  I just received a FedEx package with a $20 gift card, what a pleasant surprise.  Thanks Maha!

I've liked this place ever since I was younger and to this day I still do. The Bruschetta Chicken Burger or the Crispy Chicken Salad with Honey Mustard dressing is the best items on the menu! Both are very delicious. Kind of bummed out that they took off the old school Honey Mustard Burger...I remember eating that back in the day. Oh well, but hey still 4 stars for the place!

So this is a fave spot for me, and Im probably not the one one ^^ I only gave it 4 stars though because the service isnt always consistent. When they are busy, food sometimes is cold and refills must be asked for.  I get the turkey burger with grilled onions wrapped in lettuce no mayo. OK and I have a reason for this, why go to a burger place and skimp you ask? Being heath concious, I choose to save those extra calories for the endless steak fries that I cant resist, not to metion I dip them in ranch too. I have tried most of the burgers on the menu though. All are delicious. My last visit I had a watermelon margartia, MMMM that was a first. It wasnt super sweet like I was expecting, it was perfect. Almost like a jolly rancher. Also a side note; you dont have to order appetizers, you can ask for a basket of the fries to start with at no charge. Im a single Mommy so I love these kinds of perks at restaurants ^^ Not to mention, keep the kids quiet while waiting for our food to arrive.

We ordered burger here and the wait was about 20 mins.  The staff were very friendly but when we ordered our meal to be split with my hubby, surprisingly the waitress even have the food splitted for us already.  It was awesome!  I will definitely go back there again!

We should have known better,,, than to give Red Robins a SECOND chance!   1st time: family & I just had a great time at the AMC-14. We went to diner at RR after- this was my first time going. My hubby had been at the RR near Eastridge and said the endless fry basket was great. So, we get in there, not crowded at all, and we are sat right next to the restroom???  There were at least 12 other open tables near the front.- once our order arrived we were not given any napkins, our waiter disappeared, hubby had to ask another waiter to bring us napkins and was told, 'I'm not your waiter!' once we saw our waiter I yelled for him, he came up fast, I asked for napkins and for a refill of the drinks and ENDLESS FRY deal, he acted as if he was really tring to make up for his neglect, he then disappeared again?  After finishing our burgers the waiter shows up with just the napkins NO FRYS, hubby asked for the frys and the waiter replied, 'oh yea! Do you still want them?' hubby replied, 'why bother, we already ate our burgers!' and the waiter just blew it off because he did not care. Ok, fast forward ::2nd time:: family birthday request to go to RR- not mine,,, The wait time was average this day, after being sat at our table, the noise of the patrons seemed to increase full speed ahead adults shouting across their tables and screaming children and cring babies?!? We were wondering what was up, it was the music!!!  It was so loud it was driving everyone crazy without realizing it! But, then again, our waiter still sucked- he only gave one guest from our party a refill, we asked for extra mustard- he never brought it, and the check took forever. So, no I will not be returning to RR - Red Robins KP

I went to this place and ordered something that I'd never tried before:  the Lettuce-Wrapped Protein Burger (I substituted the beef patty with a vegetarian Boca patty). It was very delicious, although I was slightly turned off by the low-quality salad that was served on the side. The salad looked and tasted as if it had come straight from a Ready Pac plastic bag filled with bland iceberg lettuce and carrot strips. I also wasn't a huge fan of the fact that I could've made the same thing at home without paying $9 dollars for it. Now, I do make lettuce-wrapped burgers at home. Minus the crappy side salad. :)

I've been here twice and both times the service was SUPER fast. I think they know people stop by here before making it over to the theaters for a movie so they get you in and out quickly. I've only had the Royal burger (a burger with a fried egg) which the waitress recommended to me. Its soo good but I don't think I could eat here more than once a year with out ending up in the hospital.

Meh.  The food is edible.  There is a lot of it.  It's sloshing in grease, and there isn't anything on the menu that would fit any healthy eating criteria.  It's also crazy crowded because of the movie theater.  It has no vegetables on the menu.  All in all, I would rather go elsewhere.  But we like to meet our friends here before a movie, just like everyone else.
Great family restaurant & yummy  burgers!! Happy children = enjoyable meal for parents! Chocolate shake is awesome!
Red Robin is awesome!!. I love their strawberry lemonade and their burgers and fries!, I always get the monster burger whenever I go. Red Robin is the place to go for burgers!!

Ok I have to update to five for the WONDERFUL service we recieved last night. The place was uber packed but our server Andrew was attentive and accomodating. I went with my boyfriend and my bestie's boyfriend and we ordered, when the bestie called saying she was coming too. We asked Andrew if he could put a hold on our food till our friend ordered so it would all arrive at once and our food would be hot and fresh. He said of course and quickly went off to do so. When the bestie called back and said her mom was coming too, we needed a new table since we were in a small booth. He quickly ran off to ask the hostest if we could move to the bigger table in the back. And to top it all off he offered to bring us some hot fries to munch on while we waited for our friends. Not only did he bring the fries, but a cup of ranch dip AND a cup of the campfire sauce. I've never seen a server bring ranch without having to ask for it, but too bring two sauces?! Awesome! We left him a big tip for being so fast and friendly even with the crowded night. Oh and the clam chowder is still great! =D
This chain was founded in Seattle, has it's headquarters in Denver, yet still provides unlimited fries.  Imagine that.

It was explained to me by someone more in the know that this location is either quite on or very off in its service and execution in the kitchen. Last night, however, was very on, thankfully. My bf had a royal burger; I had the grilled salmon burger. We also had a spinach dip appetizer. The spinach dip, very good. No complaints on the royal burger. The only minor complaint about my salmon burger was the balance of the other flavors to onion/mustard. Adjust that, and the salmon seemed to be just fine, actually not overcooked, a miracle for many restaurants.  And I did have oversupply of the "freckled" lemonade, Red Robin's strawberry lemonade available with endless refills--seems there was a slight snafu between two servers so I got one refill right on top of another. So how's that for service?

We were a party of four, last Friday night. The place was busy (as expected) and the hostess suggested 25-30 minutes before we'd be seated. So we sat down at the bar and ordered a round, as we sometimes do. Then we ordered some appetizers from the bar. Then we had another drink at the bar. Sometimes you just feel like you've been forgotten, and sometimes you REALLY wonder if you've been forgotten. We asked the bartender to check for us, and the hostess responded (after a suspicious delay) saying we were like 4th in line or something. That seemed strange, because the place was not that busy. After about 1 hour at the bar, we were seated. The waitress was friendly and waitress-y, but mysteriously lost one of our orders. Worse, instead of informing us politely she just kept on with the "yours will be out in just a minute" line. So we were disappointed with the service and had Yelp on the brain. We discussed divvying up our dinners so that we could all just eat already. I presume the waitress overheard us talking because shortly after that someone who looked like a manager came out and said there was a "human error" and offered to "make it right." She was nice (maybe more serious/mediocre than nice), professional, and had the remainder of our food out quickly and gave us some extra fries (she was probably trying to liquor us up - RR's fries are intoxicating) and a drink refill. We were on our way to satisfaction but still hemming and hawing (as one does when approaching 90 hungry minutes in a chain restaurant.) Not that we expected much more (really, what do you expect when you eat at RR on a Friday night?) Here's why RR gets three stars and not zero: Unexpectedly (and without solicitation), the manager came back out and covered our entire dinner bill for the night. Admittedly we had spent a significant amount at the bar, but I would consider this "above and beyond" to make things right. The food and drinks were all good and we ended up going home satisfied -- almost feeling a little guilty, but not.

Good place for burgers.  Food is OK but a little pricey.  The  Royal Red Robin Burger is pretty unique.  It has an egg in it and is very good.    Service is good and they always refill your fries.  We don't go out for burgers often but when we do we come here.

Palabra. Where to eat before watching Star Trek?  Hmmm - we know we wanted to hit up Nordstrom Rack for some Mother's Day deals, and there is a theatre there, what to eat, what to eat... RED ROBIN! The wife loves their freckled lemonaide, it comes loaded with strawberries, their fries & seasoning always hit the spot too. here's what we had: Appetizer Nacho's w/ grilled chicken: 3 of 5 - This is an easy dish to replicate and I often do so at home when we are entertaining.  Each chip gets topped off with cheese, beans & a jalapeno slice with sour cream, guac & salsa on the side to top off.  The chicken was cut into big chunks which was cool but was a little too filling and they put waaaaaaaaay too much cheese, not ideal if you are trying to keep the calories to a minimum. Cluck n Fries: 4 of 5 - the wife always orders this, the chicken strips were bomb! nice and crispy and well seasoned.  Their bbq & ranch dipping sauces have a very good flavor.  The fries were nice and big just not as fried as we like. Blackend Bayou Burger - 3 of 5 - it came on a jalapeno kaiser bun, have no idea what that means.  They were able to leave the burger pink which made it nice and juicy, also had pepper-jack cheese, angry onions and instead of lettuce cole-slaw. Pretty good overall but i didnt walk awy thinking i had one of the most awesome burgers either, i am struggling to remember what else it had in it, so thats why its a 3. Service: 5 of 5 - Our waiter was very attentive without being in the way, very clean worker, smooth, brought out our refills about 2 or 3 sips earlier than most do, in fresh glasses.  Sure it was dead and he only had like 3 or 4 tables but he was on point.

I loved the burgers here. I wish I could give it 5 stars, but this place is a zoo. Families with small children, who run wild. Dirty booths. Our waiter thought the four 15 year old girls in the next booth were endlessly fascinating so we barely got any service.  Given that he was in his 20s it was even more gross.  Parking is horrendous in this plaza (at least anywhere near the movie theater).  I am going to try a different location, because even though I don't eat burgers very often when I do, I want a great burger - and this place gets the job done.

We had a great waitress! She was super sweet and entertaining, I feel bad for forgetting her name! I appreciated that she was patient with us because 2 of our guest were running late, but she kept the drinks coming and the fries!

I have to be one of the biggest Red Robin fans out there, but this Red Robin SUCKS! Seriously. It's not just once or twice, it's EVERY time. The burgers are beyond dry & the service is beyond slow. I understand that they are super busy & right near a movie theater so every rocker in the area comes here, but seriously. My last visit was the final straw. I'm so not going back. I live right down the street from this one, but I'd way rather pick it up from a different one. Slow, bad service, dry, bad food & their take out is always a 45 minute at least wait. They'll tell you it's only 15 minutes, but it never is. Seriously, it's depressing, but this one is definitely not worth your time.

There are always a crowd of people outside this place and I can't understand why. They have the nerve to say "gourmet" burgers. The only thing that will be red like a robin is your be-hiney after eating one of their greasy sliders they call burgers. And the decor...jeeesh....I thought I timed warped to Skiddy, Kansas with the merry-go-round horse crap. They give you lots of food, but this is the kind of place that will give you a coronary. If you like grease, this is your place. On the other hand, my SO liked his meal.
I'm struggling to come up with something good to say about this place... Oh yeah... endless fries. Unfortunately, that's about it.  Wait times are always long, service is sub-par.

I was craving chain food yesterday. It doesn't happen very often because I'll almost take some independent ethnic food over chain food...but everyone once in awhile I need a Chilis or Red Robin or something along those lines. I've been going to Red Robin off and on. The food is a 3 stars. They make me happy because they always do my burger just right as far as done-ness.  Also service has always been consistently good....waiters checking in consistently but not harassing.  I do not go here on weekends because it's absolute chaos.  But week nights are ok.  They let my friend and I stay and chat for a little over 2 hours...no pressure to leave, which I really appreciated.   Had the peppercorn burger which was a-ok. Nothing spectacular...but good.  3 stars for food, one extra star for consistent service.

3.5 stars. This is a fun place to go with a large group.  We went with my husbands family and had a great dining experience.  they have so many burgers on their menu...it's crazy and makes it hard to make a decision....they have everything you can think of.  it was a busy time when we came, but we were lucky to have a great server.  because we had to wait such a long time for our food, the server brought out extra fries with different dipping sauces to try...what a guy!  he did an excellent job bringing refills and keeping us all happy until the food was served.  by the time the food came, we were all pretty full.  the steak fries are good...very soft in the middle, garlic or regular...the ranch sauce was the favorite.  i had a chicken pesto burger on chibatta and my husband had the crazy BBQ burger....he loved it.  my chicken sandwich was good, too.  i had a cherry limeade, but felt that TGIF's is a lot better...this one is more syrupy and doesn't have the slushie-feel.  i had a slight stomachache after my meal....i have trouble digesting higher fat meals....probably all the fries.  i would definitely recommend this place for a family dinner or party - it's a fun outing!

Food is ok, prices are ok and the service is ok.  It's a chain and it's consistent but I don't get excited about going here.  My son loves the bottomless fries and being able to watch whatever game is on everywhere you look.  I usually get the burger with bleu cheese and it's alright.  The meat isn't as juicy as I'd like it and i ask for medium rare.  It's convenient but not a destination.

Seasoning Salt is magic salt that smells like BO.  For some reason I thought it would taste good, but it just made my fries funky.  Try it first, cause if you love cumin...then you gotta it made.  Kinda pricey for drinks and chicken strip plate.  I spent $15 when I could have gone to Jack In the Box and gotten the same meal for 6.99.  Ended up going late at night because I was craving chicken strips and was in the neighborhood.  You would think that late at night and slow would equal great service, right?  Wrong.  I did not get a refill and it took forever to pay my bill.  Overall, food is good, but a little too pricey.

Mmm yummy! I have been here twice and I will keep going back :) Their burgers are definitely awesome and the onion rings are PERFECT! The only disappointment is the way you order your burger: with pink or without pink... no rare, medium, well or anything in between. So far service has been excellent and parking isn't so bad considering all the other shops in the center!

Lots of empty tables, but they make you wait 15 minutes anyway.  It seems like the service has gotten a lot slower lately as well.  It took a long time to get the order in and a long time to get our food.

I'm a big fan of Red Robin's Garlic Fries. Did you know that you can order your burger with these fries for a small extra charge? Yum! Get some ranch to dip 'em.  Annette is the greatest - sit in her section and you'll always have excellent service. I go with friends, and we always seem to place our order with something extra or without something that should be there. Our orders have always been correct.

Pretty decent burgers here for a chain. They got chicken and fish if you're not into beef. All come with bottomless steak fries with seasoning.  Strawberry lemonade is good. They have TVs with sports on all over the place, which is cool if there's a game on. A bit kiddie/family-ish for me, but either way, I can't front on Double-R.
I had most delicious BBQ Burger I've ever tasted here.  The freckled lemonade was pretty good too.  I'll definitely go back for another burger.
i used to love this place till they took a corporate turn for the worse the service is terrible! and you have undercooked my burger every time since the manager change. do you not care?

This was my first visit to this particular location.  Haven't been to a RR since my Colorado days, so I didn't really remember what they served, but recalled some yummy drinks.  I recalled correctly. If I were to rate this place on service alone, Seth the bartender would  receive 5 big stars.  He really kicked ass.  He was friendly, fun and prompt.  He gave good recommendations, and when I finished my first drink (some frozen Bailey's concoction), I asked if he could make one of the non-alcoholic specialty drinks with Vodka.  "Of course!"  The raspberry-lime whatever it's called was quite yummy spiked with some Stoli. For food:  got the fired cheese sticks, which were pretty standard and well received.  Got a crispy chicken tender salad (hey, chicken sounds good every once in a while), and was not impressed.  Certainly wasn't horrible, but it was just a salad with some chicken strips cut up in it.  Nothing fancy.   Food was just average, but the service was great.

The burgers are nice and big, but messy because they are so big.  I like their fries, and always add a little seasoning from the shaker they have on all the tables.  I'm a big SALT person, bad kat, bad kat!  Their service is shabby though.  Since I work near there, I go there by myself for lunch and they usually sit me near the bar, which is where the waiter works.  I sometimes I have to go up to get refills on my drinks, which annoys me.  Hmph!

They have friendly host/hostesses and waiters/waitresses. I love the bottomless french fries. My personal favorite is the Whiskey River BBQ burger. The burger is huge and fills me up and plus I'm a big fan of bbq sauce. When i don't eat meat i order the gardenburger here. Nothing special about it, just a meatless burger. The prices aren't that bad.

I think this place is pretty overpriced.  Paying 9 bucks for a burger just doesn't seem right.  Their burgers are also super salty and I'd honestly just rather have in n out.  However, their fries are worth coming for. They are huge and potatoey and yummy.  With some of the seasoning, oooohhhh....  And they are NEVER ENDING.  You can't beat that.  I think I'd come here just to grab a couple drinks and have the fries.  Otherwise, not worth it.

I like burger places where the meat doesn't taste like it has ever been frozen, the shakes are real, the beer is cold, and yet the mood is that of a friendly family restaurant.  I enjoyed myself.  Dinner for two adults comes to about $40.  There is even a bar -- a very low key one -- for those who want to fly solo, grab a burger and a pint.  It is a good family burger joint.  But expect a 20 minute wait on weekends.

After watching the RR commercials on TV with those amazing looking burgers I finally dragged my family there. Ah, it was so/so. The burgers were soggy, the fries were cold and nothing tasted as good as it looked on the menu. Not sure I'd waste the calories there next time.
I went there on a busy Friday evening, food was great but service was just ok. Our server kept disappearing. But the good food made up for it!
