Dinner was bad enough being the only girl with a group of five guys, but to make it even worse, the restaurant was depressingly slow on a monday night and even worse was the fact that service was even slower.  Bad enough was the fact that I was subject to guy talk, but even worse was that it was dragged out an extra hour at LEAST by the fact that our food waited at the window for a half hour, plus we didn't get a server around our table for 15 minutes.  Surprisingly the fastest thing was getting the bill.  Not even 5 minutes into eating my tasteless chicken parmigiana, the waiter came by and dropped off the check.  Wow.  I mean, I know I shouldn't expect so much of a restaurant that has a red robin mascot running around and smacking people on the head (true story) but seriously, isn't it common restaurant ettiquette to get a server at your table sooner than 15 minutes after your sat and to at least be halfway finished with your entree before getting the bill?  Kids these days.

I'm not too big on the dining experience at Red Robin but I put up with the crappy service becuase of one thing, the Red Robin Royal Burger.  Who ever thought of adding a sunnyside-up egg and bacon to a cheeseburger is a genius!  I've had almost every burger at this place and none compare to the Royal.  If I'm not feeling the Royal, I go for the Wiskey River BBQ burger.  I usually pair my burger with the onion rings, and a beer.  What more can you ask for?

I normally love red robin, fond memories of going to it as a child in Oregon. This location though, is THE WORST. the service is always horrible. Once I ended up waiting even though only a quarter of the tables were occupied. One visit especially went horribly, I went out to dinner with my bff and she got a salad and I got a mushroom turkey burger. Everything was going just lovely, I bit into my burger and thought "hm I sure would like some ketchup on this" so I peeled back the bun to find an UNMISTAKABLE cockroach leg. I had to keep myself from vomiting all over the table. I showed the waiter (IT TOOK 20 MINUTES TO FLAG HIM DOWN) and he asked 'oh do you want us to cook you another burger?' wtf of course I don't want you to cook me another burger, you have cockroaches. Than he wondered off for ten minutes to tell the manager. the manager didn't even come over, and they only comped my burger (which duh they should have I didn't eat it), they didn't comp my drink or my friends meal. I whined at them for that, and told them that I was never coming back and I would spread the word of a)horrible service and b)an unsanitary enviroment. So I did. anywhere that has bugs in whatever instantly fails for me, I don't know if thats just me or what. and any place that doesn't try to entice me back, EPIC FAIL. f this place in its a.

this place has amazing spinach artichoke dip!!  it is so good!!  i like the orginal and bleu ribbon burgers here with "some pink" and the bottomless fries!  also the freckled lemonade is really refreshing and bottomless too!  the onion rings are good and the presentation is really creative.  would make for a good ice breaker if you are on a bad date.  the prices are a little high for a burger but the atmosphere is fun.  when you walk in, you will immediately see a tv on the ground.. i also love the cocktails they have here!  the tropical mai tai is so good and strong!!  you will only need one of these!!

i love red robin! the onion rings are delicious! they comew ith two sauces. ones a ranch sauce and the other one is a bbq ranch sauce! sooo yummy! i love fries and these ones hit the spot! the hamburgers are good i usually get bacon on mine! but anyways good place!

This place has some of the best burgers.  We loved it.  We've heard about it and always see the commercials so finally had a chance to check it out.  Wow, great food and not bad prices.  Look forward to going there again.
i likeda seasoning a lot.  this place turns up my cholesterol a notch and a great place to catch a case of hypertension to your heart.

It's a mixed review for me. The food is really 3 stars but it's a family friendly place so that bumps it up a notch to the 4 star rating. I would say if family friendly isn't a concern to you then better burgers could be found elsewhere. For that matter, if you cross the street you will find Johnny Rockets and in my book a better basic burger.
